Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2020

Review Text: Blink is a camera we've all heard of dozens of times so I expected it to be a good camera and it's just ok. The picture/video from the camera is almost like a fish bowl lense filter is on it, motion detection is slow and the video has at the very least a 5 second delay. I tried to use this in a window to watch the deer that come to the feeder in the back yard but it didn't catch the motion through the window or maybe it's the distance. I also had to turn off all night vision for it as it would reflect back through the window and only give you a white light of a screen when trying to view night vision. Turned on a porch light and that seemed to work enough to see at night but it didn't pick up the motion. I now use it with the free trial to keep an eye on the dogs when they are home alone and out which is rare. I usually put them in the bedroom with a baby gate up so they can still see and hear what's going on inside the house so I don't even really use the camera. I'd send it back but it's not worth the cost of gas to drive to a drop off location at this point. Maybe I'll just give it to a family member who doesn't mind the delay, the poor night vision and the poor motion detection. Idt I'd trust it as a baby monitor or even to get live updates on pets bc of the delay. The audio is also very poor. The charging cable is very long. It actually came with a charging brick as well which my phone didn't even come with now a days and it is very small and could easily be concealed if it needed to be so I'll go half way and give 3 stars. Glad I learned my lesson with the cheap mini instead of buying the outdoor set first.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2022

Review Title: Worked for 3 Cameras, but hit the wall at 4, and then EVERYTHING failed.
Review Text: We were really excited to buy the 5 pack of the Blink XT-2 cameras because we have had the XTs for a year and love using it to check on our dogs. We had saved for quite a while, and the first thing we did was add the mini to our 2 camera system, and shortly after, we went out of town. We were treated to the view of our Yorkie in the window howling!!  We were able to talk to him for the first time, and calm him down, and that was worth the price of the mini alone!But later when we started setting up the remaining cameras to watch various wildlife from our patio we found the 4th camera worked, (the first of our 5 pack of XT-2s), but when we went to add the next one we hit the wall. The camera could not connect in Live view—so I tried setting up a different one and it wouldnt work either.  Tried downgrading all the settings, the resolution, recording length, nothing worked. Our internet connection is only 45mps, but that should be sufficient for standard resolution. Nothing I read before ordering indicated that multiple cameras would require extra robust bandwidth.On reading more suggestions through the very limited support pages, I tried the suggestion to reboot the sync module, but after rebooting it wouldn’t go into set up mode—just one lone blue light. Next suggestion, try hard a reset of the sync module. It still wouldn’t go into set-up mode. I also tried a bunch of other things suggested, including removing and reinstalling the cameras, then removing the whole system and setting up the system on the newer sync module, which was an extra at this point. I could never get either sync module to go into the set-up mode again, and couldnt connect any cameras to it otherwise. I can’t believe I have two defective sync modules, but darned if I know how to reset everything, nor do I know if it would help with adding my additional cameras.After eagerly looking forward to expanding our system, we are so disappointed. I still am not sure I can even get my original system back up and working any longer now, since even my original sync module is stuck. But I am returning it today, because its my last day to do so. Very disappointed.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020

Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   the camera works amazing, BUT, it is not in any way secure. i work with tech, and typically i actually wouldn’t use a cheap camera like this (i received it for $5 with my echo show but it still is cheap regularly nonetheless). i got two since they sent the first with a missing part (the usb wall plug), and i used one to monitor the driveway from my bedroom window in case my cat got out and the other for my bedroom as my cat has seizures.i went on a vacation to meet my brother and the bedroom camera kept crashing, at this point i was not aware of any breaches though nor do i know now if the crashing was from the breach, and i was unable to watch my cat and make sure she was alright when i was on the other side of the state.when i came home a couple of days later i unarmed the camera so motion activation would no longer be on, but i still didn’t take it down because only a couple days had passed since i had returned. i was working on a iphone at my desk to repair, then i look in the corner of my eye and notice that my camera’s LED light was on (the one that shows someone is actively viewing the live feed). i immediately unplugged it then went into the app and checked the driveway camera in my room that hears sounds from my room and tried to view it and it said that it was already being viewed and that i could not view it. immediately unplugged that one too. i would only use these in emergency to plug in then  plug out if you absolutely need to. they do have good night vision and record good motion activated videos. but they do also make you pay for cloud.i reccomend a wansview. i had one a year or more ago. whenever someone outside tries to access your camera you get notified and there is a log. you can also insert an SD card into them and review past footage, and it records offline. i got a small one about the size of this back then and it was black and i believe it was around $35
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2021

Review Text: I think this is a great addition to my outdoor camera. I don't have the need for extremely high definition video quality, I just like knowing the basics of what is going on around my house. That being said, the picture quality could definitely be improved. If this video captured someone in my home and I had to submit it to authorities to hunt the person down, it would probably be one of those videos where you swear the person looks like someone you know, but you just can't be sure. LOL. But I can definitely see which one of my kids leaves the milk on the counter overnight, sneaks downstairs at 1:00am during quarantine and drinks the last of the My Dew.The camera (outdoor XT2 as well) has very bad audio unfortunately. Sounds as if a quiet motor is running constantly in every clip. The outdoor one was so bad that I had a neighbor stop over my house to check my pool because I thought maybe something was wrong with the pump/motor. I've learned to deal with the noise and just disregard it. I did want to point out that it is an issue for sure but for the price, can't really complain. As for adding this to your current system, you are essentially grandfathered in to free cloud storage. It's important to know this as it is a major selling point for lots of people. Other reviewers complained about this but the free cloud storage was confirmed to me by email from Blink. I can't speak for new customers, but current folks just adding a new camera, there won't be any charge. Camera sets up super easy. There is plenty of wiring to reach your electrical socket. All in all, I'd recommend it to a friend.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020

Review Title: Nice camera, power adapter sticks out too far
Review Text: This thing works great. But so did the other battery powered versions and you could place them literally anywhere.  Picture is great. Setup is super easy. Don’t care so much about the 2way talk since I only use it to watch the cat, but it’s a nice feature when I wanna scream at the cat remotely.What’s not so great and where it looses a star is the power adapter. This camera uses a mini-USB to to full-size USB cord that plugs into a 5V wall adapter outlet plug. Problem is that adapter is long and sticks out quite far from the wall and the USB port is right on the end of it. So when you plug in the cord which also has the end on it which sticks out also, together it stIcks out 3-4 inches from the wall.Given where you’ll likely put this, near an outlet around furniture or shelves where you’ll want to route and hide the cord and plug behind stuff or furniture, it seems a poor design. The plug adapter should have been made flatter and the USB port mounted on the side. That way at least you can push the furniture up against the plug and cord snugly without worry of damaging the cord. As it is the furniture I have against it sticks out quite far.Your only work around here is a power strip with a flat wall plug and just plug into that.I realize there are trade offs with design and others might find a flatter side ported adapter irritating since it might crowd adjacent plugs on a power strip. But powers strips have way more placement flexibility than a wall socket does.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020

Review Title: An Okay Set-up, Handy and inexpensive.
Review Text: So one of the things that Blink does really well is make it easy to set-up everything. I mean it's an app, you follow along, and they're online and just working. The battery thing is convenient but in the house, there are plugs everywhere which is really convenient for something that likes to send you pictures and notices but also warns you when it's too active about batteries. I mean that's the real benefit right, constant power here for those of us who are not as handy with wiring battery ones to a power supply.The minis struggle a bit more with night vision, and I think the reason why is there's just more stuff close up to an internal camera than what I have with my external ones. For instance, one has access or view of a window. Every night it "detects" motion or something and shift t night vision. There is nothing there. There is never anything there so I assume it's just the shifting of the light when the sun goes down.  The other one has a hard time of getting a clear enough picture of the door with a chain, even though it's not that far. I think it's because that camera is trying to focus on the table instead of the entryway it's "guarding". I've tried to shift things a bit with only minor success.Aside from those focusing issues, the only other problem is I just want to turn cameras on and off or schedule them. When they're in the house and people are here... no need to have it notifying all the time. Also the app is too slow. In theory you can get a motion detection and then just go live and speak to them... well if takes 20 seconds for the dang app to load the person has gotten board and left already. It sounds short, it's a long time to just stand there. I use an s10. I know it's not the most fancy phone now, but I don't really experience much issues with other apps.I have yet to find the Blink talk to the person feature to be useful due to how long it takes to get the notification, load the app and finally have it ready to talk. People don't stand there that long. And with the rest of blink, if your internet goes down... it just doesn't work. It seems like we need something to accommodate for when the internet goes down but the intranet is still up.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020

Review Text: 10/10 starts for this product.Set up: 2 cameras took less than 10 minutes to get online and going, including downloading the app.Day detection: great! Picture is awesome!Night vision: very good for these little tiny cameras.Motion sense - does a great job with recording, so far has caught everything we have thrown at it.Downsides: I have fat fingers and accidently deleted all my clips stored. I have terrible neighbors (one parties all the time and the other is a drunk who recently tried to break into my apartment- hence the security cameras) so I was trying to save the video clips of the things that go on here. There is a way to save the video clips to your phone and I know how to do this now, so thats what I do.overall the downside is just my fault, not the apps fault. Easy to overcome. Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2020

Review Title: Mediocre night vision and motion detection
Review Text: I've got 3 of these throughout the house to monitor my pets when I'm out during the day and when traveling and am using a dog sitter.  The day performance is acceptable, but at night, the picture quality is fairly poor.  The built in IR light will reflect off whatever surface you place the camera, and reflects back into the lense causing a ghosting effect.  I've had to push the cameras right up to the very edge of the shelf to eliminate this reflection issue.At night, the motion detection is poor unless its mainly in front of the camera.  It does not reliably pick up motion off to the sides if more than 5 or 6 feet away.The provided power cord is also fairly short, so figure out where you're going to locate the cameras, and measure to see how far it is to the closest outlet.  Longer USB cables are available, or you can use an extension cord as necessary... but Amazon could have provided an extra few feet on the cord and it would have saved me a lot of hassle.The audio pickup is ok when you're listening on a phone, but when trying to talk to someone on the camera end, the volume is a bit low unless in a quiet room.In the end, these camera's work, and I've not had any reliability issues.  The Amazon Blink service is extremely reliable and I've not had any cameras drop offline.  IMHO, If you buy these when there's a good sale, they are "ok", but I wouldn't pay full price for them.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2022

Review Text: I have mixed feelings on this camera setup. I obviously didn't have super high expectations because of the price but needed something within my budget to keep my family and my home safe.Pros:Budget friendly, ease of use, picture quality, settings.I do think the cameras are easy to use and I really like the quality of the pictures during daylight and that you can zoom in on them. I also enjoy the set alarm feature where I can activate the cameras automatically for times I am routinely not home. It's really nice to have that option so I'm not forgetting to activate the cameras every time I leave.Cons:Camera not activating upon activity, clip lengths, cord concerns, subscription plan.I do not like the fact that on multiple occasions during "dark mode" my camera has not picked up activity until it after a minute or two, which is way too long when you have someone breaking into your home at 1 am. I had someone come into my home at 1:08 am and even coughed loudly but my camera did not active until 1:10.I really wish the clip lengths were longer and or no downtime in between clips during activity. I understand there is a live view feature but that's not helpful if you are unable to click on that in the app during such events as stated above.I also had someone use one of my camera cords as a phone charger and it has not worked to charge my camera since. I don't know if that was intentional of the person using it but I have purchased a replacement cord and will update if it works when I receive the cord. With that being said, what will happen if someone doesn't have a subscription plan and tries to view occurances on USB? Is that going to ruin their cord?I really wish we only had to pay for clips we keep. I really enjoy the updates I get when I'm not home but if I don't need to keep the clips than I delete them. I feel it's expensive for multiple camera subscription plan to be able to see what's going on while it's happening.Ultimately, If you need something on a budget this is a great option for you. Just know that it's not the best.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2022

Review Text: I was in the CCTV/Security industry for several years.This product works as a basic network camera with some security features, BUT This is NOT a CCTV replacement product !Main Differences:1. This product does NOT support real-time multi-view of multiple cameras. NO "continuous" multi-channel (and single channel) videos. ONLY on-demand single-channel view with time limitation. You can only see one channel at any given time and need to hit "continue" to keep on viewing live video after certain time.2. It does NOT support any alternative viewing options by using conventional security camera viewing protocols (such as DVRs or direct viewing via web interface or internal/external IP address links). You can only use the manufacture's app with VERY LIMITED customization and functionality.3. IF you trust the manufacture, it MIGHT be more secure by going through their platforms/servers (assuming encrypted) to view your private videos. Traditional CCTV system does not go through 3rd party system other than the ISP (therefore you need to consider security by yourself by setting up firewalls or using advanced routing techniques).Conclusion:If you are looking for a traditional CCTV/Security Camera functionalities/experiences, go for REAL CCTV systems/IP cameras. They are also available on Amazon. The learning curve will be more steep and it is more challenging to setup, but it will be well worth it if you find a good system.If you only would like to have a simple and trouble-free setting up experience, and  are willing to sacrifice some powerful features a true network/IP camera system can offer, you can consider this kind of cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021

Review Title: Thus far overall not bad considering the price.
Review Text: Not bad for the price - but it could be done even better with probably little effort if the vendor would implement it.The (daylight) picture is pretty good for an inexpensive camera like this. I bought this for use with my Show for remote viewing and monitoring. Some people complained about the Blink app Life View time restriction of 30 seconds on the app and you have to frequently press a button to continue or the viewing will time out. True, but on the Blink skill on the show you don't have to do that - works for me and if you primarily use the Show and the app as on-the-road stop-gap, it is pretty good i.e. considering the small pricepoint.I also bought a Blink Outdoor camera kit, primarily for getting the Sync Module which I appearently can't purchase separately. Being able to record locally sounds pretty awesome, but I haven't set that up yet. For me that is the killer feature of the Blink line.Now the "bad": Night vision: It seems to me that like in any other camera at this price point (including 2-3 times it's price), it is not really night vision. It is probably more IR sensitive than daylight, but/and the camera has an IR light build in, so it lights up the environment for the camera to see. The problem now is that if you place this camera at a window and point it outside - the IR light reflects at the window and blinds the camera. Now you can't see anything other than a bright light. (the Ring Doorbells do that as well - if you mount them behind a storm door and if you put the glass in when it get's colder - you can't see anything anymore at night for the same reason - many people complained about that). Now, this could get helped if the manufacturer would allow a way to disable that light - if I had to, I could use an external IR light, that would be perfectly satisfactory for me. But it appears right now one can't do that. Also attempting to masking/tape-off the diode where unsuccessful - too much light reflects on my tapes and bleeds through the acrylic cover and I am thinking about opening the case and cut the wire to the diode, I will let you know. So please Mr. & Mrs. Manufacturer please allow for soft disabling the IR illumination feature. Dip switch would be fine as well.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020

Review Title: Awful customer service...  its always your equipment and not theirs...
Review Text: I bought one of these cameras thinking I'm going to try them out first and see what all the fuss was about.  I connected the camera with not much trouble and the camera ran for a solid 7 months without problems... until one fateful day, it just quit.  I tried for several days scouring the internet for information as I'm in IT trying to figure out how to get it to troubleshoot.  I reset that camera more times than I care to count to see.  Even went as far as getting a different router hooked up to see if it was the router, same result.  I finally get them on email support, every three to four days I got a response to my request.  After sending them data after data I decided to call only to start the troubleshooting process all over again.  Finally, after almost 2 hours on the phone, they finally sent me a camera replacement.  When I received it, in less than 5 minutes I had the camera running.  Now here I am, less than two months later and the camera that has been working fine just quit out of the blue and refuses to connect as well.  I'm with support on the phone and of course, as expected, it's everything else but their equipment.  Keep in mind I just set up a competitor's camera before calling them and that camera works...  I call them and what do they say "no it's your router and equipment" though I have other devices and a competitors camera, 6 of them and they all work just fine...

Review Title: Could be adequate in some cases
Review Text: Hardware wise: the Blink camera is certainly adequate. The picture and audio quality is decent, especially for the price, and if judging solely by that my rating would probably be 4 stars.Software wise: The Blink security monitoring app might be okay if you live alone or otherwise going to be the only person monitoring the system. Even then, there's the annoyance of the live feed asking you every 30 seconds if you want to continue. I imagine this was leftover from the models that run off of batteries, but there should be an option in the settings to allow for continuous non-interrupted viewing.If however, you have a spouse/significant other and/or kids (or whoever) that also need access that is where this system falls apart. You are expected to have everyone sign in to the same Blink account, with same username and password, with everyone having complete control of the system. Also, (from what I understand) if someone is monitoring the live feed then everyone else is locked out. Even if it's just a spouse and you don't mind using the same account, then whenever the secondary person signs in, it will send the 2 factor authorization code to the primary account holder's phone. So you as primary will have to send the code to them every time they log on.I unfortunately did not know any of this when I got the Blink camera. From my research, these same issues have been directed toward Blink in the discussion boards but nothing has ever been fixed. It is assumed that this is done purposely so that it will motivate you to pay more for the Ring system instead.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021

Review Text: I was looking for a wired camera to view anyone coming to my front door; watching numerous video reviews on several brands. I gave up my search when all the reviews of Blink and another favorable brand, stated that the motion detector and night vision wouldn’t work through glass. I didn’t want to put the camera outside the window because I’m on the first floor and it could be tampered with. Then Black Friday came around and there was an unbeatable price of $49 was offered for the echo 5 and Blink mini bundle. I placed the camera in the window and to my surprise the camera not only detects motion at more than 50ft from my door, but it’s night vision is impeccable. DEFINITELY A GREAT BUY ... LOVE IT.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2020

Review Title: Nice Camera. Security ? Not at all.
Review Text: This is a really nice camera, for the price.Really easy setup, simple application. But it needs you to create an account with blink.Calling it a security camera is inaccurate. The camera REQUIRES constant internet communication, so if for any reason your internet goes down (local issue, isp issue, blink servers, etc) it wont work.In the future a Sync Module will be released that will allow the cameras to store video locally. That will make easier to keep footage and to not pay for cloud servers to store that (if you value your privacy). But then again, it WILL NEED internet in order to work, so if for any reason your internet fails, the system wont work.If you need a camera as a security measure (or if you value your privacy), buy something that will work offline.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020

Review Title: Seems great at first, but it gets really annoying over time
Review Text: The installation process seemed smooth, and the initial impression was great. However, it slowly turned out to be a mess.I've been using the cameras (3 minis, on top of 4 XT2). XT2 aren't ideal too, but at least I can forgive them since they are battery-powered and require some limitations. I don't see a reason for all the problems below for Minis though.The worst part is reliability: random "System is busy", "Camera is offline", show up in the worst moments. It seems that I can make it crash almost every time if I use live view for longer than a minute or two. This camera has two main features, Live view and motion detection - how can you screw up your primary feature that badly?Other stuff:- it randomly records videos from live view, even though I have the "discard" setting selected, and never even tried to save live views.- motion detection is sub-par, sometimes it will catch a fly, the other time it won't catch my daughter struggling to get to the toilet for over 10 seconds.- recording has a delay, so often the motion is not caught on the camera, as well as it cuts out after a certain time. I understand the limitations for a camera like XT2 which is powered by batteries, but why have the same limitations on mini? It's wired after all. Record it the moment you detect the movement (ok, give it a second or two to ignore a fly or similar thing), and record as long as the motion is detected or the disk is filled up - easy.- if you sent me a notification about movement, why do you send another 30 seconds later? Like, I already know something was moving, I will switch to live view or watch the recordings! Make a reasonable break between notifications, like 5 minutes (or make it configurable).- it makes a clicky noise every time I switch to live view - why?I gave it 2 stars because it has potential: the form factor is good, installation is nice, and when it works, it's kinda ok. But If the above issues persist, I will have to switch.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020

Review Text: This was the third blink I attempted. In the time I wasted to try to make this work I could’ve bought a better quality camera that actually works.Two major issues: picture quality and connection.Unless you’re very close, forget trying to make out a figure in the picture. Think cell phone camera quality from 15 years ago.As for connection, we all use this cameras for the sole purpose of when we’re not around. The camera would constantly deactivate and disconnect from wifi. The first camera I got I actually contacted my internet provider to upgrade my services, but even after that the camera would still drop and not reconnect.I got this for use in a small office space during night time and every morning I came back it it would be offline. It is actually supposed to tell me when it’s offline, which it didn’t. But no way of resetting it without being physically there and more than likely to reset the wifi too.I’ve spoken to their customer service multiple times, kind and knowledgeable but still they seemed frustrated because they knew this camera doesn’t have the capabilities it should have.I missed the cutoff to return this last one, probably because I’m tired of dealing with crap electronics.Buy this if you want to constantly tend to it, make sure it’s working properly and okay if it drops off when you need it the most.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2021

Review Text: So far so good. My only complaints are there is a several second delay between a motion triggered event and the phone notification. The "live" feed is also several seconds behind. We got this camera because we live in an apartment building and someone has been stealing packages that amazon puts inside. Several seconds would be long enough for someone to come in and grab stuff on the first floor and leave before I could stop them. Just tested with my neighbor who came in. Front door was shut ans she made it galf way up the stairs before the motion event triggered and showed her coming in on the feed.My other complaint is that despite having night mode and being in a backlit hallway, the camera stops detecting motion after about 9pm. We still have people coming in and out all night. I have tried manually setting it to night mode to see if that would help. I have tried upping the sensitivity all the way. For whatever reason, it doesn't like the hallway where it's placed unless light is coming in from outside. And as you can see from the photos, there should be enough light to at least catch movement. This is the last one that it caught during the night when one of the neighbors came in. Lots of us are up early and it hasn't caught any of our movement from this morning. The neighbors are happy the camera is there now though. Gives us some peace of mind.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2022

Review Title: Hope the add notification sound soon!
Review Text: It was a bit hard to setup.  Had to reboot wifi first and then recycled the power source of the camera in order for the app to find the camera.  It has an “Armed” mode that auto records when motion is detected and send you notification. Review Title: I have mixed feelings about this...the camera is a 5, the app is a 1
Review Text: The camera has really good picture quality, and the motion detection is better than I've seen on other camera.  You can block out sections of the room and only watch for motion exactly where you need to.About the app, I am very disappointed in it.  Not only is it difficult to use because it is not well organized, but there is no way to share the app with someone else.  I am using this for my elderly mother, who has 24 hour caregivers.  I just wanted the person that is working at the time to be able to leave the room when my mother is in bed, and get a notification if she starts moving or gets out of bed.  I put the app on one of the caregivers phones, then logged her in using my account (since there no way to share).  Then I turned the notifications off on my phone, because I didn't want to receive notifications when someone else was with my mother.  When I made that change on my phone, it made the same change on the caregiver's phone - it turned off notifications.The only solution was to put the app on an old smart phone and leave that phone at my mother's house.  It solved the issues, but there still is no way that I  can turn off my phone, then turn it back on if I need to watch her.  I have to uninstall the app on my phone so I don't receive notifications all the time.  They really need to fix this.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020

Review Title: Great cameras for the price.  Lacking important capabilities.
Review Text: THE GOOD:Let me start by saying these are great little cameras for the price!  I was very happy with how easy setup was.  I bought 4 wired indoor cameras & 2 outdoor wireless cameras.  After the first camera setup,  which took about 20 minutes (my lack of experience),  the next 5 took about 10 minutes each (the better part of that time was the connection process to the network).  The video and audio quality far exceeded my expectations! The motion detection is good,  but not consistent. The night-vision is better than expected.  The zoom feature is the same as taking a picture on your phone & zooming in.  You are limited to the extent of the picture and it becomes grainy. The audio is very clear and decent range.  The talk feature is also clear and decent range. These little cameras def impress and offer a very affordable option,  allbeit a limited capabilities option.THE NOT SO GOOD:I am disappointed in the fact that other than a cloud subscription,  I am only able to view or save my videos for up to 60 days.  The two outdoor cameras can also be saved to a separately purchased usb drive that plugs into the module.  Beyond those options,  I have no way to view or save my videos from my indoor/outdoor cameras.  I am also disappointed that the app only let's you view live view for 30 seconds at  a time & not a continuous stream.  Also disappointing is that the app only let's you view streams one at a time,  rather than having a multi-panel view.  Unfortunately,  these issues are big shortcomings  in what I feel are important and fundamental functions & purpose of any camera system.Although these issues are big disappointments to me,  I am still happy with the overall capabilities and functions of these cameras at this price point.  Had I paid more than I did (thanks to Prime Days,  I got the whole lot,  6 cameras,  for about $160), I would have returned them,  due to their limited capabilities.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2021

Review Text: I'm at a loss. We've had two different "pet" cameras for a similar cost, and while they've had their issues leading to me looking else where after a bit of use, Blink is just as bad in its own way.This one was for indoor use, and doorbell was for outdoor (less about the doorbell, more about finally having a camera that works at night) plus needing the sync module that came with it. I didn't want to get trapped in their subscription so I cancelled the trial immediately to know what it would look like with the sync module and local storage. It's kind of weird that it's a USB when, again, cheaper pet cameras have better SD card options but I'll take what I can get here to try. Plenty of people have covered how it's a ploy to get you to have their subscription that you can't record live view (ie, you get a notification about motion, watch it, someone's breaking into your house, but because you're watching it live it doesn't save) but I didn't get my cameras for notifications. We have too much street traffic for motion detection to matter.That being said, I do WANT motion detection. But the doorbell doesn't do this consistently for humans in the least, and the Mini won't stay connected to the internet long enough to watch even me walk inside. All the cars when I had the doorbell out front? Totally. The raccoon that walked two feet in front of it? Super delayed on when it started to record, but sure. When I walk in my own drive way? Nah. I have to be moving the camera to be recorded. I drove ALL THE WAY up my driveway (it's long) and it didn't start recording until my car was halfway in the garage. I get that some of the issue may have to do with "battery saving", but I feel like I'm asking for the bare minimum when it comes to proper recordings.The Wi-Fi connection also almost makes no sense to me, specifically for the Mini. The doorbell has worked on the front door, and on the garage which again is looong and quite a ways from the house. But the Mini? Works in one place in the house. And not even at the halfway point of what the doorbell works with. Even the cheapo pet cameras I mentioned had better Wi-fi connectivity in ALL the positions I tried in the house.I think the Mini probably has a chance of recording more consistently than the Doorbell, but the Doorbell is the one that stays connected to the Wi-fi. Like I'm considering using the doorbell inside when we go places (I literally haven't bothered mounting it with how much inconsistency there's been). But I really finally wanted something for outside, too.I'm tired. I'm not even someone totally needing this for feeling like our house is safe and yet it IS supposed to be a security system. For me it's more to keep an eye on neighbors who keep using our yard for stuff but I would really, really love something that works for peace of mind for the unknown, too. I just don't think that with all our technology, it exists for a reasonable cost.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022

Review Title: Very good for the price -  a few caveats
Review Text: This camera will function well for me.  I do like the cloud service, but I don't think I will continue with it after the trial period is up.  I don't have high expectations for this camera, so keep in mind my ratings are me specific.  If you have higher expectations do more research to ensure these will work as you need.  I just wanted a cheap way to ensure if someone lurks around/breaks in, I have a chance at catching an image of who they are.A few things to think about:1. You must have working Wi-Fi with an Internet connection.  This sounds stupid, but my modem went out the other day, so I still had a working Wi-Fi network, but that is not good enough.  While my Hue lights still worked without working Internet, my Blink cameras did not.If you want hard core security cameras, these aren't going to be your best option. Someone could very easily kill your cameras without even having to go inside your house/business.2. While I haven't tried it yet, I believe your recordings go to the Blink servers even when you don't have a subscription.  They mention you can backup the clips set off by movement, but given it "backs those clips up once daily by default" to the thumb drive attached to the Sync Module 2, it must be temporarily storing those clips on their server (which is why you would need the Internet - See point 1 above).  So if it bothers you that Amazon will still have access to those clips, you may want to investigate other options.3.  Think about how where to install the cameras.  It actually does better when someone/something moves across the field of vision as per their instructions.  They are correct.  What I mean by this is imagine you are looking at a device screen.  It works best if the image moves across the screen from left to right or right to left.  Coming straight at the camera doesn't set it off as quickly as I would expect.  While the camera I have can see the sidewalk out by the street, I was practically at the door before it started recording.  So you have to think about how to get the motion detection to get the camera to start recording while at the same time having a good angle to get a good picture of a person's face.  -- I haven't tried to see if there are some sensitivity options to try to get the camera to go off sooner.4. They need to provide a longer cord.  I was going to install it to the ceiling to get the "right" angle to cover two doors close to one another.  Even if I went straight from the outlet to the ceiling, the cord isn't long enough to then mount to the ceiling.  Trying to get it to move into the corner was impossible.Again, I am going for low cost security.  I really just wanted to make sure no one is coming up to the door when we aren't around.  If I had great security concerns, I would keep exploring other options.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2021

Review Text: I was under the impression I would be able to do a continuous viewing without having to press a button every 30 seconds. I want to be able to monitor my mother (who has Alzheimer’s) during the times of day when she is most active and more prone to falling but you have to keep hitting a “continue” button to keep the live feed going.  I was also unaware that there was a subscription, a paid subscription, after the trial. I don’t want to keep all of the videos necessarily but I would like to be able to save an occasional video to my phone or locally rather than in a cloud.  Mom says the darndest things sometimes and those would be videos that I would want to share with the family and have indefinitely.  The video quality is quite good as is the audio quality. And it was very easy to set it up. I was able to share the app with my daughter so she can also monitor her Nana even though she is in another state.  My daughter cried for joy knowing she could look in on Nana from time to time. So that’s wonderful! The notifications for the motion detector don’t always come through so one night my mom was yelling for me to come and help her and I got no notification that she was moving about and had no idea she had gotten herself up and was in the bathroom.  I purchase this security camera so that I would be secure in the knowledge that I would be notified when motion was detected in her room and that did not happen so I was quite disappointed with that.  So, yes, there is room for improvement.  I do hope there are some changes before the trial period is over or I am afraid I will have to find another solution to being able to monitor my mothers shenanigans.

Review Title: Only works when you have cell reception
Review Text: Don’t waste your money on this. Garbage and I’m returning it.Bottom line, if someone knows you’re going to be away from your home and say, in airplane mode on a long flight, they can come into your home during that time and you’d be none the wiser because the Blink app will not record and store their movement while your cell phone is off line - and, won’t alert you when you’re back online/out of airplane mode. See below for more details.Wife and I bought it to secure our house while away on a hiking trip. We armed the camera when we left for our trip and pointed it directly at our door where all family/visitors always enter. Before leaving for our trip we did a few test runs with the camera in “armed” mode. It picked up our motion and recorded our movements each time without missing a beat.Fast forward, we leave for our trip out west with the camera armed. We were hiking in remote areas with no cell reception. When we returned into cell range, there were no alerts that any motion had been detected nor that anyone had been in our home. Wife then gets a text from her in laws that they’re at our house and have been there for a few hours. I check the Blink app and it says our camera is armed, yet no alerts re anyone entering our home - and, no videos of them entering our home. Then, about 5 mins after being in cell range the alerts on my Blink app start blowing up, but it’s all from current movement in my home not past movements when my family first came over and came through the door at which the camera is pointed.What good is a security camera when you have to have cell reception for it to actually record and send you alerts?! It should record and store even when you’re not in cell range and then save the videos and alert you when you come back in range. It doesn’t do that. Even the Canary (which we used to have and was marginal at best) would record videos and keep them stored and immediately alert you once you’re back in range that someone had been in your home.Again, don’t waste your money. Get a real alarm system from a legit company if you want something that works like it should and spend the $$$. These low cost internet security camera options don’t work like they should, including this one…
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2021

While Bezos did a good thing he has veered into a lane that's very scary and terrifying for normal people such as myself and I suggest you do not buy this device based on their non-existent reviews and description of the product if you do not submit and pay their draconian totalitarianism of paying a fee for hardware based on you having to pay for basic functionality.. functionality that is engineered to make money versus a good product which pains me because it is a good piece of hardware.. yet the software and overall intent is evil.. Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2022

Review Title: I guess you get what you pay for..
Review Text: I bought a new home recently and wanted to get something so that i could keep an eye on the house when I was away. A friend had told me about this blink mini camera and i decided to give it a shot. 10 days into it, I'm really not all that impressed.The good:Blink offers a free 30 day trial upon activating your camera, which is plenty time to use and figure out the features of the camera.  -The camera quality is actually pretty decent its nothing crazy but for $30 i expected it to be worse.  -Camera itself is really easy to set up. Plug it in, follow the on screen prompts and you're good to go.The bad:The only thing that really seems to work with this thing is live view and that's about it. This thing hardly ever detects motion in my home regardless of where i place the camera or how good the WiFi signal is, because of this it never records anything. I've had friends and family come over when I'm not home and i never get any notifications of it. Makes this camera useless for what I'd need it for.The night vision on this camera isn't that great, even adjusting the settings, faces are too bright. Should someone break in, you wouldn't really be able to make out any distinctions at all. Not to mention, when the camera switches to NV, it makes a very loud clicking noise which kind of defeats the propose of having an out of sight camera to catch intruders.When it does detect motion and record, there's nothing on the recording. Ive tried adjusting the sensitivity and playing around with the settings to no avail. This camera is just to inconsistent to be taken seriously.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2022

Review Text: As you can see in the photos, some of my canvasses in my art studio were moved from the doorway area to RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE CAMERA... BY SOMEONE THAT WASN’T ME AND I DID NOT GET A MOTION ALERT WHEN THIS HAPPENED.I purchased this camera for my university art studio and although the “armed alerts” worked occasionally when I WAS IN THE STUDIO WITH MY PHONE (where I get the alerts), the camera failed to work when someone else came in and moved some of my supplies around (see photos). The “armed” option was selected as well as the “motion alert” (little man running icon on the top right of the app), but nonetheless I did not get a notification while all this motion of moving my very large and heavy canvasses was happening. You can see damage on some of the canvas’ edging where it’s torn from the framing from whoever came in and moved these. Honestly SO frustrating that the blink camera didn’t get this recorded so I could notify my university department. Completely defeats the purpose of having a camera in a space you have personal or valuable items in.Don’t waste your money on this unreliable blink camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2021

Review Title: Great for the price, but the restricted clip length is irritating to say the least...
Review Text: For the price this thing is pretty awesome. The picture quality is good. Motion detection works well and has adjustable zones and sensitivity. The night vision works great as well.My only complaint is the restricted clip length... I am currently on the free trial of the unlimited plan which I plan on purchasing. It includes unlimited cloud storage and saves the clips for 60 days.If the storage is unlimited, why is my clip length restricted to 30 seconds?! Why can't it just record until the detected motion stops? I have the reset time set as low as it goes but that is not helpful at all, as 10 seconds is more than enough time to miss something important happening.I googled and the clip length is apparently tied to the device, max for this unit being 30 seconds and 60 seconds for the larger models. I would gladly use my own storage space or clear out unneeded clips if there were no restriction on length. Crime and theft do not only happen in 30/60 second intervals, and they definitely do not take time to pause for 10 seconds to wait for this thing to reset and start recording again.I am happy with every other aspect of this purchase, but the 30 second clip restriction and 10 second reset time are ridiculous. I am keeping the camera, but I really hope this changes.If not for this fairly major annoyance I would have given 5 stars.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2021

Review Title: OK daytime camera, 2nd morning, no detection
Review Text: I continue to be amazed at how bad this product really is. My friend bought one on sale. I warned her she should return it but it's just $20 so small loss. Amazing bad ui. Get a motion alert (many moths, etc) tap it a few hours later and it brings you to locked live view. Useless. Have to close the app, find it and Launch it to see the non events. Wyze on the other hand let's you get alerts only for people, if that's what you choose. Wyze will be pretty bad without service so plan on 15 to 20/yr per camera, but way less than blink for up to 5 cameras and their AI is actually good. Week 4. After spending hours corresponding with tech support and trying all kinds of stupid steps because their device simply doesn't work, I ordered a Wyze V3 to test it out. Set it up so it sees the same area. Turned off night mode so it uses its high gain color sensor and wow. What a difference. I'm not sure everything works correctly, but even if it doesn't, what does is better than this junk.Based on all camera reviews, I purchased $3 2 year warranty just in case.Camera quality - wyze, sound and speaker - blink, notification actual - wyze, notification sound - blink (probably setting for wyze), night camera - definitely wyze. Cost / yr for service - wyze @15 per vs blink at 36 per or 120 for bunch. Onboard recording - wyze.No service option. Neither. It seems like with both while the camera works without annual service, with blink you need sync module which probably also has technical problems since they seem incompetent, and with wyze, they clearly disclose many limitations on alerts, recording options, review options, etc. For the effort 1.50 to $2 / mo will be worth having full feature set.Region marking for detection wyze. Mounting and pointing - blink. I'll have to buy better mount for wyze to put it in a good location. Probably would have with blink to.Return - BLINK IS HORRIBLE. Wyze, I don't know and hope not to. With blink, because the product didn't work so I was returning it as defective, my choices were print a label. My printer stopped working. Or stay home from work to hand the $20 junk to ups. Amazon rep had difficulty with the detail, but when I typed in all caps that no one would be home for ups, is this OK? He went away for 5 min and just gave me my money back. OK, but I really would rather return it. Of course what's the point. It doesn't work, but it probably works as well as any other new part of this item because the problems are firmware/software.Night Vision horrible compared to Wyze V3, motion detection good when it works but non existent on transition from night to day. Picture quality OK but nowhere near wyze V3 quality.Week one.. We'll this is a bust. Tech support says. Check the early notification box. Nitwit. Is not that I don't get an early notification, it's that I get no notification, recording, etc.Basically, the camera ceases to function until I access it with the app. Seems to only happen overnight. I'll bet it has something to do with night to day transition or update check, but it's basically worthless without a Reliable detection function.Also getting late night recordings where the first 5 seconds have audio but no video. I suspect it's a prerecord feature where the light is not on until motion is detected. I like that it prerecords.Day3: tested yesterday evening and night before bed, picked up motion no problem. Walked out front door this am and nothing again. Gave it a minute. Checked app, test again nothing. Live view, lock phone, test and it picks up.Seems like you have to live view to reset which is DEFINITELY not acceptable.Day2;I have it set up so it catches my front door. Worked great first day, second morning I walked past 3 times and it occurred to me I didn't get notified. Checked, everything correct. Searched problem, apparently app is still crap. Returning defective. Not worth the $20 sale price if it doesn't detect. Was about to invest in a bunch of outdoor, but I'll go with a different brand for sure. I'll give it a week, but definitely not ordering all the other products today as I had planned.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2021

Review Text: Since these Blink Cameras were on sale for the Christmas season, I decided to take a chance and pick a few up.  I am very happy with them.  The image quality and resolution are very good including the night vision.  Motion detection works well and I have not had any wireless network connection issues.  Setting them up was fairly simple although one camera gave me some grief and i had to have my phone connect directly to the camera to get it to connect to the wifi network.  The app was somewhat helpful in guiding me through that.  The only improvement I would want is that the maximum video clip recording time is only 30 seconds and I wish it could be up to 90 seconds.  (That might be possible with the paid subscription but I haven't checked yet.  Right now I'm using the free version for storage.)  Overall, I feel these are a great and reliable value for the money.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2021

Review Title: It is NOT a security camera !
Review Text: 1- Motion Detection:Forget about night vision; objects (human/etc) have to move too close (2-5 ft) to the camera, then MAYBE a motion detection alert gets triggered! It turned out that the motion detection capability is totally unreliable in darkness. It is better in daylight, however, it still suffers from detection objects that are small (or far in the frame).2- Image and Sound Quality:Push-to-talk option works nice with minimal delay. Camera speaker plays human voice with an acceptable quality. The other direction, however, doesn't seem pleasant. Camera's microphone grabs all background noises (cars/refrigerator/machines/etc), amplifies them and delivers all horrible noises when you are watching the live view on your phone app. If someone is speaking next to the camera, then, you might have issues hearing them. Image quality would be fine if you don't expect you project the app screen on a 40" display!App and subscription:App is user friendly. One-time perspective setup and all is set! Your cameras are all accessible on the home menu and live view is available with 1sec delay. The app can notify you when a camera is disconnected or motions is detected. Auto-record or record-playback features will be disables as soon as your free subscription trial is over. You must pay yearly/monthly if you want more than in-demand live-stream.ALL IN ALL, this does not fulfill a security camera requirements. The camera will probably miss a lot of scenes you would wish to capture! Despite the nice features, it could be considered a remote camera system that can visualize what is going on whenever you need.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2021

Review Title: I wasted my money on a Blink camera system
Review Text: Over the course of five weeks - June to July, 2021 - I bought 13 Blink cameras - 7 wired Blink Mini cameras, 6 outdoor wireless, and two sync modules, all connected to the same router, 8 cameras on one Sync module and 5 on the other Sync module.First, the good: Installation was easy, set-up was relatively easy, picture quality and audio are decent, and it is helpful to be able to block out certain "Activity zones" on individual cameras. It's also helpful to be able to set a schedule for arming and disarming either system, and to be able to disable individual cameras while the rest of that system is armed. The app is fairly intuitive and provides a fair amount of control of individual cameras.Here's the not-so-good: All cameras except two outdoor wireless are between 15 and 40 feet of a high-quality router with a great signal, the other two are about 50' and 75' away. All cameras, even the one 75' away, show excellent Wi-Fi signal strength and excellent Sync Module strength. It often takes several tries to get a live view and more often than not I get "Live view failed" on random cameras. I also occasionally get "Camera off line" on any of the plug-in Mini cameras, though they almost always come back on line by themselves - sometimes within a few minutes, sometimes after a day or so off line. I have "Early Notification" enabled, but when I get notified of a camera detecting motion, it always takes several seconds before I can get a live view, and more often than not, I get "Live view unavailable". When I switch from one camera view to another, it takes several tries  before the "Live view in progress - Please wait" message goes away and I can get to the other camera - ten seconds or more. The minimum ten second re-trigger time could mean that that camera misses something important. I'm also disappointed that the battery level on the outdoor cameras only says "Ok", but doesn't actually give any indication of actual battery level.I'm really sorry I went with Blink. I'm considering just taking a loss on the $600 I've spent so far and switching to a more reliable system.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2021

Review Text: I bought this for a small one bedroom apartment. It’s facing the front door in the living room. When inside the apartment, it does a good job of tracking movement. My issue is that it doesn’t detect motion when the door opens. It doesn’t detect motion when I come inside my apartment. I have to be in my apartment for 5-10 seconds before it picks up the movement. I think this is a major flaw. If someone were to enter my apartment, the camera wouldn’t catch them actually coming in. It will only show them as if they were already inside. I can stand in front of the door and move around, and the camera will detect that motion, so I’m not sure why the problem is.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2021

Review Title: Only detects light, not movement. Subscription is expensive.
Review Text: If you have motion-detecting lights and point this camera at that area, it could work very well. I live on a busy road with a sidewalk and this camera had a very hard time picking up people walking by at night under a street lamp, but any tiny change in shadows or light it picked up right away. During the day, it worked fine. I would not recommend this if you plan on pointing it somewhere darker or anywhere with cars/light changes. If you have a driveway with a motion-detecting light or plan on only using this during the day I think it would work very well.Be aware, once the free trial period ends, you will not be able to use this at all. It will not work without a subscription. It won't turn on the camera at all. You'll have a decorative white box hanging from your wall, that's it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2021

Review Text: Amazon sold me blink cameras in May 2020. Now, over a year later, Amazon and Blink are trying to strong arm their customers into paying a subscription fee when that was not disclosed at time of purchase. Unless I pay the fee that was never agreed to, the system, over a $200 value, is now useless to me. I find it borderline criminal that a company would initiate a new policy for existing customers and force payment to use the previously purchased equipment. Nothing wrong with the cameras, but obviously something wrong with those making these decisions for Amazon/Blink.

Review Text: I feel like we are all getting subscription poor and this will be the next revolution. I bought this because I thought i could add it on to my unlimited Ring recording subscription, but I cannot. The image quality is fantastic and the motion sensing is amazing!  TRUE STORY: I had this in my garage to record Amazon zkey deliveries. A paint chip (probably paint and seam tape) came off of my ceiling at 3am in my pitch black garage. It was picked up by the sensor and recordsed very clearly on the night vision. I shared it with family and told them I had a ghost!Although the price and the features were great, I returned it because I didn't want another subscription.

Review Text: Update: Amazon contacted me shortly after the posting of this review and guided me on how to fix the issue. I updated the firmware, unplugged and plugged the camera, then reset the camera. That did the job. After the issue was resolved, I updated from 1 star to 4 stars. I think it should be more 3.5 stars but I’ll round up. I do wish the videos can be longer than 30 secs. I do experience connection issues while viewing lives. Audio and video quality can be better. But considering the price, I think it is acceptable.I got this for a remote location. I’ve had it for few weeks now. In the last week, the mini kept disconnecting from the WiFi and in order to reconnect I need to reset the camera in person to pair with the WiFi. So this disconnection issue renders the camera unless. It’s not a power issue because the camera is on when I get to the location and the other blink 2 camera and sync at the same location never stopped working.I really wished to like this camera because it’s located in a high traffic area and battery operated blinks were draining batteries in a week or two. The mini was supposed to be a solution. Hopefully, there is a firmware fix SOON but, otherwise, I will return this product.If this product doesn’t disconnect, there are things that I like about it.ProsNot powered by outletTwo way speakerfree storage with my existing accountLocal storage w/micro cardhalf decent imageReasonable priceConsNo continuous live view (I can watch it for about 5 mins and it’ll kick me off and I will need to wait seconds before I can jump back on)Disconnecting from WIFIBOTTOM LINE: This product is useless and unable to provide security because it disconnects frequently. In my case, it disconnects after a few hours of use.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021

Review Title: Great value at a low price
Review Text: Excellent picture quality. I bought this camera specifically to use inside and point it outside through the window. There are several things you’ll need to Using it to point out the window. First you will need to turn off the blue light that comes on when motion is detected because it will cause a glare in the window at night that you won’t be able to see through. And second you’ll need to turn off the night vision control because this will make the blue light come on causing a severe glare that you won’t be able to see through. I also set the IR intensity to high to help detect motion at night. So far so good. I will update more if I find more problems to overcome using the camera this way

Review Title: Disapointing with out the cloud service
Review Text: I purchased this camera to add to an existing system that was in a trial period with the cloud support. (That was before I knew that I had to pay a monthly fee for it to work well.) What they don't make clear until I called to ask,  is that you must pay a monthly fee for cloud space in order for this camera to work well. It was fantastic while on the cloud but once I started to use the thumb drive it was awful. Sometimes it recorder and some times nothing shows up at all with no reason. Someone walking up to my front door should set it off easily, but it doesn't seem too. .Very disappointing. I also get white or black screens  before it actually clears up enough to see which didn't happen earlier during the trial period.

Review Text: I actually have two of these and I will be throwing both in the trash.  The night vision is decent, however it does a terrible job of switching out of it, so you wind up with washed out video when a light gets turned on.But that’s not the main problem.We can spend hours in front of this camera with absolutely nothing recording and then in the middle of the night, get a recording of absolutely nothing.I have been working with support for over two months with no resolution and getting jerked around trying the same things.  Absolutely terrible product support.Save your money and buy something that will actually work.  Personally I’ll never be buying another blink product again

Review Text: UPDATE: After 4 months of use, I find that resetting is required on almost a daily basis.Though 3ft from the wireless router, it's ability to stay connected seems to be too much to ask for from this small camera.The process, frustrating at best, requires a reset of the camera, with multiple failures reaching the Amazon servers.(Note: you have to start back at step one each time)Forth time trying to connect seems to be the charm, however throwing into the garbage is feeling like a much better option at the moment.Works pretty well, when it works.New, motion detection was fantastic.Now it works about 70% of the time.UPDATE: Seems that daily the camera needs to be reset as it has lost signal (a process that always seems to take 3 or 4 times to get through to Blink Servers)For reference, it is about 3ft from the wireless modem, so signal is certainly not an issue.Other wireless items do not seem to have the same problem as the Blink cameras.Though I have not used them, Wyze V3 cameras (with local storage and free 14 day online storage) seem to be the way to go
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2020

Review Title: Occasional snap shot or short video
Review Text: I only purchase it to take occasional shot or short video and I think this is all it is capable of. If you get a high hopes that this is going to be state of the art security system or even baby cam system I seriously doubt that. If you want continuous monitoring or recording I would suggest to look elsewhere as you have to continue pressing "continue?" button after a minute or so. It's kind of a toy camera.The system itself is finicky and it crashed on me on day 2 after simply pushing video button while it was critically busy I guess. Not sure what happened but camera itself crashed flashing series of green and 1 red pulses on the cam. At first I was not able to reset it by reset button and it would not connect and would not do anything, like totally broken. Unplugged it for 1 hour. Delete the app from the phone. Reinstall the App, reset, reconnected and was able to restore it's operation. I just hope it works for my purpose.3 stars for decent picture, OK night vision, pleasant look of cam and steady wifi connection.  Minus 2 stars for finicky software/hardware, not able to record continuously, for need to buy additional equipment if you decide to go w/o cloud subscription and for connecting this thing to my Amazon account.It's been a stable operation for a few months now. Adding a star.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2021

Review Text: Last update 1/6/2022The basic job of this camera is to detect motion 24 x 7.When it works, it works well.(I wish the Blink outdoor ones are like that capturing motion a few seconds before it starts (at least when plugged in).)Video is clear.Microphone seems to pick up sound pretty well.I would have given this camera at least a 4 stars if not because of a day one bug that is still hauntingthe users despite support said they are working on a fix with no ETA.My camera firmware version is 9.74.Still no fix in sight as of this review revision.It seems like the camera just failed to match the exposure to the environment at all times.When the camera experience a transition from dark to bright, it failed to adjust its exposure (thus over exposed) and missed most motion until it gets dark again.If you wave your hand very close to the camera, you may get the camera to work again as the camera will adjust its exposure to the environment once motion is detected.The suggested workaround by Blink is to disable/enable the camera daily after dawn.  That adds another 15 mins of uncertainty.This workaround doesn't really solve scenarios at night though.If I keep a light on for the camera at night so that it doesn't adjust its exposure too much, that seems to help.If the camera experience more motions during the night to day transition, it seems to help.If I am using the camera in an always dark environment so that IR mode is always on, that seems to work too.Need to test these workarounds for a longer period of time to know for sure.BLINK, PLEASE FIX THIS ASAP!No reason customer has to waste their time to figure out how to work around a day one defect.The Activity Zones setting is pretty coarse like the XT instead of XT2.Each motion video can be recorded between 5 and 30 seconds.Live view on phone app will pause every 60 seconds.I also ran into random minor issues once in a while:1) Camera setting is not in sync with the app settings.2) Recorded clip is not the specified length without changing anything.3) Playback progress bar is out of sync with the video.4) First playback seems to take quite some time before it can start.5) Notification of motion can be a min or two behind.  Typically it only takes 2-3 seconds if early notification is on.Some of the above can be related to the day one bug.Would be useful to have the following:1) Allow retrigger time to be set to zero so there is no additional uncertainty.2) Time stamp on the video.2) Report number of times a camera failed to notify motion due to intermittent communication issues.3) Continuous live view as an option even in the Blink outdoor case (at the expense of battery life).4) Skip notification for individual camera but continue to detect and record motion.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020

Review Title: Subscription service doesn't work, poor customer service
Review Text: Bought this along with the free trial. Once the trial expired I got the subscription only to find out you can't attach your location to get the subscription to work. Spend an hour on the phone getting transferred, finally got to Blink and no one available.The cameras work ok, motion sensing not great and quite delayed and they glitch once in awhile.I'd recommend you look for a camera system with a subscription and monitoring program that actually works, without video record and alert these will just be more electronic garbage at the dump.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2021

Review Text: This product has met all of our needs.  This was installed in my daughter's apartment.  The video clarity is good.  The night vision is very clear, it even detects dust.  The audio is very nice, we have startled a few people.  The lights on the devices are not bothersome.  It is nice to see when the cameras are armed and when they pick something up. Being able to have the living room camera on and the bedroom camera off is a plus or visa versa.  The camera controls work decently with alexa.  We have had a couple of issues with Alexa not understanding the alarm command, however, it is very easy to arm and disarm through the aps on the phones.  Being able to control the settings of the cameras is great through the ap.  The video record time is perfect for our needs.  Instillation was quick and painless.  Only down fall is if the power goes out, because these cameras are directly plugged into an outlet.  We have not experienced that yet. All in all, this gives this momma a piece of mind, with my young(22 yrs old) adult daughter living on her own.  It also gives my daughter piece of mind knowing that she has a little more protection than her secured building entrance.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020

Review Title: Product is Junk; Service is horrendous
Review Text: Initially, I stated that the product is fairly intuitive (see also below). Good thing, because if you call their customer support department, you wait for an agent, only to be told that you have to leave a message.  When you leave your contact info, they don't return the call within 24 hours.  Not acceptable, in my opinionGoing back to the product, it is fairly simple to set up and works OK if nothing goes wrong.  However, if there is an outage, you need to visit the physical device to get it going again.  If you are using Blink to protect your remote property, you are screwed big time as there is nothing you can do remotely to get your cameras running again short of visiting the location and taking some hands-on action.More recently, I had an experience where my son walked through our house, waving his arms at both cameras.  They did not detect any motion.  Really?  I sent an email to Blink Customer Service - there is no sense in calling because they don't answer the phone or return calls - but no response.  I have followed up with several more emails over the past couple weeks and they still have not responded.The product does not work and customer service is non-existent.  Do not waste your money on this junk

It’s not.There are a few major flaws:The viewing time is limited and it takes awhile to connect to the monitor.The motion detector is not as reliable at night and it often misses alerting us when our toddler gets out of bed.It has a very audible clicking sound when the camera turns on and off, which is often loud enough to alert our toddler that we are checking on her.We ended up buying a different camera after spending a few months with this one and no being able to use it as a reliable monitor.

Review Text: I purchased two of these cameras for each floor of my home.  They are both aimed at the points of entry.  The setup was extremely easy and they are tiny enough not to be obtrusive or noticeable.  Wi-fi connectivity is strong.  I like that they allow you to "flip-video" if they camera is upside down when mounting.  The quality of the video has been great and so far I've had no issues.  There are only two things I wish they could change:1) Retrigger time:  It would be great if they could shorten it to a few seconds or just get rid of it entirely.  I would gladly play for a cloud storage fee for continuous recording.2) Allow the user to access video and control from a computer in conjunction with the app.Hopefully a few more firmware updates and continued development will see these two things happen.

Review Text: Unless your planning on purchasing the cloud-based subscription, don't waste your money on this camera. I purchased 2 Blink Minis and a blink sync module 2 and the cameras worked great until the trial plan ran out. Now the clips take a long time to load even on the same network as the sync module. There is no reason for this, the clips on my other cheap camera load instantly. I used to be able to delete multiple clips at once without having to start a video first. Now I have to wait a while for a clip to start 1 at a time before I can delete them.  If you have one of these cameras in a high-traffic area, you will be spending hours every day deleting clips. There is no other reason for the clips to take a long time to load at home and preventing multiple clips from being deleted at once. I was planning on buying the three pack Blink outdoor camera kit. I am soooooooo glad that I waited.Edit: Gone from bad to total JUNK. Now the camera captures motion maybe 1 out of 5 times. Why does it need the cloud?
