Review Title: Very seldom detects even large, high contrast motion. Practically useless
Review Text: I installed this in the garage, and tried a couple of different locations. Currently it is near the garage door with sensitivity set to the maximum in the app. It almost never detects motion. The “mini” uses changes in pixels rather than infrared detection. When the garage door opens, it should “see” 1) a sudden brightening, which would affect every pixel in the image; 2) the horizontal lines of the garage door segments moving up across the image; 3) the dark colored car backing out or driving in, creating a huge contrast in well over half of the pixels in the frame; 4) a delivery person walking into the garage (after it should have already activated due to the door opening) and setting a package down right below the camera — TWICE — having stepped directly in front of the camera. Yet the Mini usually does not detect the motion. I even made stripes on the garage door using electrical tape in order to increase the contrast. Nothing! Every so-often it will pick up the opening of the door or someone walking in or out when the door is already open, but there’s no rhyme or reason to it that I can figure out. Most of the time, nothing.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2021

Review Title: Too bad the analytics don’t work
Review Text: I really really really really wanted to like this camera. Setup was a piece of cake. Resolution was top notch. UI was awesome. It’s been running in place for 10 days.Motion detection was a bad joke.I used to work in counterterrorism and physical security back when iOmniscient was breaking new ground, GE San Diego was still a playa in gaze analysis, and adjoining room transfer was a pipe dream. The world has come a long way since then.But apparently not at Google Blink.I WALKED BY THE CAMERA AND LOOKED INTO IT… no alarm. My tenant walks by TWICE A DAY. No alarm. I pull out of the driveway… NO ALARM. I walk to my car… NO ALARM.So far, we’ve gotten 1 Amazon guy out of maybe 6, zero mail carriers out of 10, 175 passing cars out of 175, 4 stick insects, 14 spiders, 2 praying mantises, and 200 gently rustling leaves. The arthropod clips are priceless, by the way.The generic field is software video analytics. Tons of it is open source. It’s 2021 for goodness’s sake! If you can’t hire a developer to help you, pick me.Sadly… truly sadly… returning it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2021

Review Title: False advertising: Recording Subscription required even for previous blink owners!
Review Text: I am a blink system owner since 2020, and I really did like my outdoor cameras and it’s recording features. I decided to by the mini cameras, as an addition to my current system. Before buying, I read the reviews and questions and it was stated that previous blink owners with existing recording features would have the same benefits for the new cameras, no subscription required. However that isn’t true!After I bought the cameras, I had just 30 days recording features, now it says that I need to buy a subscription plan for my new mini cameras. My old ones still have the recording.I called customer service and they told me the problem was that I bought my system in July/2020 and they would grant the recording features just if I had bought it until April 2020. I still have the recording features for my cameras bought in 2020 but not for the new ones. This wasn’t stated at Amazon purchase page! In order to find such information you really need to dig into Blink website. For me this is false advertising as this data should be clearly stated at the moment you buy!I am returning the new cameras!! It doesn’t make any sense to have part of my system with recording features and part in need for a subscription. I really expected a better service from an Amazon device!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2022

Review Text: Got this camera because I haven’t felt safe or secure in my home recently. Set up and installation was easy enough; although trying to get a screwdriver or drill at a good angle to mount it with the camera attached was a little cumbersome. During the day the picture quality is decent enough that I can recognize who is coming to my door. HOWEVER. The night vision is absolutely terrible!! No matter how I adjust the settings the quality is the same. I even took the camera down and placed it outside to see if the glass pane was causing the problem with the quality but it is just BAD night vision.If you’re using this as some sort of nanny cam or only need to see things during the day it is passable— but for security or peace of mind at night I definitely would not recommend it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021

Review Title: I am a old blink user but I recommend blink.
Review Text: Blink is an awesome company. My account is old so I do have the free tier so I am a bit bias. Overall blink is cheap and I like there customer service.The quality is good. I just plug this in my room. I only like the motion sensor. The set up is easy. The device is wire so no battery.  Not much to say, it basically a all day webcam.You don't have 24 hour live play back so don't buy this device for that.  This is only good if you want a motion sensor that send notification to your phone asap with a shot clip.The camera does have a 30 live cam play.----The best thing about blink is that their camera system is supposed be on there own server (that what I heard).They did update there account security. I believe they have 2fa with email, if you log into an email it supposed send an email code to login.Customer support is good. I once have an issue with my camera. The device is like 2 year and they told me I can return it and they replace that one for free. Maybe it just me but I consider that to be good. I do own 3 blink device + this camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2021

Review Title: Subscription plan required to record after 30 day free trial
Review Text: Blink is really well thought out, and as of 12/2021 the app seems to do what it's supposed to do. I have all brand new 12/21 devices. A Doorbell, two outdoor cams, two sync 2 modules, and 3 indoor cams. The nightvision on the outdoor is meh, it works, but it's not great. Plants reflect a lot of the IR and makes it hard to see past the reflection. It's battery powered, so what do you want? Overall I would say I like the Blink system, but my headline is my number one gripe. I bought this expecting that I would be able to record to the USB drive connected to the sync 2 module for free. THIS IS NOT THE CASE. You MUST pay for a subscription plan to record. There is a free plan, but that only includes live view, and motion ALERTS. NO RECORDING. Doesn't matter if you have the sync module with a USB drive or not, all new cameras must have a subscription plan to record. 10 bucks a month for unlimited cameras. I don't know if it's worth it honestly. The motion detection doesn't really put it in that subscription price range for me. I would rather have one of the actual alarm options out there for around the same price.  I probably will just stick with the free plan, or I may even return them. I'm not sure yet. I'm going to look at the other options out there.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2021

Review Text: So far, this thing is more trouble than it is worth. We bought it to keep an eye on the parking lot in front of our apartment, only to find out that it won't work through glass. We settled for having it pointed at the front door. It was constantly using "night vision" when there was plenty of light in the room, making the image extremely bright. The TV was constantly triggering the camera whenever there was a bright flash. Several times, the camera quit responding to the app. The last time it stopped responding, I just unplugged it. I'm glad I bought it on sale, at least.Edit 12/4/20: I turned off night vision, and it now works through windows when it wants to. The camera will stop working for hours at a time, and only starts working again once someone uses live view to "wake it up". This makes it completely useless as a security camera.We also discovered that the speaker has a terrible feedback squeal, which makes that part of the camera also useless. From other reviews I have read, there is no fix for this. Turning the volume down helps, but then no one can hear the speaker.If you want this as a cheap camera to occasionally watch pets while at work, it's okay. If you want a camera that actually does everything it says it does, look elsewhere.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020

Review Text: I bought a set of 3 Blink mini cameras.Mostly to keep an eye on the dogs while my wife and I are away and also for security.They work pretty well but when you are away from home and try to talk to someone through the camera the voice that comes out is horribly distorted and difficult if not impossible to understand.The wife and I had been out for a few hours and I went on “Live” video and told my yellow lab to vacuum the carpet and she clearly didn’t understand. 🤔Just kidding about that, however, it really is horrible quality audio that comes out of the speakers.I let the free Blink storage expire just to see if it was actually something that I needed and quickly paid the $100 for a one year subscription.Without the subscription it would notify me of movement but I couldn’t go back and see what the movement was that was detected.They have some type of hub that you can buy for your home that also provides that capability but if I was a burglar I’d just destroy the micro SD card and steal the whole system.Overall it serves the purpose at a reasonable price.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021

Review Title: The camera does not hook up well
Review Text: This camera 1) does not hook up unless you are right next to a router.  2) is not a secured anything. 3) will not work unless you pay $3 a month for their cloud.  This came free with a newer Alexa show I bought or I would be sending this right back.  In the meantime... I will not be using it.  Total waste!  There should be an option to use it without it recording or going to any cloud.  Like if you wanted to just "drop in" and see what's going on.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2021

Review Title: Camera works better than expected but customer service is some of the worst I ever encountered.
Review Text: A product is only as good as the customer service backing it up. If this review was for ONLY the camera, I would give it 4 stars, but any product review should include the customer service experience, which in my case was one of the worst I can remember.If you have any issues with your camera or setup and have to reach out to customer service, good luck with that.I guess this is ultimately what happens when you offshore support to a foreign country and English isn't their first language, but that was just the beginning of my issues with them.My advice, go with the competition. The product is similar and the customer experience may or may not be much better, but I din't think it could be any worse.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020

Review Text: I got this little camera for free, so I really can't complain about anything. But, I have some of the same complaints as everyone else. My main problem is the motion detection when armed. It just stops, or doesn't work at all. I have tried adjusting the sensitivity and it still doesn't work. I can be walking around the living room and nothing. It seems to work ok in the daylight, and occasionally at night... But definitely not the way it should, so it should not be trusted as security camera. You would also think that you would have more options with Alexa. It doesn't have any option to arm/disarm automatically when you leave home or come back... Which akexa doesn't seem to work for that with the other things, anyway, but that's for a different item.Other than those things, it seems like it has the potential to be a really good little camera. Picture looks good, especially at night with the night vision.Once they get some of these bugs worked out, it will really be worth it... Especially at the price point.If you just want to have the option to look in on a room or something from time to time, this would be ok for that. Just not for security. Not til they get the motion detection stuff figured out.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020

Review Title: I just want a device that works
Review Text: If I don't want to give a company that can be hacked my phone number, and I don't want to receive text messages from them, I should be able to make that decision or at least know when I am purchasing the product that I am going to be forced to do it or I cannot use the product! I understand it is a camera so I see the need for extra stuff on my password but if I want my password to be abc123 I should be able to have it... (That's not it literally). And lastly it is a cheap product, I understand that, they make money off of selling multiple devices, but how can you have a product sold in 2022 that I cannot use my normal 5G internet at

Review Title: Just another racket like Ring. No customer service.
Review Text: I liked them until they decided that I had to provide a phone number to the account for security purposes. They don’t “monitor” my cameras so what purpose would giving my number serve me the “customer” except corporate espionage.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021

Review Title: Terrible. Hit and miss recording.  Forces you to buy plan
Review Text: I thought these were great when I first purchased it.  But then noticed that it wasn’t recording motion when I needed it the most.  I set these up at my office to record motion in the parking lot.  The cameras stopped recording about 7pm and didn’t start again until about 9am.  Meanwhile dozens of cars and people went by the view of the camera.  I worked with support for days, tons of emails, and they couldn’t figure it out. They even sent me two new cameras, I had to send the two older ones back. Same problem.  They couldn’t fix it.  AND to kick me when I was down, they changed their policy from free recording to requiring a plan.  I had free recording when I first got the cameras. That’s why I bought them!  It lasted for about six months so it wasn’t just that I ‘misunderstood’ a 30 day free trial. Then I started getting emails that I needed to purchase a plan.  I purchased a plan for one of the six cameras, just to test it.  Maybe this would fix the software issue that caused it to stop recording for hours at a time.  Nope.  Still useless.  So I have six useless cameras.  Don’t waste your money on Blink.  Try another brand.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022

Review Text: I'm really disappointed with the current state of indoor Wifi cameras. I've had a lot of Wyze cameras but they're pretty useless without their Cam Plus subscription. I sent them back because of that. Next I tried the Eufy cameras because they say they work with local storage and no subscriptions required.  The problem with them is the horrible software and buggy motion detection.I tried these Blink cameras next. They had the worst picture of the three. It's very low contrast and washed out looking. It's obvious they're using the cheapest sensor they can get. The software is also poorly designed and hard to use.  The settings for motion detection are "how long should it record" (max 60 seconds) and "how long should it wait to record again". What I want it to do is start recording when it sees motion and keep recording until the motion stops.  That's not one of the options.The final problem was the motion detection itself. It would miss big things or start recording in the middle.  For example, the start of the recording would show the cat in the middle of the room with no  recording of the cat actually entering.I can't believe that these cameras are so badly programmed and user unfriendly. It's like all these companies are just shoveling crap out the door without ever actually trying to use it.  That's not quite the case for Wyze. Their software works ok. They just want you to keep paying for it forever so they disable basic functions unless you buy a subscription.Update: 2021-10-18.  Blink support reached out to try and help with my issues.  I appreciate that they're at least trying.  Still, it should have worked without messing around with settings for something as basic as motion detection. Kudos for being responsive.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2021

Review Text: The mini is a much needed low cost camera added to the blink line up. The price point makes this affordable enough to add anywhere.Setup was simple and very quick. I already had several XT cameras so adding the mini was painless.The motion alerts and video quality seem about in par with a low cost camera.Some features I hope come soon- more granular motion arming (set per camera). With indoor cameras my arming schedule is very different than outdoor units.- extended video viewing. These cameras are not on battery, why ask to continue the video feed constantly- multiple video viewing screen. Add a video dashboard function on the app and on fire show to view multiple feeds at once.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020

Review Title: The Good, The bad, and The ugly night time video.
Review Text: Like all the blink cameras I’ve owned the picture is good enough to see what is going on in front of the camera but it’s not very good at night.  Blurry is an understatement which is really bad considering I wanted these cameras for proof or help identifying criminals in case one decides to break into my property or vehicles.  You can change every setting on the app and update the cameras but it will never be a crisp bright night vision image or video.  I’ve accepted the fact that this is merely eyes to the outside while you’re asleep or away from home and that’s pretty much it.  This new mini has a delay when you try to speak to the person on the other end it will mute your sound for a few seconds while you finish talking then you can see the person talking then a few seconds later the sound comes through.  It also started making a loud popping noise when you have the sound muted on the app just as soon as you close the live camera feed.  That could just be a problem with the app but I’m not certain what is causing that noise. The notification sometimes works when movement is detected but it’s usually 60/40 that it will work fast enough to allow you to answer the doorbell when someone shows up and sets it off.  All in all if you just want to see what is going on in and out of your home while your away this works fine but if you want good quality video both day AND night then this is not for you.  Cheers!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020

Review Title: Absolutely THE WORST camera I have ever purchased.
Review Text: I bought two of these little "Blink Mini – Compact indoor plug-in smart security camera" hoping I could find ones that work with ALEXA based electronics and would be efficient for every area of my home.So, where do I begin, honestly.. When I set up both of these it seemed like a great deal, I mean who can pass on cameras when they're on sale during the lightning deals, but when I started to have glitches happen when reviewing the playback and on live I was a little worried but thought it may have just been my internet.SO after having it for one week, in the middle of the night, both cameras started having this loud Screeching noise like a banshee and I could not get them fixed in any way. So after only two days of use and it already was messed up, I have to say I am very disappointed because if they could fix an issue then maybe it wouldn't be half bad.I definitely did not get paid for any monetary reason meaning AND I as a disabled woman that has to have cameras around the house this was a 2 out of 5 star review.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2020

Review Text: I like my mini. I like that the quality is good. However, I would not recomend this as a security camera. I have mine installed because my home has been invaded twice. I purchased this camera and it worked well for some time. However, it stopped detecting movement and filming.  A couple of weeks ago, I recieved a notification of movement but I was not able to see any video. Did someone enter my home again? Did someone stole something and I could not see it? I do not know!My children sometimes wake up in the middle of the night and this camera used to send me notifications so that I could go guide them, now it does not detect them anymore.Now the mini, just does not work.What will I do when I'm away?I can't just keep the live option open at all times.Help?!

Review Text: I wanted to replace the camera of my sons bedroom (mostly on his nap time and while he is with the nanny), and I was excited with this one, since I could use it with our Alexa echo.Got disappointed because my son would always know or would wake up when I was watching with the camera, because it makes a weird sound. Also you need a subscription to keep in track with the motion/sound activity, which our previous camera didn’t need (momentum).It doesn’t have a magnet on the base to place over metallic structures.Long story short, I kept my momentum camera in my son’s room.

Review Title: Constantly drops connection even when close to WiFi. FIXED! Updated: 7-8-20
Review Text: Update 7-8-20: Blink contacted me about the 1 star review. They sent me a new camera that works. There was an apparent hardware issue with the first camera. Changing my rating to 4 stars. Still 1 star off for not having a continuous view function. Hopefully, they can add that feature soon.Not too happy with the camera. It drops connection all the time. When trying to reconnect The camera fails and shows the red light. The only way to reconnect is to delete the system in the app, reset the camera by pushing the micro button at the bottom, and start completely over. It’s more trouble than it’s worth. The live view feature is as bad as the other reviews say. It automatically cuts off after 30 seconds. We bought this for our toddlers room, so it’s useless in that regard too. I think they really dropped the ball with this new camera.

Review Title: It's a pretty good system so far, but has some drawbacks...
Review Text: (I may adjust this review, as I have had the product for only a week now) I bought this system to use in a giant room that we use at our church. I wanted to try it out as I had been using the Yi camera system throughout the kids building (it's a 70k square foot building). The picture quality is great! The biggest issue I see is that I can't watch the camera live, if there is motion in the room. I liked on the Yi cameras, that I could watch it live, and rewind it in real time (like a dvr). I haven't figured out how to do it with Blink camera yet. I have the Sync Module 2, with the biggest USB it can handle, and have a VERY strong Wifi throughout the building. The problem is, when I go live, if there are people in the room, it will tell me "live view failed". It takes short clips (I've changed the settings to make them longer, but they still aren't very long), and I'm afraid I'm going to miss something important in the room (it's for child safety and other issues).I'll give it a few more weeks before I return back to the Yi cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2021

Review Title: Can't complain... It does work ...... For what it is
Review Text: I just put this up in my garage. I bought it on a whim because it was so cheap.  The app on the phone connects relatively quick even on my DSL connection, remotely.  The time out while watching video is crazy annoying.  The fact there's no way to store video locally is my biggest complaint.  They try and sell you cloud services relentlessly when the courtesy free storage period is dwindling.  The night vision in the garage with no lights work well.  This little block is a nice way to look into something AT THAT MOMENT.  I would consider another one if I just needed to quick peek at things instead of trying to review footage.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2021

Review Text: Got it during Prime Day, it was a good deal and got shipped quickly despite initially being back-ordered. Have bought and tried a few such cameras, I would say Blink cameras are the best out there, for many reasons.First, It is such an easy thing to set it up that there is not even an user manual included. Simply follow the 3 step instructions on the packaging and get started for set up, which took like less than 5 minutes. Everything was a breeze from there. Motion detection is super sensitive, even though it is for indoor use, I used it to point outside for outdoor monitoring, it was able to detect motion when people approach my place or when a neighbor's car comes and goes and it records video when it happens. There is no internal local storage and you can purchase cloud storage, but it's not really needed, as video clips can be stored on your phone with the app, and you can upload/download it elsewhere.It's mini and compact, night vision works well, picture quality is fine. Overall very pleased and especially for the price, why go for anything else?
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2021

Review Text: I really wanted to love these cameras.  I have several cameras I have used over the years much cheaper than these that have a ton not featured than these do.  I will give some pros though.  They have an excellent angle view and the video and audio is great.  But that's about it.  The app is clunky and the most important part, the video does NOT overlay the timestamp.  In some legal cases, this makes the video useless.  The stamp on the file can easily be manipulated and in a recent case down here, the video was thrown out.  Please review the Blink website for people complaining about this since 2017.  I have a cheap Zmodo home security system. I have $15 dangers from Foscam and similar generics.  Guess what, overlay time stamp on every one. This is not a complicated thing to do.  Finally, you can not stream this video constantly. Any other system allows this. Not sure why Blink decided to limit sessions to a few minutes.  DO NOT USE THIS AS A NURSERY MONITOR... That would be extremely dangerous.  The storage is decent, so it holds a lot of clips  but again, there should have been an option for clips to run while there is motion and not just 30 seconds when motion is detected.  My kids were fighting and it just happened to end the recording and start the next after a delay when he hit his brother. Nope, not recorded.  However, my cheap camera did, so thank goodness. After 30 seconds (maximum time it will record a clip). It makes you wait a minimum of 10 seconds before it even picks back up.  Blink, you are almost there. Just a few more key features and you're perfect.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2021

Review Text: Product arrived on time and well packaged.  I wanted these (Two cameras) so that I could monitor an ill pet and be able to talk to it if necessary to help calm it.Setup was typical Blink easy.  No issues.  The camera image is fine and unlike the battery powered units you can watch as long as you need to.  That was important to me.  The audio to me is also of good quality.  Five stars for that.Now the bad.....Using the "talk" feature results in a ton of screeching and static.  I suppose it "could" be feedback but the noise remains even if I move to distant areas of the house.  I will need to have someone else try to "talk" from farther away while I wat in the house and see if the problem persists from a greater distance.  For now the "talk" feature gets 1 star and drags the overall review down to three stars.  I would return these but I do need the video and that does work well.I have not tested the motion detection as yet.  I will update this as time goes by as the cameras are less than 24 hours old.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2021

Review Text: The cameras are super easy to get set up and the picture quality is pretty good. The features go downhill from there. One big issue is the live view. I like to have a continuous stream of live view at certain times to keep an eye on pets and things. This makes you click continue every 30 seconds or so or else it turns off. It also makes it so you can't access the live view again for a short time as it says there's still one active. Another issue, it seems to be random on when it detects things and when it doesn't. It started out working fine, but now never seems to catch everything. As I write this, I just had someone show up and get all the way into my kitchen, bypassing two active cameras that never alerted me. I've toyed with all the settings to make them more sensitive, tried the "early notice" feature that's supposed to alert you faster. These come off really great but are in fact much worse than you'd expect. They need some feature updates and maybe they would be more usable.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020

Review Title: value for the $, but just spend more.
Review Text: Edit: WARNING! After leaving a review on this product, I received a phishing email to my private email regarding this review. HOW? Stay aware. Makes me not want to keep this product!EDIT 2: after nearly 6 months, I am increasingly annoyed with this camera and wish I had just spent $70-$100 for something of higher quality. The constant notifications I get during sun up and sun down due to the IR light changing constantly and thinking there is motion is absurdly annoying.The camera is small, easy to mount, and very easy to set up. less than 5 minutes to have it working. Overall, would recommend this as a camera that faces an entry/ exit door.Pros: Small, attractive, cheap, easy, good app, 2-way communication is LOUD, night vision works great from 6 feet, no problems recording, instant notifications.Cons: Motion detection is VERY sensitive (shadows, lights turning on/off, 4lb cat), can't be "always-on" as described unless you literally always have the app open, and the cord is ~1 meter, limiting where I can plug it in while it's wall-mounted.Yes, it will always start recording if you have it in the "Armed" setting and it detects motion, but it will not be always recording without motion.Additionally, there is no middle ground with the sensitivity settings. on a 3, it won't pick up me standing in front of it waving my arms, but on a 4, it picks up the smallest shadow.Overall, I am keeping the camera as it was only $35. If I wanted one that was always recording I could get CCTV with DVR for like $300.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020

Review Title: Can’t recommend based on quality and consistency!
Review Text: Just for a little background info before I give my pros and cons… We have 8 cameras total (3 outdoor and 5 indoor minis). We have them all set up on the same system saving to the sync device that is at a good middle spot in the house by our router and also have the WiFi extended to reach every corner of the 1/2 acre we live on by using an Orbi system. We placed the three cameras in the front of the house and then the inside ones we placed strategically thought the house.Pros: 1. Easy setup: for the most part it was downloading an app and plugging in the indoor cameras and putting batteries in the outdoor ones. Then you scan the QR code and your ready to go.2. Picture quality is pretty good: It automatically switches to night vision when it gets too dark and I can adjust IR intensity to allow the picture quality I want at night. The daytime picture is pretty good up close but you couldn’t use it to see like the license plate of the cars driving by or anything detailed more than a 5-10 feet from the camera.3. You can talk and hear through the cameras: This is a plus but the quality is severely lacking in this area. You can’t talk and hear what they are saying at the same time and when they talk or you talk it seems to cut in and out quite a bit so you miss some of what is said. It is also delayed by at least 3-4 seconds from when it is actually being said to when you hear it on the app.4. The price is good for a starter security system or if you aren’t wanting to pay a lot but still want to catch a burglar or make sure your packages are being delivered properly.5. You can add on cameras if you need more but beware because the sync device doesn’t seem to like to record and save what is happening on more than one camera at a time so if a bird flies by one camera your probably not going to catch the person walking up to your porch on the other camera (or at least not until they are actually on your porch).Cons: 1. Battery life depends on usage which means with heavy winds moving the top of our trees causing the shadows to sway and then the bees and birds that seem to love setting our cameras off we have now replaced the batteries at least once in each of the three outdoor cameras and one of the cameras seems to need replaced each month. You can change the sensitivity setting to help stop some of that but it seems like we didn’t pick up anything including people walking around outside when we went down a setting or two so be prepared to replace a bunch of lithium batteries or not catch what’s happening.2. As I mentioned above the ability to talk to whoever is on the other side of the camera(or just listen in) is lacking quality and consistency!3. The app takes too long to pull up and then you can’t smoothly switch between camera live views(it gives an error message or says the camera is busy) so if you are trying to check in on each camera your either out of luck or will have to close completely out of the app and get back in to try and see the next cameras live view.4. The inconsistent recording is extremely frustrating!! Some days it will alert me to a fly buzzing past or the mailman putting mail in our box, other days though it won’t catch half of what is going on or it will catch it on one camera showing one angle but not on the other one which should have a clearer view of whatever action is happening.5. The Sync module has a spot for a usb memory drive but their blink usb drive filled up way too fast and the other few I tried didn’t seem to record the videos correctly so we couldn’t pull them up on a computer later. Your only other option is to pay each month for the cloud storage that they offer which will allow you to keep unlimited videos for up to 60days.6. Randomly the outdoor cameras will disconnect to my Orbi satellite or router even though they are within feet of them but the indoor cameras will stay connected. I end up having to take the outdoor ones down from where they are mounted and taking the batteries out for a few seconds to get it to reconnect. This is a pain since the cameras are hard to snap back onto the bracket they come with that is permanently attached to the house now.7. Although I put the LED recording status light to off on all the cameras it still comes on whenever it is recording. That’s frustrating when I’m trying to check in on the house and they hear a click and see a red light and know they are being recorded or we are watching.8. Although it has where you can set up a timer for your system to become active or inactive, you have to have all the cameras that are connected to the sync module go with that timer and can’t keep certain ones active all the time with the timer unless you put them on a different system and get another sync module.So basically they are a cheap starter system for someone wanting the basics and not looking for super consistent recording. I wish they were better because we would have added to the cameras we have now but with all the app problems and recording problems we will be finding a different (probably pricier) system to replace these cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2021

Review Title: I ok for the price but not for security purpose
Review Text: I own all generation blink cameras , the mini is a good price for basic use like checking inside the house ,the motion detection is poor, I have it set on a sensitivity of 6 and it won't detect me at 10 feet, it start detecting at 7 feet away, also it won't work inside a hot garage, I placed in the garage (my garage is hot in FL), it shows a red light(not sure what that means and it quits working I think the tempature is too high, I do like how clear the video is and how quick it text you with motion and love the talk back feature, also with these cameras it won't detect if you are walk straight at it ,they detect on side motion( like side to side )so placed them accordingly .
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020

Review Title: Not bad for the cost, but you get what you pay for
Review Text: Limited range with motion detection and misses the action that triggers the motion detection, which I think can be adjusted in the settings (beta). Night vision is grainy and easily washed out with the smallest amount of light. You can only view one camera at a time in the app and takes too long to connect and bring up the picture.  I only had Amcrest Pro cameras previously, and compared to them the Blink lacks a lot of the functionality you want in a security camera. Also required a sync 2 module to retain local video footage. Pros, they easily sync with the Alexa app, and daytime picture quality isn't bad.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020

Review Title: Disappointed and de-featured vs Cloud Cam
Review Text: I purchased this because the Amazon Cloud Cam was discontinued and I needed some additional cameras. Unfortunatley it's missing at least 2 key features and 1 compatibility concern. First geofencing. I don't want this to record when we are home. You can't set up geofencing to turn on recording when you leave a certain area like, when you leave home. You could on the Cloud Cam. You have to manually "arm / disarm" to achieve this- very inconvenient...and scheduling is not the answer. Secondly, there is no snapshot preview when you log into the app. you have to manually take a snapshot to have something to show up when you first log in and that snapshot remains on screen until you take another one or start to stream video. Sometimes all you want to do is log in, see an updated snaphot and decide if you want start streaming video. Thirdly, the Amazon cloud cams cannot be imported into the Blink app forcing you to keep 2 apps- 1 for the cloud cam, and another for the Blink cameras and pay 2 fees for recordings. Dissapointing.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021

Review Title: Only can use it with a blink plan
Review Text: Can't take screen shots, can't record. Unless you purchase a blink plan the camera is basically worthless. Thankfully there are other security camera manufacturers that aren't as greedy as Amazon. I would not recommend this camera unless you're all in on a blink camera plan and want to pay them to take screen shots and record anything to your phone. If not try Heimvision cameras. They don't force you to pay for the plan in order to use your camera. Other than that the camera seems to function fine, although I'm not entirely sure since I can't use most of the functions without purchasing a monthly blink plan. I bought this on a lightening deal and I'm sure I wont buy anymore now that I see you can't use it without paying their monthly fees.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021

Review Title: Doesn't pick up motion half the time (with sensitivity turned up to highest setting)
Review Text: The picture quality is pretty good when it actually picks up motion. It'll pick up the weirdest things but not someone walking right in front of it. I have 3 of these cameras throughout the house. There are days where it picks up every little movement (like a shadow from a tree moving outside or even a piece of dust floating around) and other days where I can literally walk in front of all 3 cameras and none of them detect motion/record anything - today is one of those days. I just paid for the year subscription for all 3 but now wishing I would have returned them for a better detecting camera before I committed to that.Also - please please somehow fix the fact that I can't hear what someone is saying in front of the camera while I'm talking on the app. I like that I have to hold the talk button to be able to talk but if they start talking while I'm talking, I can't hear a word they're saying and the delay from releasing the "talk button" on the app to when I can finally hear what they're saying again is too much.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2021

Review Title: Good little camera, loud clicking when using night vision
Review Text: The cameras work very well, no complaints there.The issue is the very loud clicking when the IR filter turns on for the night vision. It's the same for all the blink cameras (I have 2 blink outdoor cams also) with night vision though, and most other competing cameras that I've found. I can't use this to watch my child and make sure they are asleep due to the loudness of the clicking.From my understanding this is due to the physical night vision filter on the camera sliding into place.If this is near you the clicking is very distracting and drowns out the first second or two of the audio in the recordings as well.Not a great thing to have on a security camera but seems to be an issue for more than just blink cameras.Overall camera works well and I've had no issues.I'm also using local storage and that works well. however when the "free trial" of their cloud stuff goes away in January 2021 we'll see how the app and recording work with only the local storage.Will update my review then.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2020

Review Title: Good cameras when on sale with limitations.
Review Text: Got 4 of these when on sale. They are meant to be used indoors and require being plugged in with the typical usb adapter. I use a couple of these pointed out a window and they are OK. The motion detection works well through a window but the night vision does not as it just reflects on the window. I realize this is not what they were meant to be used for so not a complaint. If you use them this way, be sure to shut off the red light (through the app) that comes on when camera is active or it just blows out the picture. Many settings are available on the Blink app including zone blocking where you can have the cameras not sense motion in certain areas. Great feature to reduce false activation from things like blowing tree limbs. WiFi is excellent. I have one in a shed in my backyard and one in my camper at the top of my driveway. Both are 30-40 feet away from my WiFi hub and in different buildings and work flawlessly. Very easy setup. Just scan the code on the camera with your phone and they set themselves up.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2021

Review Title: Not that great, app is terrible and No subscription is a lie.
Review Text: Please note when I bought these the big part of Blink was they did not require a subscription to store video or do a host of other things. This has since changed and now they charge $30 a year. This is not a big deal but in comparison with other systems and subscription plans out there these are expensive for the cheap cameras they are. Before the subscription change I would have given it 4 stars. Now I have to evaluate them with the security cameras and plans they are now in league with on price.I actually have owned several types of cameras now in the process of finding what I like.ProsNot a lot of pros as they are cheap cameras. They were made to be Amazon's affordable version of Ring.1.) Microphone works well2.) Like Ring the camera starts recording right before the motion occurs so that's cool but you have to have a subscription now to view it.ConsLots of Cons that were not a big deal back when they didnt charge for storage.1.) Camera Image is not high quality especially in night vision. For the price you pay you can have better2.) The app is horrific to use. You can not steam more than 20-30 seconds, you can not stream multiple cameras at a time and I was never able to get it to work on the computer without some sort of emulator. I believe they have removed desktop monitoring at this point all together. (I recognize there is a Chrome Extension App but I have never used it as it is not published by Blink but a 3rd party and has 0 reviews.)Additionally I have amazing wifi both at work and home and pretty good phone processor. This app is just slow particularly considering that when you need to access it, the situation probably requires a quick response.3.) Speaker is not that great if that is something you care about.4.) Not as compatible with Alexa as they would like you to believe. Not saying they dont recognize each other, they just have a hard time playing together and it never seems to get updated.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2021

Review Text: At first, the camera was great. Connected to my network just fine and worked flawlessly. Now, however, it gives the green flash -- saying it has lost network connection. Have tried everything -- resetting it, creating different systems and the same result. Just now literally placed it Right. Next. To. My. Router. No joy.Will try again in a day or so. Ugh.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2021

Review Text: Edited 4/1. After having this a few months as a baby monitor, it is ultra frustrating. The video constantly fails mid stream and when you try to reopen, it says system busy. It fails nearly every time we view which is every night. I would guess 1 out of 4 times does it actually work. Super frustrating waiting for the whole app to load once the live view fails. I would return if there were other options that worked with our xfinity router. We've never had a problem with the outdoor cameras on the rest of the blink system, but this one is a pass. Might be fine for emergency motion detection,  but I would not recommend for live view use unless a last resort.When we switched internet providers we had a really hard time finding a new video monitor that was compatible with Xfinity. For $35, this was a fantastic find. Works perfectly to view our kiddo's room. We already have a blink outdoor system and this installed effortlessly. We dont use motion detection or recording features on this one. Just want to be able to live stream after we put her to bed. For that it's perfect.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2021

Review Title: I know why it came free with my Echo.
Review Text: I got this camera free with my Echo Show.1st, I had the hardest time getting the camera to work with the Echo. After 3 hours and Google searching I think I finally figured it out. At least, it's working with the Echo now. (Side now, Blink customer support is worthless.)2nd, the motion detection doesn't work. Well... it works when it wants too. I could walk past it 10 times and it will only pick up movement once or twice. (Again, Blink customer support is zero help.)3rd, the preview is a black screen for the first 3-4 seconds before the recorded image appeared.  (Hi. Me again. Complaining about Blink customer support.)At least I know why it was free.I tried getting help from customer support and they couldn't help me. And they ignored my question when I submitted an issue claim. They just closed my request and asked for my rating on experience with them. Idk, maybe I got a bad camera. But it's a no for me.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021

Review Title: Great addition to existing Blink System
Review Text: Update:I originally had some concerns regarding the scheduling capability of this new Blink camera. Less than 24 hours after I wrote my review, a representative from the Blink Technical Support Team contacted me to address my concerns. Apparently you can set different schedules for the camera, however they need to be added as a “new system” instead of being added to my existing system. This allows me to create a separate schedule for the blink mini cameras. It was a quick and easy fix. Now wondering if I’m going to incur a monthly charge because of the changes I made. Will update again once blink reaches out to me.Also: New customers will have the option of purchasing the blink module 2 with storage capabilities (using a flash drive) if you don’t want to be charged monthly to use the cloud storage.Original Review:I already own 3 Blink XT2 cameras which have been working great for the outside of my home. Once I saw Amazon offering these new cameras that could be plugged into an outlet, I decided to purchase one for indoors.The video quality is excellent, audio is awesome, and the quality of the material used to manufacture the camera is decent. Unboxing and setup was a breeze (however that is to be expected when you already own existing blink products).I just have one complaint tho, and in my opinion, it’s a pretty big deal. The blink software doesn’t allow me to program a separate schedule for this indoor camera. I was hoping to record the inside of my home during the day when I’m not there. I currently limit my outdoor blink cameras to only record during the night time because I’m trying to conserve some battery life on the XT2 cameras. If I had them recording 24/7, I’m almost positive that my batteries won’t last 3 months, or anywhere near the advertised “up to 2 years”. So basically, if I want to record the inside of my home during the day, ALL of my cameras will be recording.I realize that I can just purchase another sync module and my problem would be fixed. It just sucks that I have to purchase more equipment now because of a lack of features for the scheduling options within the Blink app. This is something that could easily be addressed with a software update.I really wanted to give this product 5 stars, but until they do something about the scheduling options in the blink app, this review will stay at 3 stars. I sure hope somebody from the blink support team reads this review and does something about it!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020

Review Title: I was looking for something affordable...this was it!
Review Text: I wasn't sure when I bought this if it would be more junk or not, but I am happy to let you know this is great!I wanted something I could setup at my door looking out the window and this was perfect. For daytime use I get alerts through the app on my phone whether I am home or not and can see it. There was no subscription to anything other than just registering on the app and no fees or credit card required. You can download the clips to your phone and then upload to your pc if you want to save any clips. I just bought one because I wasn't sure how well it would do. Here are tips, If you are wanting night time this one specifically does do night and day, but if you want outdoor night time you'll need to put an outdoor one or have a decent light outside to light the area you want to secure. This is only because if you place it inside the window will cause a glare from the infrared light and the on light, but for what I wanted it works just fine with my porch light at an angle (my deck and part of my drive way shows in the dark and all my driveway and deck show in the daytime light.) Indoors it works perfectly for night/day time use and I am super impressed with the clarity of the video. For this price this is the best affordable home security you can get. The one I have (which may have different settings on the paid cloud setup) records up to 30 seconds on motion detection and has a sensitivity setting I have mine on highest and it does capture light shadow differences some but for the most part it captures cars coming and going in my neighborhood and people coming to my door. We had issues with packages disappearing and so this now makes me feel more secure that even if I am not at home or don't hear the door the camera will capture it being delivered and if someone steals it. I think I mentioned if u need to you can save clips directly to your phone from the app. App has several auto delete options or you can manually delete them before the auto deletion days come around(which is what I do). I cant say it enough this camera is awesome. It only needs wifi and power (if its not the wireless one) and the app on your phone to work. Its super easy to set up too. I had mine setup in less than a minute!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020

Review Text: at first software will not recognize the OR code....will not recognize it manually input the code number...all my other clients...pc ...camera...printers..work in my wifi but this?1 month later, I finally got around to give this a little more time with some research.Does not connect to Alexa. Or if it connects to the app on the phone, after some work, it will not be recognized on the Alexa item when asking Alexa to discover the new wifi cam. Does live and keeps feeds (10 sec) for a bit (2 weeks or so if you decide to change the settings)thanks to the price, I don't have to return it.

Review Title: The worst wifi camera I've EVER purchased

Clarity is "ok" when it actually works. Problem is, it will never consistently connect. I can open up the app and connect normally about 3/10 times. We've tried relocating the camera, relocating the wireless router, updating the camera, updating our devices, switching between ios/android, contacting support..... no resolution. Blink is such a horrible user experience.Buyer beware.UPDATE: their support saw my bad review and messaged me to try and resolve. Went through support process again and no improvement to any of my issues. And I didn’t appreciate the support persons attitude.

Review Title: Make sure you read all the details before you buy

Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2022

Review Title: Great with some room for improvement.
Review Text: I added this to my existing blink xt2 system. I was unaware it works as a standalone unit without a need for a module but it integrated into my current Blink app and system seamlessly. It said there was no additional charge for cloud storage as I already have storage included with my other blink cameras. I wanted one interior camera for the basement and the price is great for this. I have had a great experience with my other Blink cameras. Some xt2 some xt and now this mini. The setup is very easy and the image quality has been excellent. The overall system of wireless and now interior wired is very flexible. I was disappointed with the mini in two ways. First it does NOT have advanced activity zones like the Blink XT2 cameras. As this is a new unit that should have been standard. The activity zones allow you to block out specific areas so to avoid false motion alarm triggers. The advanced have more and smaller areas you can select. This is a poor oversight that I hope gets corrected. XT1 lacks this as well but those are older first generation cams. My second issue is the poor mounting design and bracket. They all use this twist lock mounting but on the mini it just feels like it could break easily. The Blink app continues to improve and allows great features not found in any other system. You can now set up routines where motion on a camera can trigger other actions such as turning on smart lights automatically. There is another where if it hears the sound of an alarm going off it will notify you. There are multiple settings to adjust sensitivity and recording length on all cams.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2020

Review Text: Good value for basic home security. There are two improvements I’d recommend for the cameras. 1) I wish I could program the cameras individually. I’d like to be able to shut off one room while keeping the others on. As it is if you shut off one you have to shut off all of them. 2) Is the length of time in recording. (30 seconds) Again, I’d like to extend the recording time on some of the cameras but 30 seconds is the limit. The lag time after the 30 seconds of recording misses the continued movement of whatever triggered it and when it picks up again it’s to late. My camera picked up a person coming to my door to ring the bell but I wasn’t home. When I didn’t answer they took my package after the 30 seconds but it wasn’t caught on the recording of them taking it. There was no proof of the theft and they denied it. No charges could be filed per police because I knew the neighbor. (We are no longer friends!) As I said it’s good for basic security but relying on it for anything more than 30 seconds of security isn’t realistic.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2022

Review Text: If you live in a household where multiple people would like to access the camera I would NOT get this. The camera is great, the picture is great, what sucks is the app to access the camera. There is no option for multiple people/logins, when I reached out to customer service their work around was to download the app on multiple devices and then share the login....with 2 factor authentication (good security feature) that means everyone accessing the system has to bother the person who set the service up to get the code every time they want to log in to see the camera, unless you share your personal email account with your whole family which I personally do not. So until this issue is fixed I can not recommend this camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020

Review Title: Great Picture- Bad Sound on Live and Cuts Off
Review Text: Starting with cons-if I am watching the camera “live” on my phone and there is background noise in my environment (even when I’m not pressing “talk” on the app), the app gives terrible sound feedback to the point where I can’t hear anything from the live feed.-watching a live feed, you have to hit a continue button after 30 seconds, every 30 seconds. Sometimes the button doesn’t even pop up and the video shuts off.-I can have full WiFi or internet at home and on my phone and the live feed will glitch or shut off randomly.-sometimes the camera live feed will give error messages where I can’t jump on to look. I have to close and reopen app about 2-10 times to get it to work.-I have had many times where nothing gets recorded all dayNow for the Pros:-decent quality video….I have been using this camera for 5 months now and every time I use it I get so mad and I just want to return it and get something a bit more expensive that is way more reliable!

Review Title: Excellent product addition from Blink. Can’t go wrong with any Blink product

They make amazing products and the app is also user friendly.. and FREE!

Review Text: After my last camera went out, i wanted one that wasn't expensive and had good quality. I still have Logic Circle and Ring cameras but by far this ones was the cheapest. Review Title: Can't Connect to existing WiFi Network w/ No Other Blink Products
Review Text: I bought the Blink Mini thinking that all it would take is set up an account on the app, plug it in, sync to my wifi network. However, that was not the case. The description and what others were saying made me think I could basically just plugin and it would work. I spent about an hour looking online but nothing mentioned that it would be so difficult just to get it connected to my existing wifi network. The setup menu kept wanting me to add it to an existing Blink network or create a new Blink Network, but I don't have any other Blink products. This is my only one. It should have given me that option.  Or made it clear that you can't do this. I reset and tried the setup again and again, but I never got the option showing and the screen shots I saw online didn't look anything like what I was getting. I don't feel the instructions mention that although you don't need a sync module it won't sync to your existing wifi network either.  So I never go it working. Shipping it back tomorrow.

Review Title: Connectivity for these cameras should be solid but it is not
Review Text: I was hoping these cameras would be good because they are way newer than the old cameras I have from a lesser known company, but honestly, they are not even close. Connections take forever to make, and very frequently, the connections fail. Especially when going directly from Amazon devices like the show or a kindle.People have suggested the wifi is not strong enough, but I literally have one of Asus' newest and most expensive routers which provides really excellent wifi at a distance, and has only improved connectivity for my other cameras, but for these cameras, it is pretty spotty if unreliable.Connectivity directly to my phone seems slightly better, but takes forever to connect if at all.You can't rely on this camera for security if this is the way it handles.I gave its 2nd star mainly because when it works, the picture is quite good and the angle is pretty wide. If I could give it 1.5 stars instead, I would have.

Review Text: I'm not sure if I'm just clueless or if it is a bad design. I cannot find a way to run a continuous live feed on this camera. The Blink Cams were basically the replacement for the Amazon Cloud Cam and I dont feel it can compete. I wish I could order another Cloud Cam. The app is easier to use and you can stream from your Alexa devices which I cannot find out how to do with the Blink. Review Text: I switched to this security camera since I was having issues with a different security camera company.  Plus, it had high number of reviews. I'm questioning the reviews now.  My last camera was Nest and they were never able to help me log back in to my account, after they merged with Google. In any case, after much hours of communicating with Nest and Google, with no solution, I canceled it. The set up of this camera was easy. Yet, I did not realize that it doesn't have a continuous record for the day, like Nest. I can't go back to a certain time with this camera. It records constantly of anything that moves for only 30 seconds. Like a flag on a windy day. We have many windy days. I would end up with tons of  30 second recordings of something blowing in the wind. Why 30 seconds? Please have it just record throughout the day and leave out the 30 seconds. Then have the option for us to choose to save a record of a certain time of pic. That's how Nest is set up. I'm not going back to Nest, though. The service experience at Nest was poor enough to not go back.This purchase was a waste of money, unless they update this, and if they do update, then the existing cameras needs to be updated. I'm not interested in wasting money again to order new ones.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021

Review Title: The better your WiFi the better the picture
Review Text: We currently have two blink cameras. So far they are working as they should. Picture quality is pretty good. However there is a lag in the notification on motion activation. As well as not capturing several seconds upon motion. So sometimes you'll miss what or who set the camera/cameras off. We have a very high quality WiFi setup. So we're pretty sure the lag is within the blink system.If it were up to me we would have ordered the black cameras. They're much less conspicuous when trying to hide them.Two way voice is pretty good. I can talk with my wife or see what our grandchildren are up to. Plus talk at the same time.We're going to add one more camera to my shop. Which is out in the back yard. Probably need to add a WiFi booster inside the shop. In order to get it to work. I'll update this review after doing so.I would recommend using this system. Yet it could have a better/faster upload upon motion detection to the phone app.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022

Review Title: 'Extended Live View' Blink Mini Subscription Plan is a Scam
Review Text: Without a subscription plan the Blink Mini app will allow only 30 seconds of continuous monitoring. With a plan, the app claims that 'Extended Live View' for 90 minutes is possible. There is a caveat:"Extended Live View (Beta) is ONLY available in Blink Basic, Blink Plus and 30-day free trials of the subscription plans. Since Extended Live View is provided as a beta release, it is subject to changes over time with some potential functionality issues. You also may not initially see this feature in your app, since we will be releasing it in phases until all qualified customers have access to it. Furthermore, there is no action required on your part until Extended Live View is accessible in your app."From an end-user's point of view, "not initially seeing this feature" means that you will be prompted every 60 seconds to 'Continue' monitoring.This is ridiculous, a classic bait-and-switch marketing tactic designed to drive subscriptions without delivering a promised option.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022

Review Title: Just ok. Can get better products for your money.
Review Text: The picture quality is good, and that’s about it.The cons are that you cannot hear anything on the video over the loud static noise. Any video we open (we have 3) it’s just a loud static filled mess. If someone talks, you can barely make it out. The night vision is good, but it never picks up movement on this night mode. It picks it up fine in regular day light mode. The cameras don’t rotate. I knew this when buying them, but it’s still a con. The app is terrible. There’s no option for a multi camera mode, so you’re having to click one, exit out, wait for it to clear, then go into another. Just slow and silly. You also have to pay for recorded video. So in my opinion, nope, it’s not worth it at all. Every con I have listed above is a key pro feature to every other model I have found for the same price. This is a low grade option with absolutely no modern features, especially for the price. You are buying a brand name, not quality with this.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2021

Review Title: Not sure yet...kinda long post here
Review Text: I like the size but it is wired and obvious so it's more like, "Hey. I'm watching you on this bright white little cube thingy that I tried to hide but can't." The picture quality is fantastic, live view is great, night vision is amazingly clear. The motion detection sometimes doesn't work. If I wake it up in the app it will come alive, but occasionally when I walk in the room it doesn't activate. That could be me being a techno-dolt.  I did not read up on one thing before I bought this: You get a 30 day free trial for the video-in-the-cloud storage, after the free trial it won't record video. Not sure if it still notifies you of movement. You have to open the app to "live view" and survey the area. The fees aren't that bad so I thought ok I'll bite, sign me up... until I found out that because Blink is an Amazon company/product or affiliate, you have to link your Amazon account to your Blink account, no exceptions. Do they share data and account info you ask? Well yes! They sure do. Uhhh no. No thank you. I'll just let my free trial run out and probably become obsessed with opening the app to live view to see if anybody else in the house is stealing my mini Diet Cokes or flopping on my couch.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2021

Review Title: Bugs out and buffers too much to be able to use
Review Text: This item is dirt!! Got it for using it with Alexa but stays on for five minutes and automatically turns off.  It buffers every few minutes and I have good internet; it also doesn’t allow multiple users to view the cam at the same time.  Alexa has a mind fart trying to find the device because it says there are multiple devices with the same name because it keeps duplicating itself smh. I will be returning this product until Amazon/blink fixes the bugs in this device.  They should just give these away for free

Review Text: Easy Set Up. I see some complaints about it being hard to set up from some self-admittedly  technically challenged people; I think they may be refering to remembering computer and home network passwords, and creating new accounts. As far as the setting up of the camera it is very easy, but I did note one confusing thing about the camera software: I could not figure-out why "arming the camera" did not result in motion detection when setting up a second phone; it was because I did not have motion detection enabled in the properties. I think that this setting was default when setting up the first phone, but not default when setting up the second phone. A pleasant suprise to me is that the system works with even a poor cell phone signal, like I have, at home. The system works totally over the Net and your home network at home but when you are away from home, as long as you are in an area with a good cell phone signal, it works with cell signal.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2021

Review Title: Don’t be fooled/ you’ll need a monthly subscription
Review Text: BEWARE! YOU WILL HAVE TO PURCHASE A $3.00 PER MONTH PER CAMERA SUBSCRIPTION AFTER YOUR FIRST MONTH IS UP. NO WHERE IN “FAQ” DO THEY TELL YOU THIS. You get motion alarm and live view for free. This means when the intruder passes in front of the camera you’ll get an alert and it will be to late by the time you try and catch him on live view. AGAIN YOU WILL NOT GET A  RECORDING ON YOUR PHONE OR DEVICE UNLESS YOU PAY AN ADDITIONAL 36 dollars a year per camera for the service.
