Review Text: I got this camera for Christmas to use in place of the monitor in my daughters room. Come to find out it doesn't work as a room monitor at all, the unit shuts off after 30 seconds unless you hit the continue button. I figured no problem, as long as it notifies me when she gets out of bed then we are good. Well, for the 30 minutes this camera worked it was good! However it spends more time offline than online! I don't have a problem with any of my other devices connecting, just this camera. It is extremely frustrating that I have had to attempt to reconnect this many, many times just today. I will be returning this and getting my money back.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020

Review Title: Frustrating Setup and Not as Good As Others
Review Text: This was a 5$ add-on to another purchase.  I would not pay full price.I have several different camera platforms including the now retired Amazon Cloud Cam.  All other camera brands like this I own are a breeze to setup (especially wyze).  First, I was very disappointed that I had to create yet another new account for the Amazon product.  Next, it struggled mightily with my wifi connectivity.I uncovered two issues with the wifi setup:First, if your wifi network is WPA2 and still allows auto negotiation to TKIP, the network will not show up in your list.  Your phone may warn you that this is "weak" security, but the camera does not-- it simply hides it.  Forcing your wifi (in my case an AP) into WPA2/AES solved the problem partially, until my second problem.Second problem was that the wifi SSID contained a dash.  Once correcting the first problem above, the WiFi network showed in the list, but with a blank name.  Manually entering the SSID caused connect failure.  Not wanting to break the other devices I had running, I ended up having to host a secondary SSID that omitted the dash.  With that it connected fine.Finally, I found the mounting for the camera horrible and cheap.  It has a simply round mounting base with a snap-over cover for the screws.  The cover cannot be removed without a small pry tool and once disconnected, it cannot be fully separated from the camera.  Instead, it hangs lose around the pivot point.  The end result is that to mount the camera with the provided screws on the wall requires you to hold the screw, the camera AND this silly ring out of the way.  A magnetic base or exposed screws through the base would've been better or easier.  If they were worried about somebody easily stealing it and therefore hid the screws, this seems a waste: the base is cheap plastic and could be snapped off the wall by a toddler.  In fact, once secured with its screws I stretched the USB cable a bit to remove slack and caused the whole camera to lean significantly.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021

Review Text: While I like the ease of use of the app and the camera, it just doesn’t work very well. I’ve unplugged it over and over trying to reset it and have also set the sensor to the maximum sensitivity and it still doesn’t catch people walking by. It will catch most of the people, but not all. My father has dementia and I purchased this camera to make sure he wasn’t getting up and wandering. Yesterday he got up, walked right past the camera with his walker and had the door open and was trying to go out! My son and I both ran downstairs, (we heard the walker) we ran by the camera and got my father back to his room (all 3 of us walking by it again) and it didn’t record or even see ANY of it. I have a Wyze camera upstairs that will catch even my little bichon walking by and alert me and so I will be ordering another one of those to replace this. Tiny. Inconspicuous. Nice looking. Convenient. But it just doesn’t work very well
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2020

Review Text: Great little camera- highly recommendI’ve got like 10 of them and I’m gonna order more, can’t beat them for the priceI mixed and matched these are the plug in kind and then the black are the wireless, both are great and can zoom in and your able to hear everything clearlyDefinitely worth the moneyDownfall for the wireless is the battery replacement I like mine full blast and picking up everything so the batteries die quickly I’ve got a bunch of kids and animals and people staying with me so the amount of traffic is ridiculous but it’s still they last a few months before they die on the highest setting which is picking up birds and lizards and bugs and thunderstorms lol I can even hear people arguing from inside the house on the outside camerasI live in a very rural area with the worst internet and the wireless works fine at my gate which is a couple hundred feet away
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020

Review Text: These Blink products were always a scam to get you to subscribe to their cloud services. Without a cloud subscription these are completly useless.  Unless you can get the real-time alert, pull out your phone, unlock your phone, navigate to the app and attempt to view the live-view footage all within the 20 second time frame. I don't think there is a person on the planet that can randomly do that.  Best case scenario you're already in the Blink app on your phone when the alert comes through and you 'MAY' get a quick glimpse of the live-view footage.These are disposible cameras, they will not work after aprox 1 year of use.  You've been warned.If you are looking for a tempoary camera that will be trash after 1 year and don't mind paying a monthly/yearly subscription for Amazon's Blink cloud services, this 'might' be the camera for you.Good luck to you though, I personally regret every single thing I've purchased that is of the Blink brand.  So far that includes Blink Mini, Blink XT2, and the newer Blink outdoor cameras, and the Blink Outdoor 3rd Gen Floodlight.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2022

Review Title: An above average camera on the cheap
Review Text: What the Blink Mini does best is provide a cheap security camera from a reputable company (not another fly-by-night operation, but rather from the devil-you-know). From the audio quality (input and output) to the picture and video, everything is fairly standard; kinda cheap, but a good value.For the first year, you also get free online storage, but there isn’t a local storage option [yet]. If you did want to store video at home, there will be an accessory you can buy to back it up, but you can’t throw an SD card in there and call it a day.The delay, even over a robust network with low latency, has about 4 seconds of delay and a lot of dropped data when there is significant motion. That’s just in live view in my experience (I never check the recordings) but that should be addressed quickly on Blink’s part.I’ve seen worse from this price range, but overall I’m satisfied, provided the video stability is improved.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020

Review Text: I like the camera itself. The picture is good night or day. Captures motion and has different settings to adjust for that. The alert for motion is pretty quick. Plugs in so no worries about changing or charging batteries. Connected to existing system but it only gave me 30 days free cloud when the system it was connected to has free cloud so was told any camera added to the system would also have free cloud. It doesn’t. I have an sd card so I can still record motion, I just cant record live views. There is no continuous viewing which is annoying at times. Sometimes shadows can set of the motion sensor. The app is pretty good. There are many different settings and you can zoom in and out. Cameras load up quick for viewing. Quick alerts. It’s easy to scroll through saved videos. Deleting videos is a snap. I just wish I could mark some videos as favorites or something. A great companion to the Blink line of cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2021

Review Title: Awesome cameras, night vision is bad.
Review Text: We ordered 6 of these to replace some other brand outdoor cameras that were giving us issues.I bought them during prime day when they were on sale.These have been great during the day. They always capture motion and we pay for the save function.I actually installed these under the eves outside my home where they are protected from rain and they are wonderful.The down side is that the night vision is bad. If what you are watching is close, it’s okay. But anything like watching over a back yard, the picture quality and night vision is junk. The IR light also attracts a lot of bugs, which brings spiders. The spiders form webs on the camera, and I have to clear them off often.But. I had issues with two camera cords. Reached out to customer service, and they replaced the cords free of charge, no questions asked. That’s hard to beat with companies these days.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2021

Review Text: I got the wired camera in hopes of having a constant stream to monitor. But, nope. And the IR on 2 of 4 cameras is no longer working. I heard a "high-pitched" sound and then the screen went all grey (after dark) now it only shows a distorted grey image when in IR mode. I have enough light sources in one area that I can still view the camera. I still have the free trial on the storage which was a 30-day trial, so that tells you how long I have had the camera. On my old baby monitor camera, the IR lasted longer. Gave 3 stars for the pic quality, (sunny) day view is clear.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2021

Review Text: We purchased our first Blink Home Security Camera July of 2018. We were going out of the country and wanted to make sure our 18 year old son closed the garage door and locked the house. It did the job and we felt better knowing while on the other side of the world we could monitor our home.The following Summer we were so happy with our indoor system, we decided to purchase 2 outdoor cameras with the 2 way audio, and were so happy with the video and audio quality, we bought another add on outdoor camera, the next month.A year later we found the mini indoor cameras. We have one for a child's bedroom and one for the playroom. The video and audio quality is great.A year after that we bought another 3 outdoor Cameras, again video and audio quality is great.Just before Christmas 2021 Blink came out with the doorbell camera, and we purchased it. One, because it was blink and 1/2 the price of a ring doorbell camera. Two, because the doorbell that came with our new build home was so quiet, we couldn't ever hear the bell ring.In total we now have...3 Indoor battery powered2 Indoor mini corded power6 Outdoor battery powered1 doorbell wired to exciting doorbell.Cameras purchased...July 17th, 2018Blink Indoor Home Security Camera System with Motion Detection, HD Video, 2-Year Battery Life and Cloud Storage Included - 3 Camera Kithttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B018HC6PVA/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_E4N35AJJXM4QAYYN1S03?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1July 15th, 2019Blink XT2 Outdoor/Indoor Smart Security Camera with cloud storage included, 2-way audio, 2-year battery life – 2 camera kithttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B07MN67BCR/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_2VZV3YZ7F3X4F5WSF9SF?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1August 20th, 2019Blink XT2 Outdoor/Indoor Smart Security Camera with cloud storage included, 2-way audio, 2-year battery life – Add-on camera for existing Blink customershttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B07M8DTHGL/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_7XGZ93G8PTGGNHTNBGEK?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1November 22nd, 2020Blink Mini – Compact indoor plug-in smart security camera, 1080 HD video, night vision, motion detection, two-way audio, Works with Alexa – 2 camerashttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B07X27VK3D/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_dl_0CVS1GZCPQPJE577M0JV?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1August 3, 2021Blink Outdoor - wireless, weather-resistant HD security camera, two-year battery life, motion detection, set up in minutes – 3 camera kithttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B086DKSHQ4/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_dl_9F09K8M142MATNJY1C7P?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1November 29th, 2021Introducing Blink Video Doorbell | Two-way audio, HD video, motion and chime app alerts and Alexa enabled — wired or wire-free (Black)https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08SG2MS3V/ref=cm_sw_r_apan_glt_i_dl_JTH38J37N7ST707FMW4P?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1Blink offers two subscription plans.1 Blink device$3 per month or $30 annuallyUnlimited Blink devices$10 per month or $100 annuallyYou do not have to have a Blink Subscription if you do not choose to, but you won't be able to store videos.With the subscription you are even able to share your videos by text, or email. To neighbors, Friends, Family, and even the police department.Cons/irritationsWhen an outdoor camera faces the sun at any point of the day, the motion detection will go off, until you adjust the motion activity spots in the camera settings. This can take a few days to work out the kinks.Indoor mini cameras the motion activity spots don't always work. Sometimes it will go off when there is motion in the grayed out zones, and sometimes not go off in the non-greyed out zones. This maybe human error on our part. We are looking for a longer cord for the mini's to mount on the wall or ceiling.  The are options to rotate the camera view, so that you are able to mount the camera wherever you need.Overall we are happy with our Blink system and hope the company continues to grow and come out with new products.Compared to my parents very very expensive Arlo system, Blink is more reliable, and is more cost-effective. So much so, my parents have ditched the Arlo camera system and have purchased a new Blink system.We highly recommend Blink to anyone who would like to have a home video camera system that works, and won't break the bank.We love that you can start out small and work your way in to as much as you want/need.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022

Review Title: I have 3. Put some research into it &don’t let a sale fool you-like it did me 😟
Review Text: There is so many things you have to play around with to get it to work everyday and every light change. It also won’t show out a window if you don’t shut night mode off when it’s dark (even if it’s well lit outside) but then if it’s daylight and you don’t flip the night mode back on auto it won’t pick up anything at all, inside or out but even if you do that sometimes it switches back off and you miss 12 hours of monitoring if you weren’t paying really close attention that no alerts were coming in. I also have a really hard time getting it to connect to live mode. The first week it worked fine, now it just stops. No reason. Didn’t touch a thing. Just nothing and no matter what you do nothing fixes it until minutes or hours later it’ll just do it. As far as the sensitivity, sometimes a snowflake or a gnat flying by will set it off. Other times, for 8 hours someone moved Next to me and nothing (also while I was on vacation someone came into my house, took 3 delivered Christmas present bags I had put in my bedroom the day before I left for vacation and they used the restroom, left a key lay in the middle of the floor and who knows what else and I didn’t get one single alert!!! I didn’t know about it until I got home and started to wrap the Christmas presents and realized 3 of my grandkids gifts were gone so I started piecing things together (the key, the toilet etc). It feels so violating & that was the main reason I got it! To feel safe!! I also wanted to be able to watch my car and front door from my bedroom, especially if someone were to knock or something so I could see if it was for my door before going and so that I could hear them all the way in my room but this thing will only stay on about 30 seconds without you having to click the continue button that comes up. It stays on longer on Echo Show (not much) but it records it the entire time & you don’t have a whole lot of room to begin with to save videos without having to subscribe to something-that I haven’t figured out yet but what’s the point of it won’t do what it’s supposed to anyway! Not to mention, you can change how long it will save your videos without starting to automatically deleting them. You maximum time you can choose to save them is 60 days! WT..???? Half the time I probably wouldn’t even know I needed to look at something for longer than that! Like if I forgot where I put something on my birthday last year? Maybe I could look at the videos & see if it caught where I put it (like a pair of earrings I only wear on special occasions). Or if someone took something (that is if it actually worked like it should) but it was something like a firestick or game consol you only use when you have guests or the grandkids are over so it might have been 6 months since you used it last. I don’t know what all to say. I mean, overall I like the concept but it just isn’t for me. I’m going to have to send them back and try a different brand all together. Try your luck if you want. I would think I just got a bad one but I got 3 of them and even though I opened them up at the same time, I bought them at different times so they didn’t even come from the same batch! Such a disappointment 😞 I was looking forward to it above everything else and I haven’t even told you the entire list of problems. It really was a crushing disappointment.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2021

Review Text: If you are looking specifically for motions detection - keep looking. While the video is decent quality, getting them at the right time is impossible as far as I can tell. I have 2 minis inside the house looking out through a window, so there is no point in leaving them armed overnight as the IR would just reflect from the window. But once I disarm them, rearming them is extremely flaky. Sometimes it took hours or days before the camera would start taking videos again. I reached out to Customer Service and discovered that "24/7" promise is fiction. I sat on hold for a little while and then got a "no one is available, please leave your phone number for a return call" message. I left my phone # but have NOT received a call and that was 3 days ago. The sync module only picks up the videos from the cloud once a day, and I am sure not paying a monthly fee for something that works so poorly. So it's all going back.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2022

Review Title: Not worth it. Amazon uses this device to generate revenue through services they charge you to use.
Review Text: You can't access the camera via IP using web interface. You can't store images or videos locally. You have to sign up for Amazon's storage account, and then they nag  you about upgrading to their "subscription service." Blech. This is just a cheap device Amazon sells to generate more money through their service or storage. With this device you have no option but to use Amazon's storage and service. Ick. It only take short clips, and turns off if you keep the video display live on your phone for more than a moment or two. I didn't bother sending this back...I just threw it in the trash.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2020

Review Text: I was looking for cameras to install in my garage and shed. I already had the Blink outdoor cameras and have mostly been happy with those, so I figured I'd go with the Blink Mini. I wish I could say I was happy with that decision, but, unfortunately I am not.The setup is easy and it's easy to add a camera to an existing Blink system. The app is extremely okay and VERY limited. You can't have different schedules for different cameras. They all have to be armed or disarmed by schedule. Communication betwixt the app and the cameras is extraordinarily slow, even with fiber internet.The biggest problem I have with the minis is the motion detection. The cameras have no problem detecting a piece of dust falling from the ceiling, or maybe a moth flying around. But a person walking around in my shed or garage for over an hour? It doesn't detect that at all. I've set the sensitivity to max, changed the IR controls multiple times, but nothing helps. It's not much of a security camera if it doesn't detect people.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022

Review Text: Unfortunately I was unable to setup the camera. After going through the setup process the camera was unable to find my wifi. I tried reseting my modem and reseting the camera with no luck. The next day I figured that I would try again, which I kept getting an error message that the camera could not be connected to cloud. I  gave up and decided to return it when an option was given to contact Amazon support.The Amazon support agent was on hold for a long time waiting for a Blink support agent so I told him that I will try again another day.  The Amazon support agent gave me Blink support number which I tried calling twice the next day.  After waiting on hold for awhile both times I was told that an agent was not available and to leave a message.I decided to return the camera. Too many problems for something that I just received.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2021

Review Text: I setup this camera in my living room so I could monitor my dogs, son and wife from my office on an Alexa Show. I'm extremely disappointed in both of Amazons devices.The camera itself has two way voice, night vision and motion alerts and is compatible with Alexa. Those are positives. However, when viewing the camera on my phone or alexa device, it times out after 60 seconds and returns to the home screen. I want to use this for long term active monitoring, not "checking it occasionally". This is frustrating. So if you're planning on using this as a baby monitor or security device, find something else.Sometimes when giving alexa a command to check the camera, it simply wont connect. This is not a problem with my wifi or anything, it's just bad software on amazons part. When checking the camera on my phone, it takes forever to connect and when it times out after 60 seconds and the video stops, hitting the play button crashes the app.Being frustrated with the Alexa Show and the Blink camera, I tried to find software to view the camera from my PC. It doesn't exist. People will reply that I can use an android emulator program and load the phone app on my computer inside of that, but you end up running into all of the same problems as the phone app.The alexa show itself has minimal features and very few customization options and settings. I expected so much more. The hardware itself is great, the speaker sounds good, the screen is bright, clear and sensitive to touch, but amazons software and it's unintuitive design is off putting.It's 2021 and these devices are capable of so much more, it's a shame to see them fail so miserably at such simple tasks.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2021

Review Text: I bought 4 of these to put around the house and have had them for about a week now. Nice compact cameras with a decent app and everything basically works as advertised, but I have a few issues:1) The biggest one is that motion detector range is very poor. You basically have to be close and in center of the camera to have the motion detector trigger a warning.2) Another thing I observed was that after a camera for unplugged accidentally, it took 30 minutes before notification. That seems highly undesirable from a security monitoring perspective.3) I have had a few false positive triggers. No observable movement and something about start of dusk triggers it in one room.4) As many other people pointed out, the 30 second limit on live view is quite annoying if I want to use it to monitor my baby.Still trying to decide whether I want to keep them or return and buy something higher quality for a few extra bucks. I bought the minis as well as the outdoor cameras during prime day sale (haven’t received the latter yet) and like the idea of having a single system.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020

Review Title: Locked in, requries subscription and the cord already broke.
Review Text: If you buy this you are giving away any ability to use this camera on your own. It requires a subscription to have it store the files to Amazon's cloud, worse, they give no option to do this on your own. Instead they 'generously' offer to sell you a hub that you can only plug a USB stick into to record the videos. Of course, you can't use it to stream that video somewhere else, nor can you view that stored data remotely from your choice of application.The icing on the cake, the cord broke after about 5 days of use and moving only 3 times. It's simply a micro-b so I swapped it out, but it doesn't give me confidence in the product listing.To be fair to the product the camera quality fairly good for the price, night vision is only so-so but it is nice for the price, motion detection is pretty terrible but again for the price it is nice to have something. However, I can't access and store my videos anywhere useful.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2020

Review Text: My 92 year old mom wants to stay in her own home.  She has Life Alert in case she falls or has other emergency. But we want to look in on mom with our phones. These wired cameras are great.  Bought them around Mother's day and got 25% off.  Got two boxes of two.  About $35 each. The wire is very easy to hide.  I used some Command Clear Wire clips and they stick well. Camera in top corner of each room gives great view even through open doorways.  "Push to talk" system is great and she can hear them well if TV is not on. EXCELLENT PRODUCT THANKS AMAZON!Blessings,John 20:29
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020

Review Text: So far 3 have purchased 3 blink minis and they work great for keeping an eye on the house / pets while I’m away. The live view from the app and cloud recording is nice. Blink sells the sync module 2 that lets you store recordings locally if you want that option. The cloud storage is free for 30 days from when you activate your new camera and then it’s subscription based. With 4K becoming mainstream i would hope future blink minis come with higher resolution. The night vision works great and so does motion detection. The app allows you to adjust sensitivity for motion and intensity of the infrared for night vision. One other thing to note is these require 2.4Ghz Wi_Fi so in the future it would be nice when blink starts to support 5ghz networks  The last thing to note is this is as easy as plugging in a usb cable and the setting it up with an app. You can move them around etc and all you need is power.  Very happy with these.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2021

Review Title: Poor Movement Capture + Watching Live is NOT Continuous
Review Text: I bought multiple Mini's for my pet reptiles and I like them... somewhat. The video quality is good both day/night and I've never had any connection problems. The issues I have with it are about the Live viewing and the motion detection.****I would like to note that I don't know if my issues stem from the cameras themselves or from Blink's software****My issue with the Live feed is that you can only view it for 30 seconds at a time. Sure, I could continuously click "Continue", but that means I have to constantly watching for the popup and I feel that I shouldn't have to do this with an outlet powered camera. It doesn't say this anywhere on the product page and the only time you will see this information is when you're already looking for a solution.My issue with the motion detection is that either the sensitivity of it isn't sensitive enough or that it only works well until a certain distance away. This is a problem because it's supposed to be recording my reptiles but I'm only getting a handful of recordings a day for the entire day. I first thought the motion detection just wasn't sensitive enough because I only get about a handful of recordings a day and they're usually when the animals are pretty close to the camera. While my reptiles may be a bit slower moving than a human, they're definitely not so slow that the camera wouldn't capture them moving around their enclosures. Now I'm wondering if the motion detection only works well a short distance away from the camera. I've noticed that not only are of all the recordings I get *up close*, they're also all of the same area per enclosure and never past a certain point. (Note: I'm only monitoring the interior of the enclosures which are up to 4ft away from the camera max.)
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2021

Review Title: The cameras are hit or miss. But tech support is garbage.
Review Text: The cameras themselves were not the biggest problem. I know two people that have these cameras and they don’t have problems, but my cameras motion detection did not work. Sometimes it would catch motion other times it would not. For instance, I would take my dog out and walk in front of the camera for 15 minutes and it would pick up none of it. Can you believe that? 15 minutes walking in front of the camera and no motion detection. Big problem. But I wouldn’t be writing this review if tech-support would’ve addressed the issue. After countless emails and multiple tech-support reps, they all said the same thing and were not helpful. They kept telling me I just needed to delete the cameras and re-add them, that I needed to update the app, I need to reboot my phone, and then finally they’re like “oh it’s your Wi-Fi that’s the problem.” I knew this wasn’t the case so I put my brothers 2 cameras, which are the exact same type of cameras, blink minis, and I put them in the exact same spot on the exact same Wi-Fi and they work perfectly fine. I tried to tell tech-support that I knew it was not a Wi-Fi issue because I know other peoples cameras work fine and even told them that I put my brothers cameras in the exact same spot on the exact same Wi-Fi. I even told them that my brothers cameras are working on the same Wi-Fi in the same spot and were working without a problem. But the tech support wasn’t helpful just told me the same thing over and over again, obviously unaware of the fact that doing the same thing over and over is akin to insanity. Finally, exasperated and angry that tech-support would not help me, I realized I was still in the return window and so I am returning the cameras. Thanks for nothing tech-support.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2021

Review Title: Be advised - not for baby monitor
Review Text: Overall, it's a great camera, but not for use in a child's room.We have an older toddler and wanted to move away from a baby monitor, and thought this would be a great substitute.  We wanted something just to check in on him periodically, but not a constant live feed.  We also wanted something with motion detection (because he's still learning to use the potty during the night.)It works great for the motion detection, because he is already awake, but noticed that whenever we would check in on him, his eyes would open and he would look at the camera.  After further investigation, when you use the live look in feature, the camera itself makes a horribly loud clicking noise, then clicks again when you end.  Our son is a light sleeper, so it would wake him every single time.I would give this 5 stars if it were used for anything else besides a toddler monitor, but I can't because it is a very bad option for this.  We had to use the cameras in different parts of the house, and buy a whole new camera system for his room.So please be advised if you plan on using this as a baby monitor.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020

Review Title: Not what I need it for.
Review Text: If you want to have continuous live view this isn't for you. Picture is ok but grainy especially at night. You get about 5 minutes of viewing with the echo show 8 then it cuts out. That may be the echo show that cuts it out but using the app you get a notification to keep viewing every 30 seconds or it cuts out. So do not buy this to continuously view or for security or for a baby/child/pet monitor because it won't work. We will probably return this and buy another camera that will work with Alexa.Update: this camera continously shuts off and loses connection. Now it just stays offline. Total waste of money. No slot for memory card either. It's basically just a shelf ornament now.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2021

Review Text: Extremely disappointing. The infrared night vision works only if a person is no more than one to two feet away from the camera.  In contacting Blink, they say this is an ongoing issue and that they are “working on a fix” for it. In checking the Blink blogs, I see that this issue for this particular camera has been ongoing since April 2020 —I am writing this review in late September 2020.Daytime detection is OK. But, only up to about 20 feet maximum— You need to set up multiple cameras to see your entire room. – – Another disappointment. If you are considering this camera, be aware that you are not going to get any useful night vision, which to me, is the most important feature. Blink says they have no idea when a fix is expected.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2020

Review Title: Okay camera with spotty recording that now requires a subscription.
Review Text: The camera recorded okay the first month but then would record sporadically. I have it in my front window to record the front of my house. Sometimes it would record people walking up to the house but other times, people would get all the way to my front door without recording. I missed the return window or I would have sent this back. Now Blink wants to charge a subscription fee. When I bought this camera in January, it offered free recording, viewing and storage. Now the only thing that I can do with this camera is watch live views. A complete waste of money.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2021

Review Title: So far -- not impressed with quality of the product or customer support
Review Text: I had a brand new one that I've had for one month and noticed that the status lights were blinking on it today.  The blink app showed that it was offline.  I could not get it reconnect at all.  Removed and tried to re-add, no luck.  Reset button on the bottom, no luck, it just stopped talking to Wi Fi for some reason.  I've got 4 other XTs that I have had for 4 or more years and they are working just fine.What should have been a quick call to support to get a new one turned into a waste of time dealing with support personnel that can only read from a script.  I ran through the nonsense on the phone up to a point where I finally told them "Look, this is a month old and I am not wasting any more time with your script -- send me a new one."  They finally agreed to do this, but then told me that the new might do it to since it "could be my network"  Odd, I have four other cams that are working just fine and about 25 other devices that are working just fine.  This camera was working just fine up to the point that it died.Supposedly a new one is the mail -- we'll see.I have heard that blink support was a JOKE but I never had to deal with them until today.  I can confirm that it is indeed a joke.  I hope that I never have to deal with them again.  We wasted more time and MONEY  troubleshooting a 20 dollar camera than the product is worth.  Amazon bought this company -- they should fire all customer support immediately and take that support on in-house.  It can't get worse.Further, I am not too impressed with this camera that died 30 days in.... does not bode well.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2021

Review Text: To be clear, for the price difference between this camera and its competition, I am very happy with the product, there are just a few quirks.When it switches to night vision almost every night I get a "motion detected" notification. Now I am used to it and when I get the notification at a certain time I'm pretty sure thats what it is, but it was very unnerving at first.Also, every morning I need to "disarm" and re-"arm" the camera. If I do not the motion detection is not as effective.Overall, I was looking for something for my new apartment, because I have heard horror stories, and I just want to know if the landlord is entering my apartment when he is not supposed to be. Blink definitely serves that purpose.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020

Review Text: SECOND UPDATE: I ordered a two-pack to ensure I had monitoring in more areas of my house. Setup was so much easier this time. Since I already had the app and another camera already set up, once I plugged these in a notification came up on my phone that another camera was detected. Adding it was a breeze.UPDATE: After multiple attempts, I finally sent the camera back. Blink customer service reached out after seeing my original review. They sent a replacement camera immediately. Setup for the camera worked seamlessly this time around. The first camera was a dud but the second one turned on and connected 1-2-3.ORIGINAL REVIEW: I thought it would be a good idea to have an indoor camera but this isn’t the one, unfortunately. Plugged it in, followed the directions but never saw a blinking light. Troubleshooted but still nothing. Sending it back. At the end of the day, you get what you pay for and at this price point, it’s a toss-up if the device will work.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2021

Review Text: Hard to get working from the inside looking out. Infrared light needs to be turned off to work due to glass reflection. This defeats being able to see at night, making it somewhat useless. Very clear during the day. Motion sensor can be set for different sensitivity settings, which works relatively well. It seems to pick up motion that's very close, and very far away, but not in between. Odd. My beef is with the app. I needed to see my camera quickly because of a noise I heard and the app had randomly signed me out. I had to enter my user credentials, and then enter a 2 step verification code before I could view my cameras. Not cool. I think I prefer the Amazon cloud cams to these. I have 3 that still work well and I never get logged out of the app. I'm going to keep working on making these work better for my needs, but if the app keeps logging me out, I will probably return them.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022

Review Title: Decent camera, but not great for nursery/kid's rooms
Review Text: I purchased a two-pack of these cameras to put in our nursery and our other daughter's bedroom to replace the Amazon Cloud Cams (which we loved but the app started crapping out and Amazon no longer provided support).The picture quality is clear on these cameras but they are not continuously recording like the Cloud Cams were. I recognized this would be a difference when I bought the camera but what I didn't anticipate was how loud the "click" would be when the cameras started recording. It's pretty loud -- loud enough to wake up and/or draw the attention of small kids. When you're trying to just peek in on your kid while they're sleeping, it's a bit counterproductive to have that "click" wake them up.The other issue we had was the briefness of the clips. We used to enjoy pulling the Cloud Cam up on a TV and keep an eye on the kids while we watched something else but these cameras only stay live for about 1 minute before they click off and you have to ask Alexa to show XXXX's room again.The picture quality was great and they were a breeze to install so, if your application is different, these would probably be great cameras. They just didn't work for us.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2021

Review Title: stopped working within 5 months - but sent replacement once I found their contact info
Review Text: UPDATE : I finally received a response to a couple of the multiple requests I made to the Blink folks. Oin one, during a phone call to a technician, it was determined my camera had a bug in the software or hardware. They promised to ship me a replacement and asked if I’d return the bad one.  Did and done and it’s working fine.However, at some point in time the folks at Blink got their wires crossed and sent me a second camera.  Kept it as a reward for all the time & effort I expended.  New cameras BOTH working fine.not certain it can be repaired....  it appears the company expects customers to figure out and share tips on on community boards on their website.  Very disturbing.  Will update IF the company responds to my request for assistance, but looks to me like they’re global and they put all customer correspondance in a huge inbox that includes the globe and all of their many products.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020

Review Title: Can't recommend, but it has very good picture quality
Review Text: I can't recommend it at all. Got it about 3 days ago, setup was easy, packaging was good, the cable is nice and long. The quality of the item cable charger and even the plug in the back is good. The app is barbones but work good. There is no scrubbing or heat map on the main interface, which is a shame. I set it on my back yard last night to see if any animals are getting into my ducks, but this morning there is nothing stored. Maybe I did t arm it? But why would a camera need arming?? I currently have a nexht that is priced at about $25 and I think it's a superior product. It has an sdcard and option for cloud storage and an ip camera option to integrate to an existing dvr system. I don't care for cloud storage, I have a lot of sdcard and can manage my network just fine. Not having a recording option without a $35 accessory is a big no nooooo. We know the camera has  full server built in, so storing data on an sdcard is nothing for a camera. I won't be returning, but I won't be buying anything else. I included a photo from camera in front of a window.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2021

Review Text: I bought two of the indoor minis. One camera magically set itself on a schedule to turn off during the day, but without a record of it so it can’t be changed. The other did not. I’ve been going back and forth with customer service for about a month and a half with no fix in sight. They insist my camera is on an “unknown” network even though I can see that both cameras are on my network. My dad said he had the same issue and he had to put his app on his wife’s phone to fix it. I don’t have this option. So I would suggest not wasting your money on this brand. Also, this is the Amazon/Alexa/Ring brand. It is only partially compatible with Google/Nest. I would suggest sticking with one line of products instead of making the mistake of mixing like I did.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020

Review Text: Update:I’m so over these cameras.We have good internet so that’s not the issue. But the app is always crashing or it’s a failed live view connection. ALL THE TIME. It’s freaking annoying. And I feel like it’s just gotten worse the longer we’ve had them and it hasn’t been that long.They are alright if you don’t expect a solid connection all the time but if you want something more reliable, I wouldn’t use these.Original Review:Okay, let me start by saying - it’s a pretty decent camera. I do like it. It gets a basic job done.My only dislike really is that you cannot continually watch the video feed without having to hit “continue” every 60 seconds. As someone who has a kid, this is a frustrating feature. I knew that buying it and it doesn’t sound bad at first. But the longer you have it and you find how you want to use it, this is actually pretty annoying.I just wish that they would update the software to be able to watch for longer sets of time. Other than that, it’s a good starter set of security cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020

Review Text: Completely useless and technical help is slim to none!REWIND!!!! Technical help went above and beyond! I was really distraught and they stayed on me until all my issues were resolved.The mini camera. I can't say enough about this camera. I like it better than the indoor/outdoor blink camera. Setup was a breeze, you would have to be dead to not be able to get it connected. It is super clear, and has a wide scope. I'm not a 100% sure, but I think this camera starts recording as soon as there is sound which enables, for me, a better viewing. Usually it would start recording once motion has been detected. If the motion is fast enough, you get a blur. This mini camera comes one once noise has been detected. For instance, when one of my family members is coming home and puts their key in the door to unlock it, the camera would start recording. When I am viewing it, I am thinking why did this clip get saved until I see the door open and they walk through it. Very impressed with it!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020

Review Text: My 13 year old hangs out with the local skater kids. I’m thinking one of them “invited” themselves in when we were gone. That night I looked on Amazon and read reviews until my head hurt, and landed on the Blink mini WiFi , I did read a few reviews on them that weren’t flattering, but the good ones out weighed the bad. I ordered  3 of them. One in living room, dining room and one for my leather shop. Set up was easy, linking them was really easy. What I love about them, being able to talk through them, hear what’s going on. Oh and the night vision, I dig it 100%.  Works awesome in 0 light.well enough to turn footage over to 5-0 if the time ever comes. One thing, and I mean one thing, that I wish it were able to do is be able to see all 3 cameras on one screen. Doesn’t bother me enough to break up with Blink, just wish it did, switching between cameras takes a few seconds. Oh, btw, when watching a camera live view, it is a continuous stream I would highly recommend this security camera system.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2021

Review Title: Use Blink customer service for these.
Review Text: I purchased these for indoor use. After setting up the first of the 2 camera system I was pleasantly surprised. The picture quality was remarkably clear. The 2nd camera, however, had a really bad focus problem so I contacted Amazon customer service for an exchange. I was told (via online chat) that an exchange was not available so I would have to opt for a discount or refund of my purchase costs. I chose the refund. I decided I would just go ahead and look at the Amazon site and found that the item IS, in fact, available. I reluctantly ordered the system again (hoping for a better experience) as I really liked the 1st camera that I had set up. I just don't like that I was lied to about the exchange availability.Update - Blink customer service has taken care of the issue to my satisfaction. I have changed my rating from 3 to 5 stars to reflect it. These are great cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020

Review Text: I have an outdoor cam with floodlight and 2 indoor cams and 1 sync module. The cams are good, they do have great picture and the motion detection works great. There is a couple of short comings though. The first short coming is that the cams do not prerecord like others brands do. The second is, you cannot schedule each cam separately. I would like the outdoor cam to arm earlier than the indoor cams. With the current configuration I have to setup all cams on the same schedule which means I have to schedule for late night which renders my floodlights useless until the schedule arms or set the schedule earlier which captures all activities inside and I end up with 20, 30 or more junk videos. I don't want a bunch of sync modules plugged in and showing up in my routers wifi clients just to schedule different cams for different times. The schedule routine is already there in the app, it seems that it would be and easy programming task to enable the schedule for each cam. All of my other wifi devices do it. I need about 3 more outdoor cams with floodlights but I am reluctant to purchase any more because of this issue. This is disappointing and it seems to me that it is just a ploy to sell more product (sync modules). If this is the case, I will go back to a DVR security system and abandon the Blink system.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2022

Review Text: I love my blink camera system! Have recommended it to many family and friends and have bought them as gifts this mini camera to me is totally useless! It's in the house and I like to check my temperature settings very important feature that all of the other cameras have to check for too cold and busted pipes too hot and a fire! Totally worthlessUPDATE thanks to the blink team I have found the new and improved indoor blink camera and it does have the temperature on it. I had moved one of my outdoor cameras out and put this one in my basement I rely on the temperature feature down there last winter I checked the temp and it was 80 and I have the gas log fireplace set to 50 what happened is the remote control started the fireplace logs and the batteries died and never turn them back off so thanks to my blink camera for alerting me to that problem I love my blink cameras I just love them
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2021

Review Title: It's Good When It Actually Works
Review Text: I've had this blink mini for 4 months now. Several times, not a couple of times, the device is completely frozen. You can pass in front of it several times and it will not activate and record. This is especially true if it has been on overnight. You have to shut down or unplug from wall to reset it. When it does work it is great but not sure why it freezes.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2021

Review Text: I really like these cameras for the price.  I bought the two pack to test them out and bought another two pack since they are nice cameras.  I need one more to cover all the rooms in my house since I take care of my 90 year old mother and like to check in on her while at work or not at home.The cameras are extremely easy to set up and I was able to let my brothers and sister sign in to see the cameras as well.  I've owned multiple other cameras and while they were okay to set up, these were just a breeze.  They were set up and running in under 5 minutes.  The only annoying thing about set up was I had to enter the password for my wi-fi for each camera.  You'd think once the password for wifi was in, you'd be done entering it.  That's not a huge deal but just slightly annoying!Love the cameras but the one draw back is the software!  The software is made for battery operated cameras but these are plug in.  They should have had a different software package for these cameras.  The software is, well, the only way I can put it is lousy which is sad because they are great cameras.  You can only view one camera at a time and that shuts down after a very brief live view.  You should be able to just watch a live view without it constantly shutting down.  I understand why this would be for battery operated cameras but definitely not for plug in cameras!  I'm hoping they write new software for a totally different camera than they've put out previously.  It only makes sense!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020

Review Title: Don't like the ongoing subscription fee
Review Text: Edit: changing my initial review because now unless I buy a subscription plan my videos won't record. What's the point of this camera then? That was never specified at the time of purchase so a little disappointing. If I needed it for longer or if i was dependant on this camera as a security camera I would probably get something else that you don't have to pay an ongoing fee for..I have to say I'm very impressed by this little camera after the initial unboxing and set up. It has a sleek design, very easy to download the blink app and easy to follow instructions with the set up. I got this camera for the motion detection aspect of it and automatic alert to help with potty training my dogs. They love to sneak away and go potty on the puppy pads instead of asking to go outside. I have it set up in their potty spot so I can instantly take them out when motion is detected. So far so good. When motion is detected it instantly sends an alert to my phone. The picture is very clear, even at night with only a lamp turned on. It also records video and gives plenty of settings to personalize it how you want. Great for the price, very happy so far. Will update my review if needed.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2020

Review Text: UPDATE. I am very happy, I just got the guidance from BlinkTeam customer support, and they walked me trought, and got the camera working neatly!! So, I must admit and review all over my previous review (sounds like a riddle).Five stars!!!!PD. This is my previous reviewHello. I've had one of the worst experiences ever!!! Review Title: No continuous live viewing. 30 seconds max.
Review Text: You can't watch a live feed without an annoying notification popping up every 30 seconds. If you don't click continue, it shuts off the camera.  I'm sending it back. You can use an old cell phone for free with Alfred Camera and watch as long as you want.  There are plenty of other cameras on the market that don't force this limitation.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2021

Review Text: I was "upgrading" (or so I thought) from Yi to Blink.I wish I hadn't purchased them.  The recording function leaves something to be desired.  I wanted something that would record 24/7, but only alert me when I'm away.  Thats not possible with blink.  It either records or it doesn't. It records if you physically open the app and watch a live view, or you set a schedule for it to record. If you set it to record 24/7, then whenever you're moving about your house, it alerts you....a lot.  I don't need to know when I get off the couch.I can set it to record when I'm away, but then i have to remember to "arm" it every time i leave the house.Let's say you're home, and someone is breaking in, you'd have to stop everything, and "arm' the system for it to record, otherwise, its just a camera sitting on a shelf, doing nothing.Maybe one day they'll give an update to it, but I doubt it, in hindsight after reading reviews, people have been asking for this feature for two years.  Why amazon hasn't implemented it yet is beyond me.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020

Review Text: Update:  after my original review I was contacted by an Amazon Executive Representative who indicated they are aware of the camera issue and are working to resolve it.  In the mean time he suggested an additional troubleshooting step which unfortunately hasn’t worked consistently but I am encouraged that the issue will be resolved soon.If you get a working one count yourself lucky because I think we are doing Amazon's BETA testing for them on this camera.I have been working with tech support for 3 weeks with no success.  The camera doesn't detect motion from basically dawn to dusk each day like it is being shut off on Amazon's end.  When it does start working again once the sun goes down (it's in my lanai not out in the element) it will start working but even with the sensitivity level turned down it's so overly sensitive to the smallest flying insect that sometime I have to disarm it so I don't get notifications all night.They originally told me to send them serial number then 4 days later wanted me to delete it from the app and re add it then a week later I get an email that it looks like I "armed"the camera so it should be working fine.  The camera was armed the entire time and then after another week and I just go an email yesterday to delete it and add it back again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020

Review Text: Guys, this is really a great product and quality of picture is superb, really good. I have Ring also and I can say this is more or less similar quality output compared to Ring. This is very good value for money, at this price range under $ 30, I dont see any competitive quality product. App was really easy to download and start the camera, it took me less then 5 minutes from start to finish, including wall mount this camera, everything comes along inside the box. According to me it only has one drawback, it does not show your recording constantly, I dont know why they created system like this, it should show you constant live stream, but after I guess every 30 seconds, it asks you to continues, this is very monotonous,  I really hope they can fix this issue. Still I will rate them 5 star because it is hard to beat the price and what you get at this price is really good value so it meets its expectations.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020

Review Title: Audio detection is impressive. Video OK. Motion detection inconsistent.
Review Text: It is a very nice inexpensive way to monitor and area without paying too much for monitoring services. The motion detection triggers easily with light variance so I sometimes get multiple alerts around sunset depending on light and location of the device. Otherwise, I find it very useful. The audio detection is extremely sensitive and impressive. I can hear conversations at the other end of the house when it is triggered. Picture quality is adequate but I would not say you are going to read a license plate but you can make out faces ok if it's close enough to the camera. I find it similar to a WYZE camera with a little more sensitivity. The WYZE has internal storage capability and about the same picture quality. The BLINK build and quality seems more robust. Easy to use software is a plus as well as seamless integration with Amazon Echo Show devices.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021

Review Title: Does what ya want for the cheap
Review Text: I'm using it watch my dog when I'm out. Quality of video is good, easy to setup, and app is easy to use. I see most complain about the subscription but I don't care about saving video feed, so as long as they let me check the live view after subscription, I don't care about the subscription. I haven't tested motion detection because it's to watch my dog and don't need constant notifications that's she walking around. Will update if something negative happens.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2022

Review Text: To use the system you have to download the app and set up a Blink account.  No problem The whole process is straight forward until - until you are told you are being sent a PIN number to complete set up.  Except the PIN email never shows up.  I ended up trying it with 3 different email accounts on 3 different email services - Gmail, Comcast and our corporate Exchange server.  No email.  Blink support took on average 48 hours or more to get back to me and they were clueless.  Offered no productive solutions.  In fact I just got an email asking me if I had replied to their last email.  Well I did, 4 days ago.I guess you get what you pay for.  Good luck. Maybe other won't have this problem. Wasting several hours on a product that many other vendors also offer with no problems is not for me.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020

Review Title: Most aggravating system I have ever used
Review Text: While the mechanicas of the cameras seem to be pretty goodSome of the worst things:Doorbell w Sync module 2- No recorded images even with a thumb drive installed in the Sync module unless you subscribe to their service and even then does not record to the drive, only the cloud. Live images only and even then it only records for about 15 seconds before requiring you to tap on "continue?" (which doesn't work half the time). If the delivery guy cuts across the lawn, stops at the steps and tosses the package onto the porch it doesn't record him (her). People walking down the walk from the driveway are recorded.Every day there is a 20 to 25 second recording that covers from the previous afternoon at about 5:30 PM til sometime the next morning.Blink camera - While the picture is quite good and the night vision acceptable, even with a large thumb drive installed in the sync module the clips are useless. I recently installes the camera in my shop and over the course of about 2 hours one afternoon:58 clips, none over 4 seconds. Bear in mind I was working in the shop and constantly moving around within site of he camera.The vast majority of the clips were betweem 0 (yeah Zero) and 2 seconds.Do yourself a favor and find something worth buying, especially if you're looking for a security system that will provide usable video and monitoring capabilities.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2022

Review Title: Good camera for the price.  Difficulty keeping connected to WIFI but solved!
Review Text: Read below for connection issues:I bought this camera because we were leaving out of town for a week.  It had good features and decent reviews.  Don't really care about the picture as much as reliability.  App is simple and easy enough, but for the first few times it kept dropping the internet even though it was literally right beside the router!  I was just about to return it because of this, but decided to check online about issues.  Apparently several folks have had the same problem.  Long story short, most routers have a reset button.  I pushed mine then reconnected the camera.  Solved the problem!  It's been a week now with no issues.  I love the ability to talk to my bird and cat through the camera.  For the money I think it's not bad at all.  Picture is white out in some lighting (mostly when the sun is shining right close to it).
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2021

Review Title: Awful support initially, Got way better after I made a bad review
Review Text: UPDATE 8/13/21 After I submitted a 1 star review I was contacted by a different support person an Amazon Rep for Blink.  He was a pleasure to work with and allowed me to return the camera in exchange for one with a different serial number.  I had suggested doing this to the original support people and they said no.  The saying, "The squeaky wheel gets the oil" applied here since it took a bad review to get this resolved.  I was very happy with the outcome but gave only 3 stars because I had to be the bad guy in order to get this remedied.  I have yet to use the camera, so can't review that.~~~~~~~~~~~  first review is below ~~~~~~~~~I bought this for home use.  My grandson visited so I loaned him the camera to keep an eye on the baby when she was napping and he was in the yard.  When he left I tried to assign the device to me.  Can not do, per support.  He has to delete the device from his account.  Well he deleted his account before deleting the device and now the camera is completely useless.  Support keeps telling me to have him delete the device, he can no longer log in!  This is a ridiculous system.  The cost and the frustration over no help is not worth it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2021

Review Text: We bought this because we suspected our caregiver was mistreating my parents.  Unfortunately, the quality is poor and the viewing is only for 30 seconds at the most.  Many times, it doesn't even detect the motion.  For example, this morning, no motion was detected in my mother's room even though the caregiver came in to the room  and helped her out of bed.  The first motion detected was when the care giver got my mother unto the commode.While the camera was super easy to install, the night time picture quality is poor, motion is often undetected, you can only view for 30 seconds and during the live view option, the view is not continuous and will automatically shut off after 30 seconds if you don't tap the "continue?"
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021

Review Title: Terrible Product.  Save your money.  Anything should be a better pick than this.
Review Text: This camera is awful.  Plugs right in with super easy setup.  App is simple and user friendly.  That is where anything good about this ends.  Motion doesn't work right.  Login to view the feed and it doesn't work right (or at all half the time.  Typically you will get the "failed live view" pop up).  App closes abruptly when attempting to view the feed.  Then fails over and over again prompting that the "camera is in use."  Customer service (an Amazon based company evidentially) seems to have come over from the cable companies from the 1990's.  If you contact them get ready for awesome help such as "unplug your router," and reset your modem," instead of the obvious issues whereby everything else hooked up to the WIFI works accept their shoddy camera.  You can't return it either so now I have a nice pretend camera that doesn't do anything helpful.  Save your money.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020

Review Text: So I wanted to buy my Mom an Echo and they offered this with it for $5. My eccentric aunt goes up to my room to "visit the cat" and stuff has been moved around. So I jumped at the opportunity to see what the heck she is doing up there before I set some major boundaries. I'm a curious one. Anyway: the camera is great! It is easy to set-up and use, the night vision provides a decent image/recording, the motion detection works like it should. I have no complaints, other than the eccentric aunt hasn't been over lately so I haven't gotten to use it for my intended purpose, lol. I plan to train it on the cat's food and water if I have to leave for a few days, so I can keep an eye on her. I can't wait to see what other purposes develop! I like the amount of settings available too. I just discovered I can turn the recording light off via the app. Very handy that it notifies me whenever it senses motion. I have zero complaints so far and would totally buy another in the future if needed.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2020

Review Text: The Blink camera has great picture quality.  Sound - great.  However, I did not realize the recording was with a subscription.  Yes, my fault for not reading!  I have other cameras - they store without a subscription.  Possibly not as great of a picture...but good enough.  They don't have the voice/sound which I liked on the Blink.  However, I've had the others for a few years...I need to review them again and see if they have upgrades by now.I've read reviews on the module that you can get for the Blink.  A hassel to have to get the and put into a computer to view your video.  Nowadays, apps on our phone are the quickest and most efficient way to manage as much as we can.  Then, of course I could sign up for the subscription plan for $100 a year.  I'm looking for other cameras to consider while 'reading' in more depth next time.  I'm sad about this.  Blink could at least have a free version that would only hold 'x' amount monthly.  We could go in and clear it out and keep the cloud clear.  Just my thoughts.  Seems every good thing is a money racket.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2022

Review Title: Many features are turned off if you don't buy a subscription...
Review Text: The system works just OK, mostly just false alarms triggered by wind or shadows.  The main complaint is that they give you a free trial of cloud storage, then you have to buy a subscription.  I declined and use my own storage on the USB.  Seems easy enough.  Problem is, when your free trial runs out, they slow down the video retrieval (says:  "USB takes longer to load" as it's loading - really?).  This is obviously done on purpose to punish you for not buying a subscription.  On top of that there's another passive/aggressive punishment doled out - you can no longer do a "Select all" and delete.  They really hang you out to dry on this one.  You have to go through and delete each image (I usually have hundreds in a week).  F these people.  It would be a fine system, but me spending money on the cameras was not enough for these greedy f+*&^ers.  I suggest you keep looking.  One man's take...
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2022

Review Text: The camera itself is good for the price, but the Blink app that you have to use with the camera is absolutely terrible.There are so many options that overlap, such as trying to stop the camera from saving footage. There’s a ‘disarm’ button, and ‘do not save’ button, ‘enable’ button, ‘motion recording button’ button, and then a ‘save’ button. And guess what? I turned every single one off and it is STILL saving the live videos onto the cloud.Additional gripe: the Blink app asks you every 60 seconds if you want to continue watching live, if you don’t click ‘continue’ in like 1 second then it stops your live feed. Like why even have this be a feature? If I wanted to stop viewing the live feed I would have exited from the feed.Overall: 2/5. You unfortunately get what you pay for with this camera/software setup.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021

Review Title: Great camera, disappointing app and terrible execution by limiting live view to just a few moments.

Review Title: Updated to one star due to false promises and failed systems.
Review Text: Updated 03/04/2021After calling multiple times since getting them day one I still don’t have fully functional cameras. Originally they said we know we have an issue with the motion sense and with the new update they are going to be better give us a chance and as a courtesy they sent out a replacement set and a free camera. I have made all the updates and the blink cameras still don’t work. I’m really upset that I didn’t just return them like I wanted to originally because now I’m stuck with these useless cameras and terrible customer service that never returns the calls they promised. I changed the 2 star to a 1 star.So I started with blink when they became an amazon product and I loved them from the start! I have 3 of the XT2s and they are wonderful. I chose those instead of the regular XT because I was using them in my girls rooms and needed to the way radio option. I was ecstatic to see the release of the blink mini with all the same features with the wired camera so I didn’t have to keep buying batteries since I use them a lot with my two little ones. I ordered them and set up my XT2s outside which was my thought when I purchased them, I’d just put them outside when I didn’t need them in the girls rooms anymore.Unfortunately these fell completely short. The motion sense doesn’t catch anything it misses my toddler climbing out of her bed down the ladder then onto her potty then back up the ladder to her bed but then all of a sudden I get motion detection when no one is in there. Very disappointed with these two cameras. I initially thought I received a defective set because I was so used the amazing XT2s but I called amazon and got replacements sent out and they are exactly the same. I think these are unfortunately going to be returned and I’m going to have to bring back my XT2s again. I really wanted to love them but hey don’t serve the purpose they advertise and I need to have my littles monitored and this isn’t doing it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020

Review Text: This camera requires you to login to a server to see video. Well in a emergency scenario this is no good time is of the essence. Now if your a voyeur or want to see who is sneaking in your daughters bedroom after the fact yeah buy this but if you want security and I stand access please choose another. I bought this as an add on for 5 bucks, I could not see paying anything more for it. When I wrote amazon to let the blink team know they had a dud and I was going to destroy the camera and not bother contacting me regarding the issue the idiot still sent an email and said they respect my decision, well that tells you even the blink team knows this is really just a spy camera not a security camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2021

Review Text: Didn’t realize before buying that the viewing time was capped at a few seconds. After reading more reviews now I see I’m not the only one to make that mistake. I’m not sure why live view needs to be capped, especially on this camera that is hard wired and not battery powered like their other units. Also, and a bigger issue for me, is that whenever you do view the camera the camera itself makes a loud mechanical “click” noise every time the camera activates and deactivates. For our young toddler age child this is no good as it’s very noticeable and she’s actually scared of this now.Edit: dropped a star for terrible wifi range. The camera was 1 floor away from my wifi router. It kept dropping offline and Blink support told me it was due to low wifi signal. I put the camera in the same room as my router and it's been working for a few days now. This is crazy that it has to be in the same room as the wifi router, as I have Blink outdoor cameras that go through several walls and across my yard with no problem. Blink support solution was that I need a wifi extender to put this camera upstairs, even though my wifi signal isn't the issue, as evidenced by how far away I can put my outdoor cameras. They said the wifi chip is the same in the mini vs the outdoor.Edit: Moved the camera to the basement, directly below the wifi router. It worked fine for a month or so, and now today is back "offline" requiring a reset again. Don't bother with this camera, it's a waste. I love my outdoor blink cameras, but this indoor version is a joke.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020

Review Text: Good audio and video quality. The problem is with the app and the sensitivity of the camera. The blocks on the Activity Zones are so big that it is impossible to get an accurate zone. I called the their tech support and I was told that the app for their other models have smaller boxes. If smaller boxes can be used on their other models, why not do the same with the minis?On sensitivity matter, I can't fine a number that will work well with the camera in my garage (photo attached). When I select the numbers 4 & 5 for sensitivity the camera does not stop recording. And when I tried the numbers 1, 2 & 3, even I jump up and down in front of the camera it does not record at all. Now, I am thinking of returning all 4 cameras I purchased.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2021

Review Title: Great quality, so easy and convenient!
Review Text: We have Amazon Alexa, so when I seen this is partnered with Alexa I knew it would be a great purchase. I absolutely love it. I work from home in my downstairs office, with my kids & puppy upstairs I can EASILY check on them!! The two way microphone is very convenient also, I remind them (“take the puppy outside”) and same if we leave somewhere. We can just go to the App and check on the kids and puppy whenever we want. The image quality is 100x better than I expected. Even night vision, you can see everything pretty clearly— I was so surprised! It looks kind of small/cheap looking, but its so clear and does not lag much either. Definitely a great purchase! Buying another one for our house also.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2021

Review Title: Not for use as an actual security camera
Review Text: I bought this along with the sync module to kind of get around having to pay for the monthly plan. This camera was easy to set up, but adding the camera to the sync module was non-intuitive to say the least. Took a while of playing around with it, but I did get it to work.The picture quality is nice and it has settings where you can schedule it for motion detection. I really have no complaints about the hardware.However, my biggest problem with this is that these camera are nearly nonfunctional without the monthly plan. You can only see one camera screen at a time and switching between cameras with only the sync module takes a full 20 seconds. You also can't record live clips with just the sync module and if you check out the camera because you got a motion detection alert, it will stop recording as long as you are in live view.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022

Review Text: Hi(see edit at bottom .....)So, the little Blink cameras *seemed* like such a nice idea. They are on sale right now so I bought a couple. That was not a really good idea. Down in the fine print, they have a limit of 10 cameras on one "system". Just what a "system" is ... very unclear. What *is* clear is that the app will slap your hand if you try to add camera number 11. What makes it a bit odd is the stuff up in the bold print that says you can have an "unlimited" number of cameras on the (paid) app. Next step will be to see if a second Blink hub helps things ....=============So after a bit of fooling around. What you do is "add to a new system" (that catchy name) on the app once you go over 10 cameras. Give it a new name (like ... second :) ) and you can add another 10 cameras. No need for a sync module if they are just Mini's. Turns out to be pretty easy .

Review Title: Worked well before return time frame - now it's a waste of my money.
Review Text: When I first started using this camera, I was very happy with the system. I could log in and make sure my pup was ok while at work. The connection was also great and I never seemed to have any issues with logging on or watching her recorded movements.Recently I've been having a lot more issues. The connectivity isn't as good. There's always a lag when opening the Blink app. The camera is slow to start up when I want to watch live. And currently I can't watch my pup anymore because of "unauthorized access." I've tried changing my password. I closed the app out and also deleted it and redownload it.it's been too long and now I can no longer return my Blink camera. This has happened too many times for my liking. Honestly, invest in a more expensive product that will work better. With this camera, you get what you pay for.

I was able to show the police my video and they were amazed at the speeders in the residential neighborhood too. They wanted to see more 😂!  The Blink mini is awesome I would highly recommend this product.
