Review Title: You get what you pay for
Review Text: I bought 6 of these when my wife went back to work so we could watch our son while at home with the nanny. First, it’s an extremely poor app design. It keeps the same set up as the outdoor blink cameras meaning it won’t continue to record while motion is present, it will only record 30s and then “cool down” for a minimum of 10s before it restarts.....these cameras are plugged in, not battery so it makes absolutely no sense. If you open the app, you won’t get any live views, you have to open each camera individually and hope it’s working at the time (whole separate issue). When you try and open a camera, it may take 5-10s to actually show a picture (if it does at all). I bought the echo show with this and had to talk to customer support 3x to make the cameras actually show up when asked and I’m still having issues. Don’t be fooled, the cheap price gives you a cheap product. If you just want to check in, perfect cameras for you. If you want to actually know what’s going on in real time, spend the money on a better option.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2020

Review Text: I had high hopes these small cameras would work. Quality is ok. There’s a delay in motion sensor and for that reason I rated the item low. Also when camera starts recording there’s a very loud click noise and when recording ends it clicks again. I was trying to save costs on home security addition fees but I guess that backfired. The cameras are not horrible but I’d say there’s probably better options available.

Review Title: Great camera in a small package
Review Text: I already had 4 outdoor blink cameras and wanted to add an inside camera.  The mini Blink was all I needed and it was on sale so I ordered it.  The setup was very simple and I like that it doesn't require batteries to operate. The only issue I ran into was that the existing outside cameras were on a schedule and I wanted the inside camera to be armed 24/7.  I couldn't set a separate schedule for the inside camera when I added it to my system, so I sent a message to customer support asking if it was possible to establish a separate schedule.  They replied very promptly telling me that I could establish a second system and add the inside camera to that system. Once it was added, I could create a separate schedule.  This worked perfectly & now I have everything set up the way I wanted. The picture quality is really good during the day & especially at night.

SMH.

Review Text: i liked the price and function. i gave this to a person as a gift (even set it up for them). then 5 months later BLINK tirns off camera and sends an email saying it mjst subscribe per month to keep using,  I suppose 5 months is a good enough time for you to give this a 5 star rating and then get side swiped 5 months later....Yet nothing was displayed on the homepage of the Amazon purchase product saying that it was a trial only, there's some subsection with an * deep embedded in the article details that is not obviously made aware so you have to buy a module and that is completely useless if the house Burns down or you're robbed. Review Text: Initially, I ordered one of these cameras as a bundle package with the Echo Show in October of 2020. After getting everything set up, I found the camera was really easy to use. The picture quality was amazing. It worked extremely well on our horrible, rural internet which was a plus right away. So from October to December, I add 3 additional cameras to the one I already had. Everything was set up and working flawlessly.Unfortunately, I wake up this morning to check my cameras and am met with a message regarding a paid subscription now required in order to access my own product. This is extremely disheartening. If I wanted a subscription plan, I would have gone with a different camera setup.These cameras are now paperweights and will have no use. Very deceptive. Review Title: Good camera but not for kids rooms
Review Text: There is nothing in the questions about there being a bright red light for the night vision. (Picture attached) my son is terrified of it, so I have to end up returning it. So I do not recommend this for childrens rooms because of this. You CAN turn off the night vision but the picture is very grainy with out it.This camera does not have great zoom, example I had the camera 15 feet away to watch my son while he’s asleep and when I zoomed in you can barely make out the picture. (This was on night vision)Also, loud clicking noise when the camera goes in and out of night vision. Could also be disruptive to sleeping children.Also, the camera does NOT stay on live mode. It exits out after I want to say about 2 mins. Then you have to go back in and it’ll exit out again. If I knew this I wouldn’t have bought it. You have to buy a subscription to get the “extended live view”…Other than that, camera was VERY easy to set up. Very clear with night vision (within 6 feet) and very clear with day time/light.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2022

Review Title: Great little cam for the price
Review Text: We bought these for monitoring cat litter boxes as it's hard to tell who used what box in a multi-cat household and sometimes you need to know who made what to tell the vet about. We had been using Arlo Q cameras for this purpose but software updates eventually rendered them bricks and we didn't want to pay tons of money to replace them and have the same thing happen. We also tried the Ring indoor cam but it wasn't as flexible with angling. This Blink mini offers a cheaper price-point and flexible positioning. My only knock on it is that it only records for 30 seconds max whereas the Arlo & Ring offered up to 2 minutes max recording. As such, it generally doesn't catch the cat's full bathroom visit but at least we have a general idea of who used what box and can figure it out from there. It also doesn't offer sound-activation but that is okay for our purposes of litter box monitoring. Overall very pleased with the camera and have now purchased multiple Blink minis for less than the cost of 1 of the other brands.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021

Review Text: I received this as a free inclusion with the purchase of an Echo Show 5.  I live where we have 5 foot gates around our townhouse patios, and this Blink Mini lets me see my gate, patio, and from the side someone at the front door. The reason I can do this is that it, "Pixelates" through the glass of my sliding glass doors, per an article I read. So, I have it set up inside, but it looks outside. It's not made to be out in the elements.It is motion sensitive (adjustable), has a mic (not much use for hearing the patio, but a nice feature for other use at another time),  and it alerts me on my phone through the Blink app on my phone and I can view my patio live! I can look at what the camera sees on my Echo Show 5 also. It has infrared for night viewing, but my patio lights are bright enough that I have the infrared turned off and it gives a nice clear, color picture - just like daytime!I love this despite one quirk. If you turn the mic off (as I said it's useless through the sliding glass door), then the Echo Show errors and says, "Hmmmm, Camera is not responding" or "Ok. I'm not quite sure what went wrong" or "OK"This error message occurs if your devices are muted when you use a voice command "Alexa show me the [name of cam]". It is only an issue when the Echo Show has the latest firmware version 6.5.4.1 installed. The solution is to enable the microphone for that camera in the Blink app's Live View settings.So, I eanble the mic, set the volume to zero and voilà, works perfectly.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020

Review Title: Good video and speaker, terrible app and motion sensors. Unable to even use the cameras.
Review Text: We first got these and loved them. But as we got to know how the product works... now I wish we would have just purchased the more expensive ones.The motion sensors only covers part of the room (on high!) We do not have a large house.. we have to be about 6ft away before the camera picks up motion.I will feed my baby in the bedroom and watch the other kids through the camera but most of the time it says that live view is unavailable, or video in progress, or it just continues to load.. defeats the purpose of having them. No, it’s not our internet.Ultimately, the video quality is good, I like being able to talk through them, the speakers are loud, and the price was good... but it’s pretty pointless if we can’t use the app to access the cameras when we want to. We will be purchasing a different product that better fits our needs.UPDATE: live view is still hardly ever available but we still use the cameras to see what had happened.What bothers me is that when amazon emailed me to ask about my review, they said they ONLY needed my email to access my cameras!!! I said no, but since they EMAILED me and only need my email... I’m a little worried about privacy.They wanted to see what’s wrong with them- nothing. Just a bad product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020

Review Text: The picture series has Wyze first and Blink Mini 2nd in all shots. First pic is of both at my wall mount. First comparison is Image Quality as cameras capture in daytime. I am standing at 20 ft from cameras. Next enlargements are done by zooming thise images on IPhone 12 Pro Max and doing screen grab of each. Wyze wins with sharper images. Lastly is night vision comparison. Night vision is hugely better on Wyze. Why have a security camera if someone breaks in and their faces are blurry? Pros and cons: First Amazon owned Blink feels more solid product support wise, long term as its a bigger name with likely more resources. I had cheap Chinese MIPC based cameras before - what a joke! 2nd I don't want images in cloud. I want local discreet storage. The Blink system can give that with Bluetooth available USB sync module storage possibility. The Sync Module can be hidden in a outlet in a cabinet or a location not nearby. That is better than Wyze. Micro SD cards in camera (Wyze) mean suspect can steal them or destroy them easily - so this is a strike against Wyze. Lastly I don't like the pigtail on the Wyze V3. I know they did this for sealing/weather tightness. But they could still do a co injection molded sealed insertion of the connector at the camera body. Cameras should all have flat round common diameter bottoms, designed properly and have common interfaces for hookups and wire concealment in wire tracks. In this way they fit avariety of mounts. For wire concealment I use Legrand Cordmate C10 white wire channel it works very well. Standardize all interfaces please. So really neither has their act together 100%. But Wyze has most important feature, Image Quality, correct.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2021

Review Text: I got this recently with the Echo Show bundle. I mean seriously.. for $5, how could you possibly have any complaints about this camera? We've been having issues with our puppy when we leave the house and this helps tremendously when he starts to get into trouble. He's well trained on commands, so when we talk to him through the two way audio, he doesn't know where my voice is coming from but it gets him to stop doing what he's doing. We were looking at several other systems that were several hundred dollars in price. So glad we didn't end up going that route.

Review Title: After countless conversations with tech support...it's garbage

Each time- can you restart the camera, can you restart the blink module, can you run this app to check your connection. Every. Time. I have the wireless cameras and they work amazing!!!! These plug in ones are poor quality in comparison. I can never get a live view unless I'm at home on the same network as these plug in cameras. I can never view them from outside the home and I never get updates on them outside the home. The wireless cameras work great! This one, not so much. AVOID!

Review Text: This camera is very easy to set up.  It works very well on indoor places. If you want to aim the camera out a window, there are some things you should know first.1. There are several great features that no longer are available after a trial unless you pay a fee.2. The camera can have a mind of its own.  It will record regularly and then skip hours all by itself randomly.  Mine skips 6 to 8 hours.3. It has a great picture but you cannot read license plates very well so look for a strong camera if you need details.4. It works very well indoors recording inner rooms and places.5. It's tiny and barely noticeable. It can be held in place with a 3m sticky strip.Overall i would recommend this camera if you are willing to pay the monthly fee. Otherwise to me it isn't reliable.

Review Title: Requires a monthly subscription to view anything that is not live.

Review Title: Great product for the money. App needs help.
Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   I really like these cameras a lot. I used to have an Arlo set and these surpass those for sure (and for a fraction of the price). These were very easy to set up and never fail or randomly shut off like others I have had.Pros:NO HUB!!!! Great picture quality, EXCELLENT sound quality in recorded videos, ability to 2-way speak through camera, excellent free plan for online storage, ability to save any video to your phone without converting, great options in app for personalizing almost every aspect of recording.Cons:It must first record the video before alerting you, inability to receive alerts for a single camera (must receive all or none), the speakers on camera are a tad too quiet and both sides must pause before speaking again, night vision lacks details in moving objects, no SD card slots, if facing out a window the glare is horrible, to use the live view you must press a button in your app every 30 seconds to continue.All in all, I really like them to be honest. These work perfect for what I need as a consumer. I'm not a shop owner worried about theft and I live in a good community so I just use them to keep an eye on my kids and things of that nature at home... and catching the occasional fairy or ghost at 3am apparently.

Review Title: It's ok, but with storage limitations
Review Text: The camera is easy enough to set up, but unless I'm on the same wifi network, it is sometimes difficult to connect to the live view.  Right now, it is offering free video storage, which is good because if I had to pay for what little bit of storage they offer, I would really be upset.  A competitor...Nest, offers 5 days and now 10 days of storage.  I am only getting 12 hours with the blink mini.  So, if you go away for the weekend, and something happens, this camera isn't the one for you.  For it to be truly effective, they have to increase the number of days you can go back for review.  It says 60 days of storage, but that is only if those images don't get overridden.  If the camera is recording constant motion, you get 12 hours.  Or at least, that is all I get.  I'm hoping that when they roll out the the local storage option, this will be improved.

Review Text: Easy to install (both the equipment and the app), I like the arm/disarm feature (keep it off while I'm home, etc), but I did notice that the sound pickup for these cameras is VERY sensitive. When reviewing a recording from the  first day I mounted the cameras, noticed that it was picking up the sound of my central A/C return vent (about 12 feet away and around a corner) and doing so quite loudly...sounded like there was a fan blowing right on the microphone for the camera.  My Hive camera was installed in the exact same place, but never had this problem.Overall, great little camera set.  I can live with the sensitive mic pickup.  Night vision and motion detection are spot on.They also don't constantly crash (like my old Hive cameras do), so that is nice :)
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020

Review Text: Like others, I was shocked to find that the stream only lasts for a total of ~30 seconds before timing out. This is clearly meant as a security camera rather than a baby or dog monitor, and is really meant to capture short moments of motion before shutting off. It does this well.It also requires a premium subscription to really operate as advertised, so do not be swayed by the low cost. I can only speak to the Mac and Android apps, but overall they are very poor quality. Connections drop constantly, app has to be open to record, and there is no way to monitor constantly. The automatic setup does work well however. Overall, probably about as good as the apps that come with the various knockoffs available here. This is clearly a very low priority for Amazon.Video quality is...fine. Nominally 1080p, but about what you would expect from a cheap 2000s-era webcam. You will not be sharing clips with family and friends.2-way audio is a great feature, and works well for this price.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2022

Review Text: Cant test any of the features because it simply wont connect to my wifi. im still on a 2.4ghz only network with 802.11 b/g using wep 64/40 ascii which should connect this camera. It does not. I have the camera only 1 foot away from the router and can not get it to connect.First Edit 6/21/20: i was able to get it working with one of my phones wifi tethering (android s7) While my iphone would receive the same connection failure. The device updated and then i tried to reconnect using my home wifi, again it would not work. Should also state that not only is my router in spec for this device, my internet speeds are 100MB U/D so this is faulty. Even my cheep chinese lightbulbs work with my routers yet this cant even make a connection.Followup 6/23/20: Blink has since contacted me and is attempting to troubleshoot, in the meantime i was able to get it working on another network in my s/o house which was a pretty easy setup. While the camera works and is decent for the price in terms of clarity from what i experienced its not real time and displays with a full 6 second or more lag while viewing from the same network on both my phone and the echo show the fps isnt the greatest either. Kinda makes the intercom through the camera pointless. Still a few leagues behind setting up picams in both clarity and frame rate, also with the ability to set custom storage on your own network still missing from this device its miles behind the picam, hopefully when this feature gets added it has decent settings that are for more advanced users.Im upping my review from 1 to 3 stars because of the support attempts so far and because the clarity is decent for the price. If i can get it working on my network it will be worth the 4 stars.Update 3, 6/24/20 - Blink support had me download an app to monitor my network sending them data that i don't even get to see myself only for support to tell me that i should call verizon and see if they can fix the problem by telling them that i have a blink camera that wont connect, what a joke, do they really think verizon has the time to deal with redoing my network for a single device that wont connect when everything else is fine. This review is getting dropped to 2 stars due to the data mining and lack of support.

Review Title: Easy setup, switching cams fast not good, good picture
Review Text: Main points:Setup on a 2.4G network was a piece of cake - easiest yet.Picture quality is the standard 1080p. Movement is slightly delayed and more glitchy than previous cameras but not enough for more than a second or two so fine for me watching my cats and moderate security if I hear a bump in the night.Cancelled the auto subscription cloud plan ASAP - that would be a wallet smack and was annoying but meh knew it was coming based on the reviews.Audio is also sort of delayed but my cats don’t talk to me so it’s all good.Overall fit my needs for the price point. Cut a large command strip in half to use as an adhesive to my wall and bought two 20ft each micro usb cables to fix the short default cord issue. The base stand does pop off and you can put it into the back of the cam over the QR code and it does great and allows rotation. This was a big selling point in keeping them. If you leave the base on the bottom you can’t walk mount it without some special frame for it. So unnecessary. Command strip was stellar.Might end up buying a couple more with time. So far my wifi network is more pleased with these cameras which is a big win.

Review Title: Good little cameras; Not best in class.
Review Text: So I've been using Arlo for a while and it's pretty good but I like the Amazon ecosystem and wanted to see if these new mini cameras would be a good replacement. I bought some to try. Verdict is that these are easier to use and have great picture but with 3 fixable flaws:1) most cameras offer the option to turn off the IR lights; I was told these cameras can't. If you need to put these facing a window that could be a problem.2) my biggest hope was that it would be easy to have these cameras send an announcement to Alexa - they cannot. This is a big shame given how this use is important for the elderly, security and as a baby monitor. You can try to use a skill called Notify Me but those are notifications not announcements which means you won't know about any motion unless you check the notifications. Announcements would be better.3) with Arlo you can see multiple cameras on a single screen. Again with the minis and the Blink app you can't.Bottom line is that I would say with some modifications these would be best in class cameras. For now I would say are not quite there yet.

Review Title: Does not work with the Echo Show 5
Review Text: I bought two of these Blink Minis together with three Echo Show 5s for security. They work fine with my larger Echos Shows but even after spending hours on it, they will not work with the Echo Show Minis. Search online and you will find this is a common problem with no workable solution.-----------------------------------UPDATE: changed 2 star to 4 starAfter posting this review, I was contacted by a Blink tech who worked with me to identify the problem. Turning off the Blink mini microphone (in the BLINK app) solved the problem. I can now access the camera on all three of my Echo Show 5 units. There is still a delay after I say "Show me the camera," before the camera comes up, so if someone triggers the driveway alarm, they may be out of sight before I can see them.

Review Title: Pay the fee or it sucks.
Review Text: This is a terrible product unless you pay the monthly fee. I even bought the “blink” flash drive for local storage and most of the time, the clips won’t even load. Not to mention the stupid message about how it takes longer to load USB clips than cloud ones. How does this take longer, and I mean a good deal longer when the storage is local? If you plan on paying them for cloud storage, this is probably decent but if you refuse to pay yet another monthly fee for stuff you own, then it’s absolutely horrible.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021

Review Title: Unreliable... Cameras go offline frequently requiring onsite intervention
Review Text: Purchased a starter set of 4 (outdoor) cameras with the control unit.  Installed relatively easily, so I ordered and installed two minis.  After about a week, cameras started going offline for no apparent reason, usually requiring on-site intervention to bring them back.  After an hour on the phone with support, I was told there was a bad update and I had to revert to the original version, which I did.  Cameras worked for two days, and went back offline.  System is in my vacation home 700 miles away, so I can't just drop in to reset them every couple of days.  Currently 4 of the 6 cameras at my house are off line and they have been for days since I can't visit the location to reset them.  Support tells me to check my WiFi in the house, that is a cop out since the WiFi is better than good (and it's a small house!). Horrible product, save your money.  Ready to throw them in the garbage.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021

Review Text: This is my first review ever! The App for these cameras sucks!  You can not rotate your image for viewing the correct orientation. Ex. If you mount the camera upside down. The image will be upside down on your phone, tv, echo etc. I have many other brands of cameras and they all have this feature. this issue has been complained about on the blink forum for years! No changes have been made! Also, I wanted the motion detection feature to be able to trigger a routine (smart light come on) within the Alexa app (blink is an amazon company). This seems fairly reasonable to me. Nope! Not capable. You can do it through third party apps, but not Alexa. Also, you can’t watch multiple cameras live on the screen at one time! Come on Amazon! Come on Blink! Make this right!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020

Review Title: Good camera; Poor bait and switch
Review Text: This is a good camera for in-house use.  Enjoyed it up till now.  Now Blink want to charge for 'cloud' storage of videos.  This was one of the reasons why this was a good value, until now.  Now it is just an lesser-value security camera; you get more function with other security cameras. Without the 'cloud' storage option, the camera just shows a picture only when you chose to view it, only.  There is no support for other security monitoring software packages.  There is another device that you can purchase, but it only stores videos locally to a flash disk.  You then have to take that disk to another device to view the videos (I have not purchased and used this device).  Debating if I should get a 'cloud' storage plan, or sell the devices and move onto something more professional.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021

Review Text: Changed my mind and edited my review...after a year I now am told I have to have a subscription to view motion detection from mini cameras they only pick up motion sporadically at best anyway...when originally purchased nothing was mentioned about any subscription plan needed to view clips... I never keep clips after viewing anyway... why pay for cloud storage I am not using.  View and delete...that’s all I use it for. It was nice if you didn’t hear the notification sound and couldn’t go live right away to view live .  Not that nice when the minis don’t always pick up motion though. DISSATISFIED new policies should be for new purchases only, others should be grandfathered in.  This is the second time I’ve purchased  cameras from Amazon where I’ve felt deceived.. purchased Belkin cameras and then was notified that their network was being dissolved and would no longer work..
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020

Review Title: This is not to be trusted as a dependable surveillance cam
Review Text: I got this cam as a bargain that came with a flex. Yet I still processed a return on it , it's nowhere near up to expectations if you really need to rely on capturing important footage. If there's continuous motion, it doesn't continually record, in my experiences. It'll record in segments , stop, and  if motion is still happening it may or may not start recording again for another 15 or so seconds. I had it in place of my nest cam facing out my window by sidewalk to watch for anyone trying to mess with vehicles at night, and I got so aggravated that as someone would walk by it would start recording but catch nothing. When me and my wifi were just bickering and I wanted to prove I was right for once, the footage is NEVER THERE. Smh
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021

Review Title: If you want something reliable, look elsewhere
Review Text: The motion detection doesn’t work that great, even in okay light. I have a light bulb on, and the motion detection works like 70 percent of the time. And the motion has to be consistent.The 30 second record time is awful. It just cuts off even if someone is still in the room. I have this in my workshop and the recording cuts before I can see what people were doing poking around. So I can’t even see what they may have taken.Set up was easy-ish. It kept disconnecting from the WiFi Ann’s needing to be hard reset a few times. And setup from the start again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020

Review Text: I got this mini cam and at first really liked it at first as I also have 2 outdoor blinks but noticed after a few days it wasn't always picking up when there was motion, it would here and there but not all the time.  In addition to that it keeps recording when nothing is there & I mean a lot. I could get up in the morning and have 25 plus recordings with nothing being recorded except an empty room. They sent me a 2nd camera-got to wait and see if it works or if the same but they did try to help.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020

Review Text: I got this on the recent Amazon truck special.  I was wanting to buy Blink outdoor cameras but hadn't pulled the trigger yet.  When I saw this I decided to get it and see how well it worked. I'm obviously in the minority with my review but it didn't work at all for me. Tried to connect this thing too many times to count.  It wouldn't connect.  Suggestion from Blink was to download a third party router app that's rated at 2.5 stars.  It's bad enough that the Blink app is only rated 3.5 stars.  I shouldn't have to download other apps to make this thing work out of the box.  Every other device in my home connects and works flawlessly.  My Wyze cameras took no time at all to set up.  I'm very disappointed as I wanted it work and get some outdoor cameras too.  Oh well.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2021

Review Text: It captures good video, but only detects motion nearby. I live in a townhouse, which isn't very wide, and I have the camera sitting on the outside wall from my oven. If I'm cooking, the camera has no idea I'm even there. I bought 2, and was going to put the other one in a corner of another room, but if it can't detect motion more than a few feet away, there's no point.Also, it keeps sending me false alerts in the middle of the night - I'm not saying it sends me videos of nothing happening, I'm saying it alerts me that motion was detected, but there's no accompanying video of nothing happening, which is more annoying. I'd rather get an alert and see a video of nothing happening than get an alert and see no video at all.I bought 2 minis, 1 sync module, and 1 flash drive - gonna return everything but 1 camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021

Review Text: It took me awhile because I wasn't sure if I should return it. I got this to look outside the window. Approximately, 60% of the time it will operate but for some darn reason, it stops operating ( detects motions; goes offline ) consistently and intermittently. I even tried setting it inside the house instead but same. I didn't want to return it after using it due to privacy reasons. I read the community support and don't feel at this time it would help contacting Blink support either.At any given time, it would stop detecting or just stop entirely go offline. I moved it. Checked my internet. Checked the USB adapter cable. Now when it stops working, I'll just pull out the cord and reconnect t to reboot it. Takes a little bit of daily labor. There are some good things about this camera such as the night mode's clarity positioned to look out my window which is better than the WYZE's v2 night mode. However, during the day, WYZE's v2 is better. Polar opposites.I wanted a camera to not go out so I bought a WYZE v2 to back up the BLINK and I'm glad I did. It has never been an issue since day 1.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021

Review Text: So, the blink system is cheap. Thats why I bought it. Well, the old adage of "You get what you pay for" couldnt ring more true in this case. Think of this system as ONLY something to notify you of motion. Because it will NOT catch the beginning of motion. i.e You will not see the person walking up to you door untill he or she is pretty darn close, and after that, you will probably not see them walking away either.The software is really garbage. If you have neighborhood cats, this system will drive you absolutely crazy!!! No matter what settings you try, you cannot stop them from triggering your system. So the battery will wear out in like 2-3 months instead of at least a year.Im currently looking for a different system. Amazons Blink is garbage!!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021

Review Title: Buyer beware - READ EVERYTHING BEFORE YOU BUY THIS CAMERA!
Review Text: I really wish I had read EVERYTHING about this camera before purchasing it.  I was drawn to it by the easy setup, and when our original baby monitor stopped working, we decided to purchase a blink mini to use as a nursery room monitor, with plans to purchase more.First, I was very disappointed to find out that we were only able to view for 5 minutes at a time.....which basically makes it useless as a baby monitor.Since these cameras can be viewed remotely through the Blink app, my wife and I figured they’d be great to view the nursery while we were not home.  Here comes disappointment number 2.  While viewing the camera on the echo show that was purchased along with the camera, we quickly found out that you could not access the camera on a phone through the Blink app simultaneously while the camera was being viewed through the echo show.Needless to say, we’ll be returning both items, and continue our search for another baby monitor.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2021

Review Title: They only work when they want to.
Review Text: They work fine when they work. Problem is they don’t work half the time. I have been in basically continuous communication with Blink support since installing these. They advised me yesterday 09/03/2021 that there is a “bug” which is affecting the camera’s ability to record 24 hours a day. I had something stolen from in front of my shop and naturally I have no video of the incident because neither of my two cameras were working at the time it occurred. I will be looking for another brand of cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2021

Review Text: We got our puppy about three weeks ago and just started leaving her in her pen for short periods of time. We really needed the peace of mind in knowing she was okay while we weren’t home. This camera is great! I did have to purchase the longer extension power cable, but that’s just because of our lack of outlets where we wanted to place the camera. Overall, it’s really great for our new pup. I like that it has night vision and motion notifications, I can see all of the motion-sensed videos it took during the night when ever she got up. It helped us determine our pup does not like her nice fluffy bed, but prefers the hardwood floor. We removed the bed from her crate and now she sleeps more soundly. I will echo what other reviews have said, in that it would be nice to have a continuous stream of the live feed, instead of having to hit continue every 30 seconds. But for the price I really can’t complain - this camera meets all of our needs.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022

Review Text: I try connecting it to my wifi and it didn't work. I called Amazon they transfer the call to the Blink company they try helping me with the set up but nothing. I was told my the associate he will send me a new one and I would just have to send this one back, never got the second one. Here I'm home with a camera that don't work and I can't even get my money back because is past the time. Ended up ordering a different brand not a Blink and this one works great.

Review Title: you cant view the camera in the Alexa app
Review Text: We wanted this to monitor our dog while we are gone who has severe separation anxiety - but the short comings make it at best a surveillance only camerabig things i do not like:1. you cannot view in the alexa app so you have to have yet another app to view the camera thru - this is SUPER annoying when you have multiple brands of Amazon products and none of them can work thru the same channel2. when you are talking thru the camera, you cannot hear the audio from the camera3. no way to hold down the talk button (more like having a conversation instead of just one way input/output)4. picture is not great - cannot see into a dog crate in daylight5. the app wants me to pay for the recording service constantly - geeni takes screen shots when motion is detected and it is free to view themcant say i recommend it over a $15 geeni from walmart.

I have changed my review from 1 star to 5 stars because of their support and since everything is fixed and working great!I have four of the standard Blink cameras installed in and out of the home. Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   I love this little camera by amazon, finally they know how to make something good other than the trash cans.I have 2 Blink outdoor, and recently added this Mini indoor and I am satisfied with it's performance. Even though optics are not up to par with other manufacturers, but given the fact that price and ease of the use, it is worthy contender.Night vision is actually very useable, as far as I noticed, Blink is using software based motion sensing, not the  PIR motion sensor, this is the reason it detracts the motion all the way at the end of the frame as good as at the start of the frame.Overall, I am recommending this to anyone who is looking for a security camera which is easy to install and use.

Review Title: Parent’s best friend while distance learning!
Review Text: I got these to help me with my 3rd and 6th grader’s distance learning. I also have a a 4 year old. My third grader is autistic and I am having to help him most of the day. It’s been convenient to have one in each bedroom where they are schooling and in the playroom and the living room. I Can tap into each camera and talk to one child while I’m helping another.  The view is wide. I was surprised as how much of the room I can see.Kind of Cons- Sometimes my voice isn’t loud enough from the camera if there is noise closer to them.  With 2 zoom calls and steaming shows, our Wifi is over extended. Sometimes the live stream can freeze. It’s perfect for my needs. It has really really relived a good amount of stress and running up and down stairs.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2020

Review Title: Can you tell what this is?
Review Text: I cannot believe these other reviewers saying ‘high resolution’  - this is a picture of my peach tree but you sure couldn’t tell from the videos. Oh, yes, and some kind of bug(?). Someone has stolen all my peaches and I’d hoped this would nail the thief but no… you can’t see ANYTHING about the peaches disappearing. Don’t see any person but the peaches are magically gone. I did put the camera outside - as in 1" outside the window NOT any real distance, temp same in and out right now - as motion detection won’t work behind glass. See a lot of flying bugs.Can’t even tell what kind of bugs. Very poor. PLUS I get all these messages as to why it is not working. The "Live View Failed" is one a LOT of people get and yes, I went through the set up again and again. The network problem? This sits about 10 feet from the new AT&T fiber modem. NOTHING else complains about the network.Definitely returning.

Review Text: Update, 5 star, 2020-04-23:I was contacted by Blink support the next day, after my 1 star review.  They quickly generated an RMA and I received a replacement camera with a few days.  I was able to install the camera within 2 minutes - worked perfectly!  Very happy with the camera so far.I was very pleased with the quick and polite service response.Original review, 1 star, 2020-04-19:I was looking forward to adding the Blink Mini to my existing Blink network of cameras, but was quickly disappointed when it failed to install.  Looks like I got a bad camera.  Attempted to get a replacement, but a refund was the only option available.  The camera appears to have powered up correctly, showing the expected blinking light pattern, but when I'm directed  to connect the phone to the camera's WiFi 'BLINK-XXXX', I can't find it on the phone's WiFi list. Review Title: If you have an existing legacy data/cameras- don’t buy these
Review Text: First, the cameras are nice and easy to set up, the super bad- if you have a legacy (free) cloud storage plan with your existing cameras and add any new camera (mini-blink),  it will start auto erasing all your camera footage in the cloud after the “free 60 day “ trial ends for your new cameras.  I even purchase the outrageously expensive premium storage plan and that did not fix the auto delete -even though I have unlimited storage and delete set to 60 days.  I deleted the two next mini-blinks and now my legacy system cloud storage is not being erased every 2-3 days.  Blink customer service has no clue- spend at least 2 hours and 6 calls/emails with them trying to fix the error.  At this point I think I would just buy the off line hub storage if you want to add new cameras.  Totally sucks!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2022

Review Text: As seems to be typical with these cameras is there is no detail, and they are easily adversely affected by light.I have very good internet, and these thing drop connection consistently. I have several ADT cams, and they are connected all the time.The mounts do not work on a wall, as they won't open up to 90 degrees. So to get a whole room they have to be mounted so high, they are pretty much useless.I have one in my garage, when the garage door is opened (like for Amazon deliveries), The light coming in washes out the picture rendering them useless.My rating one these is JUNK.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2021

Review Title: Overly restrictive terms of service & doesn’t detect cats
Review Text: I got this camera to catch my cats climbing my counters. The motion detection will get set off by people all the time, but not once has it detected the cats. This makes me think it’s a deliberate design choice, and for me it’s a deal-breaker.The more annoying thing, though, is their overly restrictive terms of service. You’re not allowed to try to create your own custom software and integrate it with the camera. They warn that if they catch you doing something like that, they’ll disable your account and your camera will be useless. Probably because they want to preserve their flawed business model intended to force you to either subscribe to their cloud service or buy their local storage setup to back up your recordings. It’s a BS money-grab, come up with a real product before someone else does it for you.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2021

Review Title: Blink? More like all they do is sleep
Review Text: Own three of these cameras, and none work well at all. Despite tweaking the sensitivities and other settings, and doing resets, they are worthless. One, when armed, does not detect any motion, 2 inches, 2 ft, 20 ft, nothing. Unless I want to live stream and watch it all day, it serves no purpose. The second works about 25% of the time at detecting motion, but is inconsistent to say the least. The third camera is possessed. Sometimes it records motion if I walk by about 6ft in front of it, but no further than that. The creepy part, is every morning between 3:00 and 3:02 am, I get 3-8 alerts and recordings of no motion whatsoever.I had high hopes and expectations, but these are a waste of time and money.

The most annoying thing is after the 30 day trial the camera is pretty useless if you don't upgrade to the subscription cloud service. The camera will still work in live view for a few seconds at a time but you can't record anything or review previous recorded clips.

Review Title: Echo show and Blink do not work well together
Review Text: The Blink camera's I bought were purchased with an Echo show.  Setup of the camera's on Android, using the Blink app was easy.  Overall image quality is good.Getting Blink to work with the bundled Echo show has been futile.  The directions indicate the setup must be done in the Alexa app, so that was a challenge since the echo show doesn't have that app.  And I don't have any history using the Alexa app, so it took me some time to figure out I had to install that app separately on a different device.But the real issue I have is that the camera's are named in Blink. And the advertisement and the Echo show app all say you can use the cameras with simple names.  But this has not been possible for me.  The Alexa App detects the camera's and names them only by the serial number.  Naming the camera's is not currently explained in the "Alexa Setup and Troubleshooting Guide".Additionally, one camera only detects motion sporadically.  I have these in a shop environment and I frequently only get detected by the second camera.  I pass the first twice and it usually doesn't notice me.  Both are about the same range.

Review Text: These cameras are great when they work, they have pretty good picture and sound quality,  but unfortunately they don’t record motion an awful lot of the time. They’re obviously not the highest quality/most expensive cameras on the market but it’s disappointing to have put over $300 into 6 cameras and a memory plan and find that they only record about half the time. I bought them for my grandmother’s house as she has daily caregivers and significant memory issues and I wanted to be able to keep an eye and make sure they are there when they’re supposed to be and doing what they’re supposed to do but these don’t trigger more than half the time making them unreliable for their intended use. I wouldn’t buy them again and wouldn’t recommend them to anyone who actually needs reliable recording functionality

Review Title: Worth The Extra Security - I Guess
Review Text: For the added security of knowing you have the ability to watch over your home/possessions while away puts your mind at ease.  We have two of these units in our garage. One monitors the cars and tools in the garage, the other, is in the attached 1/2 car enclosed shed that houses more tools and equipment.The Pros:- Instant notifications- Ability to see activity live and interact with anyone that comes with distance of triggering the unit- You are in control of when and how you want the units set i.e. set times of when you want them on or offCons:- Having to pay to get the recorded snippets or any live content- The whole purpose of getting a system like this is to capture those moments when there may be an intrusion of some sort, not having that means you have paid for something and get nothing. I am truly disappointed that because of an upgraded camera, you are subject to the fees associated with maintaining it to its full functionality.

Review Text: Worked amazing before my 30 day trail ended. I went ahead and payed the monthly fee because if not the system is pretty much useless and what’s the point of having a camera if you can’t see what’s going on when you’re not home! Now that I have the monthly fee my camera works well sometimes but 90% off the time it says offline and sends me notifications about motion detection hours after they’ve been recorded. Review Title: Can NOT be used as always-on baby monitor
Review Text: I purchased bundled with Echo Show to use as a baby monitor. It does not work for this function, despite many other reviews and sites saying so. You have a limit of 30-60 sec before prompted to turn off live streaming. You can click “continue” for up to 5 minutes and then it turns off. On Echo, no continue prompt to click but still stops after 5 minutes. If you only want a notification when your baby moves and/or check-in periodically, this may work for you. But if you are looking for an always-on web camera that can be always streaming, day or night, look elsewhere. I’m still testing the motion detection feature to see if I can use this for something else but if I hadn’t basically gotten it for free with the bundle, I would be returning it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2021

Review Title: DO NOT BUY. Bait and switch performance from lying Amazon
Review Text: I have four of these, and they worked great while Amazon still let them function as originally advertised. Now they don't work at all unless you pay a subscription fee -- the lack of which was one of the PRIMARY REASONS I BOUGHT THEM IN THE FIRST PLACE.Stay the hell away from Blink.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2021

Review Text: I originally had a one-star review because I was not able to get the camera to work for me. I had thought that it was the fault of the camera itself, but I was wrong. Thankfully they have fantastic customer service that quickly got in touch with me to find out how they could help me.It turns out that I had not configured my camera right and my WiFi router needed to be rebooted. Review Text: This camera is garbage. It worked great for a few weeks. Then... nothing but problems. I have several Blink cameras that work fine but I wanted one that is wired. This thing can’t even consistently stay connected to WiFi. I am constantly rebooting it and even deleting it and connecting it all over again. I know it’s NOT my WiFi. Review Title: Everything not inclusive of two way audio works, Two Way audio is completely unusable
Review Text: I got two of these cameras in a 2 pack and the two-way audio if completely unusable as it gives terrible feedback.  I tried it from different devices and from over 10 miles away and nothing helped. I adjusted the volume levels on the cameras for their speakers and the support was of no help.  Basically just have you remove the camera from the app then re-add the camera back.  then they want you to playback the recorded video and see if there is a noise in the recorded video and when there is not, they say there is no problem.  The recorded video is not the problem, the problem is when you press to talk through the camera you get a rolling ear piercing feedback noise.  I am not the only one having this issue as you can see in other reviews. I bought another camera to see if maybe it was the batch I got and the same issue with it.  Now I have 3 of these cameras and they are only good for video and listening to recorded sound.  Now i will say that the video and recorded sound are good but there is no two way audio that is usable.

Review Text: This Camera is not worth buying as it's subscription base cloud storage only.  Once Trial is up for the storage, you will have to pay a monthly subscription.  Or it seems you would need to pay more for the larger blink Cameras which seem to provide a local storage hub.  The Blink Mini does not provide a way to store recordings locally.  It does not provide a constant live view, it will only provide a few seconds, up to 30s I believe from the settings, and you have to keep monitoring it.  If it disconnects from the Wi-Fi connection, which could happen, it will not re-establish a connection unless you unplug the device and plug it back in.  Not good if you're away and trying to use this from the app and your home has a power surge, or a possible brown out.  For me, it's not worth the hassle.  It being plugged in constantly is nice though and can put it by any window or power outlet for use.  The lack of local storage and the monthly subscription for cloud storage to view your activities are disappointing.  Would rather pay more for local storage.

Is there a firmware fix or a community fix or hack?I see even the expensive Blinks have an unacceptable delay to save an image.Night vision is pretty useless inside as the window just reflects the IR (guess) and looks like a reflective mess.Picture quality is actually ok with a petty wide angle for the price. Review Text: Finally. A good basic quality HD camera system that is easy to set up and works immediately without any histrionics. I did the “by 8 AM” delivery, and they were at my door when I got up this morning at 6 AM. These were up and running by 6:30, and that’s only because I needed to have my coffee first. Plug and play. Easy as could be. Small, discreet. You get a few free months of cloud storage as well. Those features aren’t that important to me because I’m typically wanting to check on my dogs during the day. The microphone is super sensitive. I was way out in the kitchen and had the living room camera open and spoke softly, and it picked it up. You want a simple and discreet camera system that you don’t have to hire Geek Squad to set up - this is it. Very happy with this purchase.

Review Title: Not as good as the outdoor versions
Review Text: If you have experience with the outdoor Blink cameras you'll notice a difference in these mini-cameras. They work fine and provide a good picture but seem to be slower to react to movement than their outside battery powered counter parts. Also, at times when in a dark room, the video starts with 5 seconds or more of black before the picture actually shows in the recording. I've never had this problem with the outdoor ones. But for the price they provide a good value.

Review Text: Camera constantly drops connection for no discernable reason. When it IS on, it will catch fluctuations of light (e.g. its own led going on) and flood you with motion detection alerts, yet someone will walk directly through the path of view and it won't trigger and you'll be left with no video of an event you were trying to capture.We bought these (for inside) and Google Nest battery cameras (for outside) and the quality in detection, connection, and video is not comparable. Coupled with Amazon's unwillingness to relay Nest doorbell alerts to Alexa, this entire experience has us swapping out Alexa and Blink cameras for Google Home and Nest, all after years of Amazon use.Sorry, we just don't have time to wait for Amazon to sort out this glitchy system when we paid for security today.

Review Text: Have had this for a few weeks now. It’s an ok picture for the price, but that’s if you have a clear view in front of the camera. I have it pointed out my back window to monitor my porch door area and at night it cannot even produce a picture at all. It’s also set on motion detection and there are days when I check the camera to see if something got into my trash bins and it hasn’t recorded anything at all for the day - even though my family has been walking in front of it numerous times. I turned the sensitivity up all the way and still there are days it just decides to not capture anything. I’ve even stood in front of it and waved around to test it…nope, no capture. Then what’s the point of having this if it isn’t reliable in capturing footage for security reasons?

Review Text: So I waited about 5 months before writing a review.  The Blink Mini is good for checking in on my house doggie with the live view.  That's about all it's good for.  It records when there is nothing to see moving.  It somehow loses color and views or records in black and white about 20% of the time.  The sound bounces on and off.  There is too long of delay before it begins to record...I can come inside the house and turn the corner into my kitchen and it will not pick up the movement unless I am in view of the camera for about 5 seconds or so.  Someone could actually dash into the house and around the corner without being recorded.  But like I said it is pretty good for just checking in to see what my dog is doing at home alone.

Review Title: Does what it's intended to do
Review Text: Allows me to keep an eye on my dog when I'm not home, which is the sole purpose of the camera.  Daytime, the picture is in color and appears sharp and clear; nighttime, the picture is black & white and clear enough.  Haven't decided where to mount it yet; doing so would give a better view of the living room/kitchen area.  Right now it's on a bookcase so view is limited to her bed area for the most part, but I'm satisfied with that for now.  Bonus was the microphone feature; when tested by simply whispering her name, my doggie's ears perked up immediately and she looked right into the camera.  Easy setup.  So far, has worked as expected; the furthest I've been away from home to date was 25 miles and there were no problems.

Review Title: The security issue on this device needs to be addressed and fixed.
Review Text: I recently ran a data recovery application called disk drill on the micro blink usb drive I have attached to the sync module after discovering that someone was doing a “live view” on my indoor cameras when it clearly wasn’t me.  What I discovered is that there were a bunch of deleted videos on this device that I bought brand new and the 64 gigabytes on it were not anywhere near being used up on it.  I ran the scam after only having it for a few days. The only explanation is that someone is hacking into my blink account.  When you google if this camera can be hacked it states that there are no recent documented cases of this happening. What does that mean exactly?  What steps need to be made in order for any suspected hacking to be “documented?”  When I look at my wife network blink is listed as being “unsecured.”  It seems to me that since this is a security camera that more measures should be made to make it more secure. A sophisticated thief can hack into these cameras.  I really like these cameras, the videos it takes are clear, the night vision on them is awesome, the audio is ok it needs a little improvement but overall setting them up is fairly simple and the cameras are great quality cameras except for the security part of it.  This company should really try and address this very important issue about their product.  I do not know why this issue was not taken care of before they were put on the market.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2021

Review Text: I should've known when I bought my Echo Show when it said it included a camera it was too good to be true. But it's an Amazon brand and I have plenty of other products made by Amazon that work great. So I held out hope. This camera does what is supposed to and can live stream whatever you place in front of it..thats about it (unless you buy a monthly subscription, it can do more apparently but I won't be exploring that) But let me tell you some not so great things I've noticed over the past 6 months. The live stream feature is severely lacking and has a loud audible popping noise while watching even when you are on a different end of the house (which can only be heard by the observor). Next, I'm the type of person who likes to have my phone set up so I can watch my child fall asleep while I'm in my office, it gives me peace of mind. After having live stream activated it will ask you almost every minute if you want to continue watching, otherwise it will time out the screen. The next thing that was not so great to find out was when I mistakenly took my phone into my sons room with me. I had the app open, and walked into the room where the camera was and it let out a horrible screeching noise... lovely. I should've stuck with my already installed home security cameras (Arlo!), but I didn't want to see this go to waste. In my opinion, this would be a great pet cam. But that's it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2021

Review Text: Cons: 1 - The camera goes to sleep, and may not detect motion. Not reliable. Update: Blink has confirmed that they have an issue with sleeping camera. The unit fails to switch from night view to day view, and will not record movement. Recommended workaround is to disarm/then rearm camera daily until a firmware fix is available. (No projected delivery date for the fix)  I would consider a major problem until that is resolved.  2- The triggers to Alexa are unreliable, even with the Blink skills, reinstalled on Alexa. Update : Cas of Blink Customer Support wrote that "....you might be able to do it with Alexa Routine Triggers....". (I'm not feeling the confidence there.). Many times, we recieve a message from Alexa, "sorry, I dont know what went wrong"3 - Subscription required to retain video clips. ie, if you want to see past motion (ex:someone at front door), you must pay Amazon a monthly fee, and clips are stored in the Cloud for your review. Amazon claims you can store clips locally but you need additional technology. (You guessed it - you must pay Amazon for that technology.)And even then, it appears that clips are still stored in the Cloud!)4 - Poor conversation capability - way to tinty and low volume to be of any value.Pros: Good picture, easy to install (except communications with Alexa!),  intuitive appBottom line: its just not a device you can count on. Get a Wyze camera - much more reliable, no subscription requirement to store video, and about the same price.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020

The set up was quite easy and I was pleased with how the camera was working until about a week or two after I got the camera when all of a sudden it disconnected and still to this day will not let me reconnect. I have tried everything in the manual and contacting customer service with no luck, so unfortunately now this camera that was once great it’s now just sitting unused and worthless on a shelf. Review Text: This makes a fantastic addition to our Blink system. I replaced an XT2 at the front door with this one. It's more apparent that it's a surveillance camera, partly because you can configure the green light to stay on. Live View seems to kick on quicker than the XT2.This camera doesn't have a battery, so I'm using a phone charging battery as a backup, which is plugged in to keep that charged.Pros:- Quick start of Live View- Great picture quality- Attractive bullet camera design- The green light can be permanently enabled to make it obvious that it's operational (a separate blue light turns on when it's recording or in Live View)Cons:- I wish it wouldn't bother me to keep tapping Continue - It's not limited by battery power, so it should just let me keep watching - At least I can do that while watching with my Alexa Echo Show

Review Title: you can’t watch the live continuously without having to press continue after 60secs
Review Text: I would probably give this 5 stars if I had the opportunity to watch the live stream for as long as I want to, also if it was wireless but I can deal with the wire if I was able to watch the live for longer than 60secs without having to press a button saying ‘continue’ i bought this for the sole purpose of keeping my eye on my 18 yr old westipoo dog when she’s sleeping in my upstairs bedroom, I’m not separated from her a lot but when i’m downstairs doing things while she’s sleeping upstairs, i decided i didn’t want to have to run up and down the stairs 50x a day to check on her every 20 mins, so i got this camera to watch her instead. Yes it notifies me when there’s motion, which is fine when she’s sleeping on the floor, but she’s blind and has dementia, she insists on sleeping on my bed a lot, so just getting a motion notification could mean i have a split second to get upstairs before she walks off the bed and breaks her old lady bones by the time it notices her moving and notifies me. She might be blind and have dementia but she knows who i am and wants to be with me every second so she often knows when i’m not in the room with her or laying next to me even when she’s asleep which is why i need the cam too so I can know when she wakes up, to avoid her pacing around the room looking for me.Other than that flaw (which is kinda major in my case) the picture/video quality is quite clear there’s a very very small delay which is understandable and I can check up on her when i’m not home which is nice too.

Review Title: Good can for the monet, but customer service needs work
Review Text: Bought this mini cam to be used as a monitor for a relative recovering from illness. Clarity of video is excellent in daytime light, pretty good on nighttime vision too. Review Title: Does Not Live Up To Expectations
Review Text: This item has replaced the Amazon Cloud Cam. I have found several things that I did not like about this item. One is the app. The app looks like it was created by a 3-year-old.  It is hard to use and has a very bad UI. This cam cannot be viewed on a computer. With the Cloud Cam, you can view all of your cams on the website for Cloud Cam. I like to have my cams up on my computer while I am working on the computer. This cam you can only use on the phone. Overall the picture quality was very good. The features leave a lot to be desired. This is an update to my previous review. I have 2 of these cams now b/c my cloud cam died for good this time. I still do not like the app where when you open it is just 2 blank screens and you have to choose what cam to watch. You should be able to open the app and see both cams at one time then choose if you want to see one full screen then you can. Next is when you do have one of the cams pulled up you have to keep hitting continue every few seconds to keep watching the camera. Remove that  continue. I like to set my phone up while I am working and watch my cams. I do not want to have to hit a button every few seconds to keep it from turing off. 3 there is no way to watch the cameras on your web browser. Cloud cam allowed you to sign in and keep the cams up and running in a browser window.  The night vision is bad when you have it sitting in a window looking out. The reflection of the IR is really bad. Cloud Cam did not have this problem. This product needs a ton of work but the picture is super.

Review Title: You can not view live view for over 30 seconds, it times out. This is not mentioned in anywhere.
Review Text: Review is for the BLINK Mini. The camera setup easily, the video is ok, the audio is ok. Problem is, if you are viewing on a smartphone, tablet, anything EXCEPT a Echo Show, the live stream times out after 30 seconds and you have to hit "continue" to bring the live stream back. There is no option to turn this off / have the camera show you a continuous live stream unless you use a Echo Show.If you use a Echo Show, it DO NOT HAVE 2 WAY AUDIO. You can only hear the camera, you can not talk through it. So if you want to talk to a person you are watching on the Echo Show, you have to stop the Echo Show stream, start the APP on your phone or tablet, enable "live view" and then talk to the person.  I only have to do this once or twice a day, so it's not bad for my use case, but if you need to talk to people a lot it's not a great setup.for $30 it's not bad, not great. If they let you have live / continuous viewing through the app so you could monitor all day and talk to whoever you want it would move up to 4 stars.

Review Text: The cameras were very easy to set up. The only problem I have is that you can't continuously watch live footage. I will update further after 30 day trial.*Update*  cameras, doorbell and sync module all blinking green and not reading wifi. My wifi connections are strong all my other devices working fine. Glad this happened before 30 day free subscription expired. I don't need to be resetting these devices all the time. Plus you can only view live for a few seconds anyway.*Update 2* After working all day on all devices it suddenly just started to work. I don't know if blink servers were down on there end. Maybe they should notify us so we don't go crazy resetting everything. I will give it one more chance before I pay for there service.

Review Title: THE BEST SECURITY FOR THE PRICE
Review Text: As a father of 2 I'm going to give you my complete unbiased opinion on this camera and let you decide.PROS: So easy to set up. Only time I looked at the directions was to see the app I needed to download. I love the 1080p and the Night Vision is great of set up correctly. Live video feed to my phone is wonderful and even has a 2 way microphone.The camera armed continuously sends you out alerts ⚠️ as long as motion is going on. ( PLEASE NOTE THAT WHEN YOU FIRST ARM THE CAMERA YOU WILL NOTICE THAT THE FOOTAGE TAKES PLACE AFTER THE MOTION HAS BEEN DETECTED, THIS WILL LEAD YOU TO THINK " OH WELL ITS TO LATE IF SOMEONE BREAKS INTO MY HOUSE" YOU CAN GO INTO THE SETTINGS AND CHAGE IT TO ALERT YOU AS SOON AS THE MOTION HAS BEEN DETECTED ) very inexpensive and magnificent for it's price. HOWEVER!!!CONS: YOU MUST PLAY AROUND WITH THE SETTINGS. what do I mean by that? The camera comes default 720p and the Night Vision is low quality. You need to go into settings and change that. The same with the motion detection you need to go in and adjust that. Things that can't be adjusted are what aggravate me the most such as, the speaker used in the 2 way is not lowed whatsoever. It was Night time and my son had his tablet on low and he couldn't hear me talking even though the volume was set to max. The livestream keeps asking me if I'd wish to continue watching what feels like every 5 seconds and if you look away just for a sec and/or don't click continue in time the live feed cuts off. Sometimes it's hard to get the live feed back up and you have to force close the app. The Night Vision after adjusting it in settings is wonderful as long as there are no reflective or even somewhat reflective surfaces near it. I had min place on the top of the cabinet and the white surface of the cabinet distorted the feed and wasn't real able to see passed it. Once I moved it to have it rest on a darker none reflective spot it worked like a dream.OVER ALLI really do love this little camera. I feel like a good majority of the stuff I dislike about it could be fixed with and update. The only thing that I would suggest changing in the next model is a significantly louder speaker so my kids could hear me. The live feed being cut short could be updated to continue to play as long as the app is open. Yes I get they're probably trying to save us data or battery life on out phones but that doesn't matter to us when we're checking on whatever we care enough to protect which is the whole purpose of buying a security camera. I really do love this little camera and I do highly recommend buying it. It does have its flaws but over all its the best I've ever seen at this price point.That you for taking the time to read my review. I appreciate your time and hope you found this helpful.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2021

Review Text: There were many flaws with this... I 100% promise the Wyze Cam is better in every way AND it's cheaper. I got rid of my Blink Mini after trying a Wyze Cam.The Blink support couldn't help me with an IR issue, you can't turn off the IR in night mode (it's useless if looking through a window at night if you're relying on any IR light, including with an external IR light source), and the app honestly is terrible. Every 30 seconds of live viewing requires you to say you're still viewing. After December, you will have to pay for any useful cloud storage. The Wyze has free 14-day rolling footage (the only downside is it only records the motion for around 12 seconds without a paid plan). Also, I got motion alerts constantly for things like bugs. The Wyze uses AI to detect if the motion is a human and if so you can set the Wyze app to notify you only for HUMAN motion (I tested it during day and night and it works well). Also, a Wyze allows for local storage to an SD card and the Blink only allows local storage if you buy an additional Blink product that enables local storage.TL/DR: Don't consider a Blink Mini, buy Wyze Cam instead. It's better in just about every way.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020

Review Text: OK - so I got this camera for $5 on a promotion. I'm glad I paid no more than that for it.This little camera is similar in size and shape to th $20 Wyze V2, a nice little camera that I have several of. It is not, however, similar in features. The first thing I learned about it was that you cannot use it for continuous monitoring, something that all of my Wyze cameras can do. When I contacted their tech support about it, they told me there was no way to use it for that. Evidently, the 5-minute time limit is supposed to "conserve bandwidth." On a WifI network? WTF for??I did not bother to check out any of its other features. If you want a good, cheap security camera, get a Wyze.

Review Title: Good but it's a subscription product
Review Text: This is a pretty great service. Very useful indeed. The motion detection is effective. The app is excellent. The picture quality is great and the hardware is really not bad at all (2.4GHz only). No bugs. All round a win..... exceptWhat they don't tell you is after I think a month you have to subscribe to a $3/mo Amazon cloud service to record the video feed. If you don't this product doesn't work well. You can invest and buy a local storage solution, but thats a good $50ish. Had they been more upfront about this I wouldn't have purchased. In a way I'm glad they weren't because now I have it I'm very happy to $3 for the service.Mixed feelings but overall an asset. Since you can always return I suggest buying the product and trying it out.

Review Title: Look elsewhere for an Inexpensive security camera. Poor dependability and CS
Review Text: I'll start off by saying that I own a Blink mini and Blink XT2, which are used to monitor and ensure the well-being of my grandparents in a different house. The XT2 has worked well for me, but the Mini has just been problematic. After using the XT2, I bought a Blink Mini to add an additional camera since I was already using the blink ecosystem. Unfortunately, the Blink Mini recorded videos with static and bars going across it as if it was a 30 year old camera. I contacted blink customer service about it and after sending them a video file that clearly shows the issue, the customer service wanted me to do a wifi strength test to ensure the camera and module (sold separately for cloud storage) have good connection. It's worth mentioning that the blink mini and module are about 10 feet away from the wifi router whereas the Blink XT2 is 30+ feet away from the router and has zero issues. Anyway, I went to the other home where the Blink cameras are set up and completed the wifi strength test comprised of downloading this app and testing the wifi connection relative to the location of your camera and then sharing the report to Blink. But after completing the test and contacting Blink again, I didn't receive a message or call back. At this point, all this effort is not worth a $20 camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2021

Review Text: This camera went off all the time because of a bush moving outside. Turning down the sensitivity only put it into “I detect nothing” mode. Review Title: Forces you to Spend additional Money!!
Review Text: Picture quality is good for both indoor and outdoor cameras but the Blink App is setup such that you will be forced to purchase additional control modules to selectively schedule arm/disarm of certain cameras; also that you will be forced to purchase the annual subscription for network storage to avail a simple convenient feature to manage storage. This is because the edit select all and delete function is disabled for the local USB storage of video clips. I have contacted Blink Technical support via email and phone, and got the same answer that I would need to pay for the network storage at a cost of $100/yr. For a repute company like Amazon that owns Blink this is not the right thing to do. Hope they will revise the programming.

Review Title: Money making scheme for Amazon cloud service. Stay away
Review Text: I am downgrading my review to one star after trying to use these with Sync Modules after Amazon started charging for using the cloud. They WILL NOT WORK as a local-only system even though the clips are recording to a local storage. When you lose your connection to Amazon's cloud, these cameras go dead. And you have fewer options in the app using local storage, which is clearly a push by Amazon to try and get you to pay for the cloud service.I have also found that they don't always re-connect and start saving clips after a power or wifi outage without you having to fiddle with unplugging and replugging stuff. So if you go on vacation and the connection gets dropped, your cameras will be useless for days until you get back home and physically get it working again.Coming from an Amazon fan and stockholder, I have wasted far too much of my life trying to get this junk to work as reliable home surveillance. Disappointed in them.

Review Title: Not for continuous viewing or use in a quiet space
Review Text: Bought these for replace/add to a couple Nest cameras to monitor our toddler and for assistance in puppy training.Although setup was easy and video quality great, we determined fairly quickly that there are deficiencies which makes them not suitable at this time for our needs per the cons below:Cons: - No continuous view in app or via Alexa device like Echo Show.  30 sec max and a little longer on Echo Show unless you keep clicking on continue to keep the video going- App will only show video from one camera at a time.  If you want to monitor multiple areas at a time this is not possible- Only one person can view a camera at a time- Loud click when turning on.  This wakes up our toddler who’s a light sleeper (you can hear the click over a fan across the room on low speed).  Used for crate training a puppy for sleeping at night and wakes up the dog as well when we check on her.  From Amazon Support: to clarify that the Mini camera uses the IR at night when the room is dark to detect any motions, and the click for the IR on and off is the component functionality sound, and that can not be taking off unless you turn the IR off and give some light to the room.- Motion sensing is a little delayed.  Will alert you but not tell you which camera was triggered until you look up alert in the app.- Have to manually set or create a schedule for the cameras to monitor and alert you for security.  There is no option to turn on based on location automatically when you leave and return. - From Amazon: if you integrate the Blink system with IFTTT, you can enable the applet for arming/disarming the Blink system through the IFTTT location feature.- Subscription service required without the “x” system.Pros:- Easy setup- Great video quality- Interfaces easily with Echo Show- PriceUnfortunately due to the no -continuous video and loud click when they turn on and off these will be confined to use in our garage and shed where intermittent viewing and motion activated monitoring will suffice. Ordering another Nest thermostat for other areas.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2020
