Review Title: This is only narrowly useful and can be frustrating.
Review Text: 1. This does not stream. It takes short clips. Maybe that is enough for some users.2. Whenever a user wants access to the app to see the clips, a time-consuming process butts in. You have to sign in every time you use the app, but the process is complicated by a stupid security idea. Every time you sign in, you have to go to your phone, open a message, read a security code, and then type in the code. THEN the app will open. By that time, someone could be dead.If your phone stops working, you are out of luck because they cannot send the code by any other way.3. Tech support is junk--it doesn't matter whose fault it is. If you need help with the camera, app, etc., you will have to waste hours and energy so some foreign alternative to intelligent life can repeat a script and never fix anything, but make false promises and insult you.4. You will have to subscribe and pay if you want to save your clips or, I think, even see them. There is no way to save them otherwise.The few good points are irrelevant if you can't even get access to the app.

Review Title: Do NOT follow the directions that come with this camera.
Review Text: The camera comes with three lines of statements on how to set up.  It sends you to a website where you have to create an account.  THEN it asks for your credit card info with  a note that "your credit card will not be charged". However, if you read the fine print on that site, it says your card will be charged $39.95 a month if you don't cancel with the limited trial time period.  Thankfully my card company notified me that I was being charged.  You could NOT download the app without the credit card info.  I packed it up and was going to send it back but thought: "There should be an app I can download."  Went to the App store, downloaded the app, set up my account with no request for a credit card.  In face, it said I had free service till 12/20 and would only have to pay for cloud service if I requested it!  In addition, when I went to their website to notify them of this disconnect in their info, the support page came up with:  "page not found".  What a mess.  Thankfully I am ONLY using this camera when away to view the weather outside.  Inside the house, I use a group of much better cameras.  I would not recommend this product for the reasons others gave it a 1 or 2 star.  There are much, much better cameras out there.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020

Review Text: Gave this product 3 stars only because their support is extremely terrible. I called weeks ago and only option was to leave a voice mail. To date, never received call back regarding subscription. My trial period ended and I wanted to subscribe but getting a message "not available in your region". I live in the U.S.  ???? You would think if they want your $, they would be on top of this issue. Other than that, the cameras are great. I have 3 of them outside and no issues. Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2022

Review Title: Decent at best.  Don't expect too much out of this setup.
Review Text: A wifi camera for $35 - cool!  Oh, I need a separate $35  Module to store data locally?  I guess that isn't too bad for $70.  Oh, I also need to add on storage? $15.  $85 total.Despite it only functioning via A/C power (no batteries) there is no way to get a continuous video feed on it, even when you opt to manually go into live view more.  Blink claims this isn't an option because of the battery powered units and power cell consumption.  But again, this is an A/C powered unit.  It only allows you to watch a max of about 2 minutes, in 30 second intervals that prompt you to "continue?".  And yes, this is even with a Sync Module and 64GB of local storage.But in any case, I purchased this for the motion sensor and notifications.  That motion sensor function has been spotty at best.  It picks up cars driving by quite well, but often misses people that are clearly in view and, per the way Blink claims the camera's sensor works, changing pixels by moving.  I have the camera positioned up high, so there's no chance of the subject walking directly towards the camera (Blink repeatedly claims that it isn't recommended to position the camera where your subject is moving directly towards it).  I'm probably at the limits of it's distance (20 feet) but still, it should function properly even at their maximum recommended distance.  I keep reading reports of inconsistency from unit to unit and I can't help but feel that mine may be faulty.That said, the setup in total with the Sync Module and storage was ~$95 after tax.  I honestly expected a little better performance from the primary function, motion detection, for that total package price.  If I were to do it over again I would spend more on an all-in-one unit, or even a full system with more reliable motion sensor tech.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2021

Review Text: I have several out door cameras and work great. i needed a indoor one to catch a pet. This one i am not pleased at all. nothing works well on it, night vision is not clear, motion clips are set to 30 seconds only i get a max of 21 seconds if lucky mostly 3 seconds or no picture at all and if it will detect motion very unreliable. i have changed every setting and factory wiped it with no luck. Live view works sometimes .UPDATE:  The whole problem was with my WIFI, I have 4 APs . I set it up when using one and when i moved the camera to a new room it did don pick up the closer AP. All my APS have same name and password. I hade to shut off my 5g and disable the AX network to program. Works now and even 95% of time the motion clips are at 30 seconds. Still not sure why the camera would not pick up the closer AP and even the APP showed strong WIFI signal.

Review Text: I have had Amazon cloud cams that are awesome. After having one for a couple of years it stopped working. After having it for a few hours I noticed it wasn’t recording. I called support and they told me I had to adjust the sensitivity. That worked for about a day. There would be days that the camera wouldn’t record anything, I found that hard to believe since it was in my kitchen. And yes, It was armed and the sensor was on high.How can you have a camera that you’re not confident with!? That’s why I returned it! You may have better luck, I doubt It since others had the same issue. I’m going to try the arlo q.

Review Title: Mad I wasted my money and time
Review Text: I'm pretty sure this camera was trying to catch fire. I bought these to replace the other cameras we have- living room, family room, utility room, kitchen, entry way, and our baby's room. This one was in our baby's room. Review Text: I have a unique situation where I need to secure expensive equipment (astronomy) in a publicly accessible space.  This little device/software was the perfect solution at a great price. The camera only needs a usb port for power, it operates independently and can connect on its own to wifi. You can then manage through software (I'm using android, works fantastic). You can arm/disarm, when armed, if any motion it detects and starts capturing video/images, and send you a notification on your phone. Perfect so when I'm sleeping, I get a notice. It is fairly fast, about 8-10seconds for notification. Very easy to manage/delete captures. One of those few products that surprises you in every way - simplicity to setup, quality, and great value/price.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2021

Review Text: I've had this little camera for three weeks and so far:Pros:Lots of settings to personalize what you want-can pick where on the screen you want the camera to detect motion and record (ie. Not the busy street we live on but only where we're parked)-can set when you want security mode to be activatedGood camera qualitySmall and discreetCord is surprisingly longGood speaker and noise recording qualityHas not used up alot of wifiExcellent storage (I had been concerned about needing to buy storage but so far so good)Cons (and the reason it lost two stars)Sometimes it just stops notifying me. I've had my several instances where I get no notification when someone was clearly in camera range (example, I had a package delivered and no recording of it)Otherwise, cute, affordable, and useful.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2020

Review Text: I bought a two pack of Blink Mini cameras and have been pleased with the results so far. One is scheduled to arm at night, facing my windows/back door. This one arms without any problems, detects motion well, and has a pretty clear picture at night. The second is on during the day, facing out a window toward a bird feeder stuck on the outside of the window. I wasn't sure if the camera facing outside would pick up motion at all, and expected the video quality to be pretty bad through the glass, but it catches birds eating from the feeder without any problem and the video quality is pretty good considering it's recording through a window.My only complaint is there is a longer delay in connecting to the camera located on the opposite side of the house from the router. I ordered a new outdoor camera and once that arrives I'll connect the Minis to the Sync Module 2 and I'm hopeful that will help with the delay. Overall I'm happy with these cameras, they were inexpensive and are working well for their intended purpose. If they go on sale again I'll probably buy a couple more.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020

Review Text: I agree with other reviewers about the lack of being able to view the live feed continuously without pressing Continue. Super annoying not sure what that's about. Motion detection works but can take a lot of trial and errorn to position camera where it won't be triggered by neighbors etc when you set up the trigger zones in the app. I think the Blink cameras are really good but could be better. I also have a Blink Outdoor.

Review Title: Amazing device! Does exactly what it says it does and super easy to set up
Review Text: So far, so good. This little device does exactly what it says it does. The only thing it does not do is allow an SD card to be put in for data storage. It’s light, portable, reliable and you don’t have to plug it into a hub. All you have to do is plug it into a wall socket and off you go.What would make it even better though is a 10 foot cord so I can put it up higher and I don’t have to have some ugly extension cord showing if I put it on the wall. Other than those two things about the SD card and longer charging cord.I recommend this device to anyone looking for indoor added security that’s reliable, and notifies you when someone is in your space.Note – sometimes if I have to go out just for a little bit I just let it stream if I have concerns about someone in my room, instead of wait for a notification.

Review Title: Clear Image - Runs off Hot Spot
Review Text: I live way out in the country where internet is not available so I'm essentially forced to run a hot spot for internet. I was a little apprehensive in purchasing the Blink system for my house because I didn't know if they'd operate correctly on a Hot Spot. So if you're in a position like me and couldn't find a simple yes or no answer - YES! You're Blink Cameras WILL operate on your Hot Spot. I have 5 Outdoor Cameras, 1 Indoor Camera, and 1 Blink Mini Camera all connected and have not had any issues. Since this reviews is about the Blink Mini - The short answer is this little camera is awesome. Small and inconspicuous with great quality and I love the fact that you can talk through it unlike the original indoor camera Blink released. I use it to check in on my dogs when I'm not home most of the time. The wide angel allows me to capture much of the room with only 1 camera which is a bonus.

Review Text: Upated:  I have raised my rating from 1 to 4 stars since after my post I was contacted by customer support. Review Text: This mini-Blink came in a package with the new, more svelte Echo 5. Set up was very easy following the included instructions. I was up and running in under 10 minutes. Integration with Alexa was easy after the camera was detected by my network. Note the mini only works on the 2.4 GHz band - if you only have 5.0, look elsewhere.Picture quality is very good with distortion typical to a wide angle lens. Night vision is adequate. Currently only cloud storage is supported (free introductory period paid by Amazon), however, a sync module is due to ship which will provide local SD card storage.In short, this was a great value and I'm highly satisfied. I'll update in the event of issues.

Review Title: Great as a camera just to take a peak….

Review Title: Quality Great, Everything Else..Not So Great
Review Text: I bought this thinking it was going to be exactly what I needed. I have a pet rabbit who learned to yeet herself out of her pen, so I needed a camera to drop in every now and then to check on her. I purchased these during Black Friday so I got a pack of 3 for a good price.I set up the first one since I only received one initially until they sent the other two later, and everything was dandy. The picture was good, the night vision was good. The one thing that I quickly learned (when I propped up my phone at work) that wasn’t my favorite, was the fact that I can’t just keep the video on. It asks me three times if I wanted to continue before it glitch then kicked me out of the app entirely. I tired several times and noticed after the third “continue?” That it will just glitch and shut down the app.I read another review by Haley where she also said, “ The main issue for me is that there is no option for continuous viewing. The live view from the app will automatically shut off after 30 seconds if you don't tap the "continue?" prompt.”My husband had bought a different brand similar to the one I got for his work, but he has the ability to just bring up the video and set his phone down with no issue.The other really frustrating part is that you get a 30 free day trial before you have to pay for a subscription to be able to access certain features. 1. Why can’t I just be able to save video without having to pay for it? 2. When I have tried the save feature during the trial, it’s very confusing. I switched it over to save, but as soon as I exit out of live view then go back into live view, it had switched back to discard on its own. I also tried switching it to save then exiting and seeing the result after a minute, and as soon as I saw the saved footage, before I could even click it to watch it, it disappeared and I have no idea why. I go back into live view and it switched itself to discard again. So what’s the point? Why would I pay for something that doesn’t even work? I haven’t even opened the other two because what’s the point?10/10 would return and just get the one my husband has. He can also save footage without needing a subscription.

Review Text: Honestly, a bit let down by the overall experience with these cameras, of which I have four now.  They are suitable only for occasionally keeping an eye on a room or place and do not work super well for motion detection/security functions, and do not have great resolution for anything at a distance (across the room, say).  The Blink app which is required for your Alexa devices to show you the feed (for example on an Echo Show - "show the living room") does not always link up with the camera, even when opening the app directly on your phone or tablet links to the feed just fine.  The two-way communication is half-duplex (only one side can transmit while the other side receives) and the connection is wonky with audio sometimes completely dropping out entirely while using it.  I want to stress that these cameras are NOT useless - but they are not what you might be expecting.  I have repurposed them from my original intended use to tasks more suitable for them... for example, one of them now watches over a 3D printer so that I can check on it remotely.  If you want home security, or reliable two-way communications, definitely look at something else.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020

Review Title: Waste of time and money if you don't pay for the cloud service
Review Text: If you are using this with the could service it is okay. If you plan to use it without paying for their cloud service look else where. Their app is complete rubbish if using an USB to store clips. Using their cloud service you can delete multiple clips at once but they disable this option when using the USB. So, you have to delete clips one by one. If you don't, the storage will fill up quickly and stop recording new clips to the drive. So, if you buy this you should factor in the price of their cloud service.No night vision.No motion detection settings.Cannot clearly make out faces unless standing close to camera.

Review Title: Super Basic Features w/ Ok Quality
Review Text: We got this camera to keep an eye on our puppy when in his crate & playpen. Unfortunately, the quality isn’t what we expected & shortly after having it we realized that the features were too basic.Few cons:After 30 days your trial is over & the more advanced features are removed unless you pay monthly.There is a clicking noise from the camera that happens every time you log into the app to check in, it not super loud but loud enough to wake up my puppy.Night vision is just okay.The app sometimes takes time to load or says “system busy” or “authentication denied” (something of that sort).I did my research & realized that for a few more bucks there’s much more advanced cameras that can clearly capture the whole room & follow your pet wherever it goes while in that room.Just didn’t work for our needs with a puppy, we will return. Review Title: Inexpensive, but not the same as Nest
Review Text: I set these up in my office, and the motion detection when armed is 50% at best.  It misses motion / activity regularly so it's not dependable.  It also only captures a small clip, and you can't replay the time before or after it.  I've had instances where it picked up motion, but then it glitches and captures only a person entering the frame, and exiting the frame, nothing in between.I'd stay away from these cameras, if you want to protect your home or office i'd recommend Nest.  I decided against Nest for this use case because of the higher cost.  In this case, you get what you don't get what you don't pay for.

Review Title: Simple to set up and use
Review Text: It took a couple of tries to set up, but eventually it worked.  The Blink app is simple to use.  When motion is detected, it gets a notification, and then one can view the recorded clip or live connect to the camera, with sound.  That's how it works *if* you have a cloud account subscription, which is free for the first 30 days then costs $3/month or $30/year, depending on the plan.With an optional Sync2 module, it's possible to store clips to an USB drive locally, and perhaps skip cloud subscription at the cost of reduced functionality (one can view stored clips from a computer, or via the Blink app but without saving live views or other niceties).

Review Title: No way to watch continuous feed.
Review Text: This is a decent "starter" security camera I suppose, I put it in my kids room ( for the toddlers) to keep an eye on them and such, the issue is there is no way to watch a continuous feed. You can watch a 5 minute feed but you need to keep pressing "Continue?" when it comes up, and the motion detection only records a few seconds at a time. It is not efficient at all as security camera. Thankfully I only paid 5$ for it as an additional deal, also it ONLY runs off WiFi so if your wifi is spotty it will have issues with the set up.As for the camera its self, its decently built, I like how it is just a USB-C cable that connects to it in case it breaks its an easy replacement. The stand is completely able to easily disconnect from the camera but it isn't so easy that it will fall off on its own.If they fix the issues with how long you can view the stream I would highly recommend this camera, otherwise I just can not.

Review Title: UPDATE: Records in COLOR and NO FEE!
Review Text: UPDATE: Amazon contacted me and guided me to fix the constant black and white picture - I had to adjust the infrared to “auto” instead of on all the time. They also informed me I DO NOT have to pay a monthly fee because it is an add on camera to my existing Blink system.OLD REVIEW: I just set up the new mini and added it to my existing configuration of Blink cameras. All going well, except the new mini camera is only showing in black and white during the bright daytime. The old Blinks all record in color. Not sure why the black and white?? And I’m confused with all these reviews saying I will have to start paying a monthly charge to use the mini. If that’s the case, I’ll send it back!! I don’t like free to fee!!

Review Text: I got a great deal on this but it has been a big disappointment. It took 2 calls to support to find out that these minis only detect action side to side. If you have it pointed at a door, for example, and somebody enters it does not start recording until they walked past the camera. This obviously is a major flaw in the design of the product. I'm really disappointed that somebody didn't think this through in development.

Review Title: Image Delay from network speed and Unable to talk to people through Echo Show
Review Text: Three stars for amazing picture quality but... The features asked to be rated all refer to image quality. Nothing talks about the delay as well as the inability to hold a 2-way conversation with someone using the Echo Show. This defeated the purpose for us since we got this to go in our son's room and serve as a baby/toddler monitor. However, the image quality is amazing.Overall, if you are not looking for something that shows video in real time and plan on view only with your Echo Show than this is perfect. Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020

Review Title: Can only be linked to 1 account & requires 2FA
Review Text: I bought this camera so my wife and I could keep an eye on our dog when we have to leave her alone. However, the only way to access the camera is through 1 shared account, and what's worse is it requires 2FA to log into that account. There is no way to disable 2FA. This means a whole song and dance between the account holder and the person you want to share the account with. The app usually doesn't require that user to log in once access has been granted, but you better hope that it doesn't log back out for one reason or another. I will be returning this device for this reason alone. It works fine otherwise, and it has a lot of nice features for the price.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2021

Review Title: Warning you must pay a subscription plan for one indoor camera to work!
Review Text: Got this with an echo show at a discount price. Not worth it even if it is free. I did not see where in the product description that you must pay for your recording to be saved in order for this camera to work. I currently have an outdoor three camera system that is free. I started to register the camera but when I found out there is a monthly fee, I stopped right there.  It is brand new unopened in the box collecting dust.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022

Review Text: This new mini-camera provides the same high-resolution viewing as the larger X2 cameras, but is much smaller and less obtrusive (or less obvious to burglars?) as the X2 ... if anything, these are easier to setup (a snap, takes about 2 minutes per camera). But, like the X2 this one also insists on updating firmware before it comes-online (but it does this completely automagically, no user intervention required ... and it updates much faster than the X2 series). The only "flaw" I've seen, so far, is that the power-cord is difficult to plug into the (recessed) camera's jack ... it takes quite a bit of forceful wiggling to get it to go in (altho it is conveniently "keyed" so there's NO WAY you're gonna try and plug it in upside down ... the plug will only fit into the recess ONE way ... a good feature, if only they had solved the misalignment problem). It automatically added itself to my Alexa-Blink skill so the camera immediately is integrated into the Alexa app and works flawlessly (as expected). I was so impressed that I immediately ordered some more of these great little cameras AND can't wait for the updated/new Sync Module 2 to be released so I can have local-backup storage for all video clips.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020

Review Text: This camera was worth every dime and ignoring every bad review. Set up was simple. Picture quality was great! I originally got it so when my teenagers didn’t answer my calls and texts while I was at work I could check in on them. I loved it so much I ordered a 2nd for my elderly mom. I have it set to motion detect at night. I woke up to a motion alert this morning. She had fallen and couldn’t get up. I rushed to her house and all is ok now. Without this camera it would have been hours and hours before anyone would have checked in on her. I would get it 15 stars if I could.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020

Review Text: Should have listened to other reviews - this is NOT good as a baby monitor. But it doesn’t work that seamlessly, and you have to go and show the camera in question, and half the time it says “system is busy” so you can’t see anything at all. Plus every time we check on them, the camera in the room makes a clicking noise and a light turns on and off - so if the baby isn’t already fast asleep that has scared her. Seriously - don’t buy to use as a baby monitor. The price was good tho so now we are debating to keep for home security reasons or just return
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020

Review Text: I'm so glad I bought this during a black Friday sale. I'd pay full price for one in every common room of my house. I can use it as an intercom, set it to motion detector mode at night or when I'm gone, make it automatic night vision or on at all times, watch a live feed, save live views, and so much more. It has a long plug in cord so I was able to set it on top of my cabinet. It also has a mount with screws and rotates to capture the best angle and amount of space in a room. Only complaint I have is this particular model isn't considered weather proof and it wasn't compatible with my Alexa app even though it seems to link up with it. It's worth the price and I'll probably buy another to look outside my front and back door and kitchen.

Review Title: Not so simple and needs a new account with  your personal information.
Review Text: It's not for me. I found it too complicated and not very reliable. The corded power supply limits where I can place it. Activating the microphone produced a loud shrill noise. It can only be managed from mobile devices, there's no account management from PC. Since it only cost me $5 in a bundle with an Echo Show 5, I was considering deactivating it and putting it in storage, maybe to try again later. Since it's "linked" to Amazon/Alexa, I guess that means I'd have to start a new account with them, too. So I'll either return it or toss it, as I'd rather not have my profile sitting in Blink's cloud waiting for me to come back.

Review Text: This is the 3rd indoor camera I've used as a baby monitor and sometimes security device. I thought by getting an Amazon-branded product I would be buying something with a bit more quality and safety than the Chinese products I've had. Nope! Of all of them, these are the worst! They make a loud clicking sound when it turns on for live viewing and when it changes from daylight to night vision- and when you factor in the changes in ambient light from a door, curtain, or person moving those clicking sounds can be several times a minute! It's very difficult to see any detail in the night vision. When viewing live there is a very loud static sound that forces you to mute it. I refrain from using it for an hour after bedtime because the loud clicking can wake up my child/ prevent my child from falling asleep- making it largely pointless.

Review Title: Almost perfect - too bad they won't stay online for more than a few minutes.
Review Text: So, I wasn't expecting much for a cheap camera, but these are better than expected.I have only ONE complaint.They go offline a lot.I'm using them to help keep tabs on my aging mother in an assisted living facility.  The quality is great. the night vision is terrific. But I can't seem to stay connected to her feed for more than a few minutes at a time before the feed buffers, then drops.Mom has her own cable modem with 50mbps download and 10mpbs upload.10mbps should be more than adequate for the standard quality, but alas, the cameras drop offline constantly and I have to restart them.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2021

Review Text: The Blink system arrived promptly, but has been disappointing.  After some difficulties connecting the module, the cameras were easy to connect.  Currently 5 cameras and 2 doorbells are deployed.One big problem is that the system often delays the photos/notifications by 12 to 24 hours.  The burglars had come and gone by the time their picture arrived.Another big problem is that the camera only detects 2 of 3 cars driving through the gate.  2/3 security was not the goal.  Upping sensitivity resulted in lots of nuisance trips, but did not capture all the vehicular or pedestrian traffic.A third serious issue is that the cameras seem to go off-line in a random fashion.  Some came back online automatically.  Two are still off-line.One of the battery operated cameras drained the supplied batteries within 3 days of deployment.  The batteries were supposed to last 6 months or better.During daylight, the pictures are fine.  At night, car headlights overwhelm the cameras so badly that it is not possible to identify the vehicle type much less read the license plate.For $600+ I'm much less than happy.Rev A:  I contacted Amazon and have received some support.  System is still wonky.  Thumbnail still fails 90%+.I think my house may be too big for the Blink wireless range.  I am also working with wifi range extender, but so far the Netgear/Amazon extender has refused to connect to the AT&T and T-Mobile internet hotspots at the western and eastern ends of my property, respectively.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2022

Review Text: I bought this Blink Mini in a package deal with an Echo Show. I have always wanted to add security cameras to my house, but thought it would be too much of a hassle. We also have old wiring in our house, so I needed a camera that could be plugged into a regular outlet versus messing with the electrical system. This was beyond easy to set up and we couldn't be happier. The picture and sound quality is great, as well is the night vision and motion detection. The size is small and barely noticeable depending on where you put it. I love being able to arm my system when I leave the house and get all the motion alerts, even if it's just my dog wandering around. Will definitely be picking up some more minis soon!

Review Text: waste of your money.  You must purchase the blink app to use this camera.  Not worth the price even if the camera is free. I do not want to use the cloud, I just want to use the camera.  The cloud is NOT secure.

Review Text: I have the mini blink.  It’s in my basement so I can check on my grandchildren when they are downstairs.  Lately when I try to view the picture is gray and foggy.  I had to reset it and the wonderful picture came back.  Now I tried again today and it’s back to the foggy gray picture.  It was super easy to set up.  But I just bought it in May. Review Text: Great mini camera. Crisp picture day or night. Motion detection a plus. I used this the first day after purchasing it and I was so impressed, I ordered another one. Review Title: Once I finally managed to get it to connect, it works fine

I actually got to the ‘one last try’, and as if by magic... Review Title: mostly as advertised but rarely true HD picture
Review Text: This small wired camera works mostly as advertised except when in low light conditions. It switched to b/w when low light and then picture is fuzzy and blurred. I would not claim it has night vision ability.  When motion is detected at night it is barely anything can be recognized reliably in night vision mode.One disadvantage I found is mounting this camera. It is intended to be mounted on horizontal surface, which I did not have - attempt to mount this camera on vertical wall was unsuccessful. Screw worked through hole in camera base, but it is impossible to point camera to the center of the room. Not enough ball head adjustment range.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2021

Review Title: Wait to buy the Mini. Buy the XT2 now.
Review Text: I'd like to start out by saying that I have three XT2 cameras and I love them. Because of that, when I saw that the Blink Mini cameras were on sale, I figured I should add on to my system. This was a huge mistake. The cameras fail to switch from IR to regular filming consistently. This leads to either blown out footage or even failure for it to record at all. I switched off the IR on one of the cameras, hoping this would fix the problem, but it still fails to record about half of the time. It is a shame, because these cameras have much better mounts than the XT2s (stronger, more range of motion, and allow for bottom or back mounting) and not having to worry about battery levels would be nice. These cameras seem like they may be decent eventually, but I would wait until there is a patch to purchase them. Blink says that they are currently working on fixing them, but there is no ETA on when the patch may be out. In their current state, the cameras have been pretty much unusable.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020

Review Title: A decent budget home or small business security camera, provided you have good internet
Review Text: First and foremost: this camera does not store recordings locally. (On a data device.) It requires the internet to function for any purpose. Second, the length of recordings is limited and, therefore, of limited utility if you need a dedicated 24 hour recording or extended recording for security purposes. Finally, the storage Blink allots is limited to the point that this camera is not all that useful for tracking high traffic areas.All that aside, this indoor camera will function well enough as part of a mixed home security solution provided you have a decent internet connection. It is lightweight (in most every sense) and can be easily placed anywhere with funtak or similar light adhesives. It has decent picture quality, sound detection, and the sound output is similarly good. Nightvision is pretty good for a camera its size.  If you're looking for a camera that helps you check on your home/pet/children when you are away, this is a good choice. If you're looking for a camera for dedicated security, I recommend using a camera that has an onboard storage device (like an sd card) in conjunction. If you're looking for a hard security device or a dedicated streaming device, look elsewhere.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2021

Review Title: Fantastic Product same quality as Bigger Brands BUY THIS!!
Review Text: I have a 1yr old Akita that can get out of his crate. Because  this has 2 way audio it beeps my phone as soon as the camera senses movement. I was at the store I could then tell my pup to "Place" he went to his doggie bed and stayed there til I got home. Wonderful wonderful product for the price. I got the mini indoor monitor and you simply plug it in. It does not use a "base station"  It automatically connects to your wi-fi via an app. Took about 7 mins tops. I couldn't be more pleased. I have an $800 outside security what a waste of money. I will definitely order an outdoor camera for the side of the house that's not covered. Bye now

Review Text: 30-Days after setup.This camera is cheap and you get what you pay for. The quality is good and thats all it has going for it. When I set it up it gave me 30days free trial to the subscription service. During the 30days it detected motion maybe 3 times in my garage that I park my full sized truck in everyday. Today the subscription is over and now my app lets me know it's no longer recording video, I need to pay for it. And what do you know, it's capturing motion left and right, but I can't view it because I'm not paying for the service.I've had a Blink setup for about a year and the system is OK at best. It's good if you don't want to watch the cameras more than 30 seconds at a time. I have most of mine plugged in so I don't have to change out batteries and still the app will not let me watch live video without pushing the stupid continue button every 30 seconds.Long story short, skip these wireless POS cameras from Amazon and pay for wired cameras, old school hard wired with a physical hard-drive system, not cloud based crap.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021

Review Text: For the price this camera WAS a bargain. However, Amazon recently switched to a paid subscription for all the Blink features that have been free for the last year. Unfortunately, the camera at $30 is decent and had enough features for my use- not worth it with the monthly subscription. I will now go with a higher end camera that has premium features and reliability (even if it includes a subscription also) over this.original cost of the blink camera:-$30 camera purchase (with free features that meet the "plus plan subscription" included)new cost of the blink camera:-$30 camera purchase-$3.00 mo./$30 yr. basic subscription plan-$10.00 mo./$100 yr. plus plan subscriptionCamera pros:-simple setup-great picture quality-base camera price-ability to toggle on/off LED recording light-night mode works well (used minimally)-option to limit zones for motion sensing-push notifications for motion sense alarmCamera cons:-enabling night vision causes an easily audible noise every time the camera is activated-app reliability is sketchy (has been improving over the past year but still not reliable)-light shifts in the room will trigger the motion sensor and send alert (sun moving through day/clouds/etc.)-camera will go offline with no warning or apparent reason as troubleshooting does nothing (waiting is best method as eventually between 5 minutes and a couple hours it will "fix" itself)-length of camera power cord is less than adequate (mounting hardware and customizations are provided but mostly unusable due to power cord reach- best for table top use near a plug in)-total cost: $60 or $130 for initial setup and year subscription, $30 or $100 yearly as long as own camera
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021

Review Title: Not good for security, lapses & you have to log in with app more to get accurate alerts
Review Text: This is NOT an ideal camera for security, AT ALL! You should not use it as such. It lapses in sensing when movement is happening and does not alert you. I have had it for a over a week now and I’ve learned that it doesn’t sense ALL movement, it’s selective and it appears it’ll sense & alert more when you’re interacting with the app more. For example: I left my home at 6:46am today. I got alerted of a car going by around 9am. However, When I logged into the app to just take a peak, I found that my neighbors were standing right outside of my window and had been smoking for a while. The app NEVER alerted me of any movement at all. I would say absolutely do not trust this for ANY type of security usage. It’s got a great quality picture. This would be a great camera if you’re just checking on your pets. Will be returning.

Review Text: Portable, aesthetic indoor cam that offers premium features typically found on higher-end security devices like high definition, motion sensor, night visiona and remote access, the latter of which gives user the ability to monitor the scan area and communicate via built-in speakers while away using wifi. Had mine for several months and it certainly provides a little more peace of mind when I am at work or out in general. Very pleased with the device and seriously consider purchasing more in the future, perhaps one of the outdoot kind!

Review Title: Nice small camera and good interface, but quite a few drawbacks and flaws
Review Text: Have had this for a few months now.  Due to the price I decided to keep it because it's a small little camera and easy to set up.  However, EVERY day the motion detection completely stops working. I have to either go into live view and exit out again, and then motion detection MIGHT start working. Or I have to power-cycle the device. This happens every day, and have seen other reviewers with the same problem.  The camera itself isn't locked up because I can go into live view. The other issue is live view is limited to about a minute, then you can't use live view anymore for a timeout period.  This would make sense on their battery operated cameras, but this camera is plugged in.  Also, clips can only be a MAXIMUM of 30 seconds, and then the camera must wait a MINIMUM of 10 seconds before it is allowed to start recording again. These options are all visible in the camera setup. It's a shame it has these drawbacks.

Review Text: Just canceled the return request for the Blink Mini because it finally seems to be working. I was having trouble with it staying connected to WiFi & once it lost connection the only option was resetting the camera, deleting the camera info on the app & starting all over. I bought it to check the house while away (because we may travel again someday, you know...) and resetting the camera from a beach hundreds of miles away didn't seem possible.I wish I could tell you that it was the fine tech support staff from Blink that made the difference, but that would be lying. The three stars are for the camera. When it works, picture is clear, and the app lets you fine tune motion sensing settings. We'll see if I'm tempted to pay for storage or just use the app for live monitoring. Two stars empty for the worse than useless tech support. Email response was delayed by days, live phone was a crapshoot (Is that you Borat? Cool tie-in with Prime, but I need someone intelligible OK?) They had me download & run an app, RouteThis Helps, which supposedly analyzed my network and kicked out a cryptic code for me to forward. What info it gathered, I'll never know.  (Creepy? Yes.) Their analysis came in an email with a .png image attached basically saying "It's your WiFi, please contact your WiFi supplier." Not helpful. So, I trolled the Community postings for Blink & my router (a real good one BTW.) And started herping & derping with the settings.If you're still reading, here is the best advice I can give you if you're having trouble. If you have a dual band router, the camera can only use the 2.4Ghz band. Make sure, in your router settings,  it is separated from the 5Ghz band. It must have its own unique name, and its own unique password. Download your router's latest firmware, reset it a few times. Reset the camera, delete the Blink app & download again, setting up afresh. Make sure your phone/tablet is on the same 2.4Ghz network when you do the setup. Pray. Throw some salt over your shoulder. Curse if the kids aren't around. And it should work. Maybe.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2020

Review Text: I was looking for security camera and I ended up buying the blink mini for what I paid for it it does the job with a decent Wi-Fi connection you don't have to worry about it cutting in and out and the picture is pretty good even in night vision although it is only black and white but in the settings you can change the picture quality all the way up to 1080p and the night vision you can change the intensity of it so it's not blinding like other reviews have said the reason why it doesn't get five stars is because the live view option is annoying having to press continue every 30 seconds is really a bummer and I wish in a future update they changed that also would like the ability to record for more than 30 second intervals when motion is captured and not have a 10-second delay between videos the only other gripe issue that I have is that the power cord does not lock into the camera it's a snug fit but if somebody really wanted to they can just pull it out but overall if you're looking for a cheap camera and a cheap subscription service for me it's $3 a month before unlimited recording on the cloud it's not going to be the worst thing in the world but just keep in mind the cheap price doesn't give you every feature you want and if you're looking for a baby monitor or something to show a constant feed as of right now you can't do that

Review Text: Update: August 7, 2020I want to amend my previous review.Shortly after my original review was published I was contacted by someone from Blink who offered to help resolve the problem that initiated my negative review.We emailed back and forth and a satisfactory resolution was settled on and I’m pleased with the way that Blink responded.It makes me feel that Blink does care about their customers and about making things right.Because of this I want to be fair and amend my previous review.Thanks Blink!Original review below:I had already purchased my first Blink Mini a few weeks ago and was very pleased with it.The second one not so much. It arrived with the stand not attached to the cam.Maybe I’m just doing something wrong but no matter how hard I try I cannot get the stand to attach to the cam.So since I wanted the cam set on a high surface, my fridge, pointing downward, without the stand it can’t be used for what I purchased it for.Would just send it back but because of the virus and my being older and in the high risk group, I’m afraid to send it back.Plus I don’t go out so I’d have to ask a relative to risk coming over to ship it back for me, I don’t want to put them at risk either.So I’m stuck with a useless Blink Mini unless someone knows how to attach the stand to the cam and can please let me know.I already tried pushing the cam onto the stand or trying to screw the stand by hand into the hole at the base of the cam but when I let go of the cam it just falls back off of the stand.My first Blink Mini already had the stand attached when it arrived, so I’ve not had to deal with this issue before.Thanks for reading this.

Review Title: Doesn't live up to expectations - not for continuous monitoring
Review Text: Since it was a package with an Echo5 for very little I thought I'd give it a try.  I'm disappointed. Review Text: Omg, I’m mad I waited so long to get these! We have an autistic toddler that is also nonverbal. We live in a two-story townhome so keeping an eye on her was difficult at times. She would injure herself and not be able to tell us what happened and so forth. Also, she had gotten sentimental items and misplaced them along with my keys to my filing cabinet. I needed cameras for our home for her safety etc. The hookup was easy and quick. The pictures are so clear even in night vision. I also love being able to speak to our toddler when she’s attempting to climb on things. I can redirect her from downstairs when I’m in my online class etc. It is a godsend! I ordered two the first day and then decided to order the echo show 5 that evening so the camera views can be visible for my husband to also view our daughter without him having to download the app etc. He’s not tech savvy, so this was an excellent option for him. The echo should be here today, so I cannot review how is works with the blink mini. So, the cameras arrived and I loved them so much, I ordered another one to complete every angle of our downstairs living area. I showed a girlfriend at the gym as we looked in on my husband and daughter. She loved the clarity and requested I send her the link! You will not be disappointed. I suggest reading all the specifications and details about the mini before ordering it. People have complained about it not working properly. My guess would be internet connection. If you have a good internet connection, live feed will truly appear live. I give these cameras ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ OH, and the motion sensors definitely work! Another additive to these awesome cameras!!

Review Title: Easy to set up, unobtrusive, great quality
Review Text: At last, I found what I believe is a decent quality indoor security camera at a decent price, is easy to set up, easy to activate, and secure.I did not think such a thing existed - some of the cheap Chinese cams look to do the job but I am seriously worried about the network security.They do not have an ‘always on’ function like on a baby monitor but they are not designed for that.The app is very easy to use and you can configure zones and each camera separately - this is really good!IR functionality is very good for the price point and the overall thought that has gone into these is excellent.I do find the microphone a little sensitive so I tend to turn that off but that doesn’t bother me in the slightest.I started with two cameras and have just added a third. The free online storage subscription until Dec 2020 works for me - I am converted, I found what I thought did not exist.

Review Title: Significant delay before motion detector is triggered, I don't recommend.
Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   The picture quality was ok if you are only monitoring children or elderly and the night vision is acceptable. This video was recorded at 2:30 a.m. As you can see my mom sitting in bed. She had already sat up, laid down then sat back up again before the motion was triggered to record on the camera. Review Title: Only records for up to 30 seconds at a time with a min. 10 second restart of recording
Review Text: I wanted to build a security video system using the "Stay" 8, Blink sync module, and a blink mini camera.  Setting it up was not too bad.  I was fairly sure that after testing I would add cameras and also reluctantly subscribe to the "Plus" subscription so I would have confidence that the recordings would be there if I needed them.  Overall not too bad of a system but the HUGE DRAWBACK is that the recordings only run for up to 30 seconds and will not restart for at least 10 seconds.  My last thief was there for 6 minutes cutting off my catalytic converter and I did not get a good face shot until the 5 minute mark so he was arrested.  This system with the 30 second cut off on recording would have let him walk free.  I am returning the camera and sync module and keeping the "Stay 8".
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2021

Review Text: I have purchased 4 ofnthe mini cams which i thought was a good deal but I am not happy with my purchase. The cameras and software lack some basic features like not being able to share access to the cameras with anyone else without supplying them your user credentials. Thst is a security risk by itself but then you can't manage who is seeing what or prevent anyone from making changes to the setup. Other issues stem from tnot having this basic feature. In addition, I've found that the motion detection does not work effectively as many motion events are not detected or recorded in anyway. OVERALL, I recommend finding another option that meets basic standards with better user satisfaction.

Review Text: This small unit gives me the coverage I want for a small area.  Easy to install, fits nicely into small areas for discreet monitoring of a chosen area. It is moveable in different directions to find the perfect coverage area that I wanted. I found taking the photo on my phone a bit complicated to get what I wanted and the phone app navigation awkward, but I am getting there. The monitor is very sensitive to lighting, so sometimes headlights at night and early morning will set it off. But I would rather it capture more than less!  So far very pleased and it does notify me of any movement so very happy there...
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2022

Review Title: We use it through a window so we don't use night vision; it does what I wanted it to do.
Review Text: I bought the mini after I had four of the outdoor cameras mounted fairly high up on outside walls. I wanted a down-low, direct view of people walking up to the front door and the mini through a side window is perfect. Motion detection works pretty well during the day but I have to disarm the mini at night because the lights from cars driving by start the recording and IR night vision doesn't work well through windows. I like having a plug-in camera facing the front door so I don't have to use the live view from the battery powered outdoor camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2021

Review Title: Simple App, Simple Use, Does exactly what its supposed to do.
Review Text: So to start off with, I have my smart home built around google, and google assistant compatible devices. I bought this product because I mistakenly assumed that it would work with the google ecosystem. with that being said-Best Mistake Ever.So I look for a few things when i am adding anything supposedly "smart" to my home, and those things areEase of Use, Quality, and Compatibility.Ease of Use- This camera is SO easy to set up, its perfect. You literally turn it on, scan the QR code, and call it a day as you bridge your home WIFI to the camera through the app. When setting up activity zones, you can change the sensitivity, you can highlight specific zones, you can change the length of the clip AND the cooldown time between clips if you(like me) was trying to catch a specific video of something. All of it in a simple app that took only 5 minutes of playing around to figure out!Quality- I bought the cameras to monitor my kitchen and bedroom because my child is at an age where sneaking food and money is apparently a thing. Day or night, these cameras put out amazing quality video, to the point where i can read labels off the boxes of cereal in the cabinet when i open the door. ITS THAT GOOD! on Wifi or Cellular, i have almost no issues connecting- BUT i will say my only issue ive run into is when switching live video cameras, i have to give about a ten second pause otherwise it will not let me switch from one camera to another. not a big deal at all.Compatibility- Ill be honest it does not work with my google assistant devices, BUT if the quality of everything else is any indication i fully believe its compatibility with alexa is just as good.overall, love the cameras, would definitely buy them again!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020

Review Title: Great if it would only stay online!
Review Text: I have had this Mini cam one month. I use it to check on Mom at her assisted living facility. It is great, when it works. It would get 5 stars, if it worked 100%of the time.  The problem is it loses its WiFi connection and can't find it again. It's  happened twice in 30 days. WiFi is fine. I get a message that the camera is offline and I check the WiFi remotely. Unplugging the camera and plugging back in does not help me. The app only gives the choice of changing WiFi or deleting the camera. So I delete the camera and reinstall the camera. It's a royal pain. If it continues, the camera will go into the trash and I will shop for a different brand.

I would buy another Wyze cam since I've had no issues with mine.

Review Title: Great camera for the price, app could be better
Review Text: I got way more then I expected from these tiny cameras. For the price I think they are hard to beat. The picture quality and night vision are superb, especially at this price point. I bought a two pack to try it out and am already thinking of getting another. Easy to set up and easy to view remotely. The app is the only thing I could slightly complain about, it’s not really set up quite right for the mini cameras yet. The basic features of the app work, it’s easy to set up the cameras, it’s easy to change the settings, you can remotely view, and even record. I think in the future, hopefully soon the app with receive updates to better use these cameras. Overall the app is usable though. I think the biggest take away is that these cameras come from a reputable company. Blink is owned by amazon, it’s not some random company form who knows where, collecting data for who knows what.

Review Text: I bought these cameras to put in my toddlers  rooms as baby monitors. I don’t recommend them for that purpose for two reasons:1. Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   I bought this, because of Amazon Prime Day! There was a great deal!I had been meaning to get one of these for a LONG time and I finally got one!Super helpful and reassuring knowing that I can view my home and also make sure my pup isn’t getting into too much trouble while I am out!Pros:-Delivery came quick.-Good price for two cameras.-Set up was super simple! Review Title: Good little camera that could be better
Review Text: I like the cameras, but I have a few issues with them.  First, they are Wi-Fi only, and 2.4GHz on top of that.  I prefer to run Ethernet to my cameras.  Second, the power connector is micro USB.  Anything this new should have USB C.  It makes replacing the cable easier. On top of that if it was a POE camera, both of my issues would be resolved, and the camera would be much more reliable.  Ethernet would not drop connection.  My POE switches are on UPS's.  So, power drops would not be an issue.  Also POE would allow me to put the camera anywhere I wanted, and not have to find a location with power.

Review Title: Rather pointless without paying for monitoring

Without paying for monitoring, its pretty much useless.  There are other cameras on the market that have SD card slots where you can record on a loop.  This way you can see recorded video of incidents if they occur.  This camera has this function but only in cloud form, meaning you have to pay for the cloud service.  It will not save anything.  The camera is good quality and cheap because of the added cost you will need to monitor.

Review Text: These cameras are cool. Easy to set up and control. Very neat and simple, a sweet size so they fit just about anywhere and the have a nice amount of capture range too when recording. The settings are simple enough for you, making easy to set up in your home, garage, attic or basement. You can use them to keep an eye on your elderly or your children, you can even speak through each camera to your fam on the other side. There is a bit of a lag tho but I'm inclined to think that is from my less than stellar internet signal and my cheap cell phone. There's motion detection on these babies too that actually send you a text when movement is caught and I do mean caught because these cameras record detected motion. I'd advise you to cop a few if you're looking for an easy way to keep an eye on the inner working of your home when you're away. Once you work out the kinks you'll find it with the price.

Review Title: Wouldn’t stay connected- had to return
Review Text: Bought to use as a live view only camera to check in on our puppy during her crate training. When it worked, the picture was a nice wide view, very clear and I liked the zoom feature too. Unfortunately, the camera would not stay connected even sitting 10 feet from the router. We have fast broadband internet and had no other devices drop out or lose connection (including other security camera). If the blink cam would have reconnected on its own or through the app I would have kept it. But it forces you to press a tiny reset button on the camera itself, go through finding and pairing the device to the app and putting in the WiFi password. Every. Single. Time. Very annoying when this was happening at least once a day sometimes more. If the connection fails while you’re away, your camera will not reconnect and you can’t do anything about it until you get home. Totally not worth the hassle for our needs and would be awful for home security. I returned it and will get a different brand.

Review Text: First of all, set up was easy for me. I am a regular Amazon user though, so I knew how their tech worked for the most part. Review Text: This is a great camera for the money. We use this as a nursery cam to monitor the whole room, not over the crib. The picture quality is top notch and the night vision is flawless. Using the echo though allows the camera to stay on for about 5 minutes, so we can monitor the room and make sure the baby is okay and safe. And having the ability to hear audio is a big plus as well, making this a great nursery cam. Lastly, the price for what you’re getting is crazy, I feel like they could be charging more for this so I appreciate the low price point. All things considered I highly recommend this camera for any and all indoor camera needs.

Review Text: Camera works ok w/good motion detection. Primary issue is that several key features are not available to use unless you subscribe to their pricy cloud storage plan. It’s very deceptive and that info should be front and center in all item descriptions. There’s no logical technical reason for withholding these features. Review Text: I thought this would be a nice camera to monitor the house while I am away. Upon day 1 installation it detected motion through the day. Then day 2 it stopped detecting motion. It turns out that it is a known issue that the mini is not able to come out of nightime IR mode and is not able to detect motion when that happens, even when night turns to day. The red light comes on on the front of the camera and it is dead. Reading Blink community reviews I discovered this is a known problem since 2020 and it has not been fixed yet. Amazon continues to sell them as though they are a working product - and they are not.

Review Title: Update on my review. Blink Mini
Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Customer service got ahold of me without my asking, I thought that very good on their part. We resolved the issue with the night vision. Seems my camera was reflecting off the surface in front of it. I relocated it and it works well as you can see in the video I posted. The motion still stops working if left on. Blink said they are working on a fix and will send that out to the device when ready in a week or so. It's a new camera and a low price point. But I am much more satisfied now than i originally was.  I am raising my rating to 3 stars pending the update. Also a quick reminder since it frustrated me at first until I figured it out. If you are running a VPN on your phone, turn it off before connecting to the camera when installing it, otherwise the camera will not find it. After connected you can turn it back on and everything is good.

Review Text: The camera system is great if you just want to check in on your animals and such. Not very good if you're somewhere that you rely on cell service as your only form of internet provider.The problem we have with this system is when you get an alert that there is motion detection on 1 camera, if you try to live view it, it'll just sit there and load and load and tell you camera is busy. Then after a minute you'll get a 1 second clip, might be a blank screen might actually be a recording, but it doesn't give you much to work with. Even with a flash drive equipped.Other than trying to view the camera while it's trying to record, they're not terrible, and the speaker is loud that is in the camera's. Doesn't do well audio wise with recording sound if it's windy.

Review Title: Simple setup but not what you may expect on funtionality
Review Text: The blink is easy to setup and simple to use.  The video quality is good enough but still has choppy image issues with fast movements. The camera will cut off the sound during these times so you have to ask the other individual on the camera to repeat.  Other than that, I would only think of this system like a 30 second babysitter, certainly not a security system or basic security setup.  My wife and I only use it when we leave town and check on the kids.

Review Title: It's not what I wanted, but it works I guess
Review Text: I did not know you cannot do continuous monitoring. Times out after 30 seconds and have to keep pressing continue. You'll have to subscribe to a monthly fee after the 30 day trial ends. Far as motion detection it is ok, sometimes it doesn't pick up despite being set to most sensitive for motion. The sound gets cut off at times. There is a delay when speaking through it when the other person replies, sometimes gets cut off. Would I buy it again or recommend it? Probably not. I guess it's ok for the price and if you're ok with it sometimes not picking up motion and no continuous live feed.

Review Text: This things catch’s every change of light and car going down the street, when I open my door it and walk outside it works.This piece of junk has only captured a delivery driver once!! I watched the Amazon delivery driver drop off a package take a picture and the camera did not record..  i am not impressed.. at last it looks like have a security camera..Thank goodness ups sends me notifications when a package is delivered, if I relied on these I’d have twenty boxes outside and never know about them..Buyer beware!!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2021

Review Text: The camera looks very nice. I have mine mounted in the top corner of my room. The motion detection works very well it doesn’t seem to get effected by moving headlights coming through the window though the window has sheer in front of it. The image quality doesn’t seem that good though it says 1080p but it’s good enough to make out what’s in the room if it be a person, animal, or little rodent. The night vision is pretty much the same quality as when not on except it’s in black and white but one down side of the night vision is when I open up the live feed it makes a click sound and turns on the light(s) for night vision (they aren’t lights just little leds to indicate it’s on) same when you leave the live feed it makes a click and turns the small leds off and as well as taking a picture it clicks twice. It probably does the same when motion is detected with night vision, I haven’t tested that yet though. Another thing is the motion detection when on night vision there are little dust particles that are visible that float past the camera but the motion detection luckily doesn’t see them so it’s not overly sensitive. Otherwise a very nice camera that’s good for security and very light weight easy to hide. Those are my only complaints and they’re just kinda small things that make it a little less than 5 star quality.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2021

Review Text: 1. Live View only allows you to continuously watch for 30 seconds. After that you have to hit a "continue" button or it closes out in the app. There are no settings to increase the live view time.2. Live View frequently returns "system is busy" message and does not show you anything.We tried using this as a baby monitor but its a no go. I understand the company is more "security" system focused but through their marketing material they made it seem like the device would be useful for live monitoring.They should mention that live view is limited by time and they need to work out their software bugs.As much as I hated CACAGOO Video Baby Monitor (I was trying to replace it with the Blink system) it works much better.P.S. there is no multi-user functionality (multi-accounts for the same system with different logins and usage rights) you have to share one email/password with all users.Edit: Updated review to 3 stars. A Blink support person contacted me and pointed out that the description does have "(live view is not continuous)" in the description. I missed this before purchasing and half my issues are related to it. Fairly similarly priced competitors do have the feature. So I still feel like the feature should be supported.Using Wyze Pan now and its working great.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020

Review Title: Very hard to say is useful in a shelter situation.
Review Text: Software is lame and requires constant tending or is concerning/disturbing so as to produce anxiety.  Use is spooky, I don't ever really feel in control of my own hardware, it seems to be controlling or influencing my decision making.  Application to surveillance that one would desire to be effective is doubtful in my situation (homeless shelter), I  probably could not provide useful legal evidence with it.  Half the time I feel I am doing something counter-effective with it.  I bought it to counter thievery, I have lost over $300 worth of stuff here.  It is not proving very helpful.  I only use it to monitor a power bank charging display so I don't have to babysit near the outlet.  This usage makes it worthwhile for me because I have back problems and I have to go outside to smoke.  I had hoped it would make it safe to sleep through during charging but it seems to require constant monitoring.  The motion detection wouldn't prove a deterrent, I really need some sort of property tracking device so I can chase down the criminals.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2021

Review Title: Goes offline and horrible motion detection
Review Text: I bought this camera to see what my cat was doing while I was not home. Very easy to set up and good night vision quality. The app itself is simple but could be better. I am not impressed at all with the motion detection aspect. I could sometimes walk right in front of it and it won’t even catch the motion. Also the camera goes offline and becomes unavailable all the time has happened every day since I got it. So it becomes essentially useless because the only way to get it back online is to unplug it and plug it back in. This defeats the purpose of having this camera the first place because when you need it it disconnects and you have to physically reconnect it which you cannot do when you were not home. No I do not have a problem with my Wi-Fi it’s the only thing connected to it during the day and I live in a very small apartment. My dad recommended Blink to me because he had great Luck with the other outdoor and indoor cameras this one I would not recommend the Mini unless you’re home all the time and it disconnects. Should have bought the other Indoor camera as this one is disappointing

Review Title: Nice plug-in camera for the price.  Make sure it is connected to 2.4.
Review Text: Having been pleased with the original Blink battery-powered cameras, I am also pleased with the mini-cam.  This one plugs into the wall, so battery usage is no issue.  It is small with a wide lens and good picture quality.  The only difficulty I had at first was with regard to my router. I have a router which transmits both 2.4 and 5.0. The router decided which one would be best for each usage. Please note that the Blink camera requires 2.4.  It was a simple measure to split my router signals to make sure  that the cameras were connecting to 2.4 only.  Quite a nice camera for the price.

Review Title: Nothing special, not worth the cloud plan price, lacking image quality.

Review Title: Good for use as a Toy, but not reliable enough for Security
Review Text: The hardware intermittently works, so it really is not good for security purposes. My network is in tip top shape but the camera's only pickup some activity & not others. You can walk by now & it records & an hour later, walk by the same area under same lighting conditions & it never records. I ran network diagnostics in my house & moved my sync module to ensure all cameras & sync module getting good signal as Blink would recommend to do when having problems. Really dissatisfied w/ the reliability of recording for security purposes. I have a camera pointed at my driveway, it recorded me pulling out of driveway & then when I pull back in 10 minutes later, never recorded it (it missed an entire vehicle) last night the front camera just stopped recording after 11:43PM & then this morning around 9am I did live view & it started recording cars driving by again. Before 9am i saw cars drive by that it just did not record them. It is like the camera fell asleep until I did a live view.We recently had a car broken into in our driveway & the camera did not record the crime.Even though the hardware is inconsistent, I must say that customer service was fast & responsive. Customer service was able to retrieve deleted files quickly (within a day) unfortunately the camera did not record any activity of a person in our driveway that got into the car, but camera did happen to record a suspicious car that stopped in front of my house at 3am the night the incident happened.Another bug I noticed is that if you turn off the night vision in settings & you later go into settings to make a change to the recording zone, the night vision will be turned back on to auto even though I did not make that change.So over all the concept of Blink is right, & I like the fact that I don't have to pay monthly fees but unfortunately the software in the camera's or the sync module is Buggy & glitchy & not reliable enough for a REAL security camera & just good as a TOY if you want to MAYBE see what is happening around your house.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020

Review Text: By far the worst camera and software ever. Total garbage.  App crashes repeatedly. Image quality is non-existent existent. Do not waste your money.  I got it as a bundle with an Echo show so I can't return it because I want to keep the show.
