Review Title: Motion detection at night doesn’t work more often than it does
Review Text: Even with the sensitivity set to the max, the camera rarely picks up any motion in the dark. When I open the app and look at the view on the camera, the camera seems to have a decent view of my place at night, and I can see myself fine, but it does not notice me and begin recording. Pretty disappointed so far. Will change me review if an update comes out to fix itUpdate - Blink had reached out to me to help correct this issue. After getting me set up with the appropriate products, they are working significantly better. Big thank you to their customer support!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2021

Review Title: Good for the price and does what I was looking for
Review Text: This little camera is really easy to mount and setup.  Download the blink app and you are ready to go.  I chose not to mount the cameras to the wall using the provided screws.  Instead, I used 3M mounting strips which work really well.I had a defective unit and the customer service was fantastic about shipping out a new one (very quickly).  The new unit works very well and I get the coverage that I wanted.The early notification feature works well - so you get a notification right away (and I like the ability to customize the delay between notifications).I have been moving the cameras around in various places (from large rooms, small rooms, hallways, etc..) with various lighting.  Overall, the camera works as described (up to 20 feet of motion detection in both well-lit locations and with no light - IR mode).I would give it 5 stars, but there are two scenarios I have found which seems to reduce the distance of the motion detection.  *  When I place the camera in a hallway (about 4-5 feet across), for whatever reason the motion-sensing drops from 20 feet (when it is in a large room) down to about 10 feet.  The lighting conditions do not matter nor changing the "active" zones of the camera.  I get the best results when the entire hallway is lit and there is significant light behind me.  *  I also have noticed a drop in motion sensitivity distance when the lighting is about the intensity 20-30 minutes before sunrise.  The IR mode is off (because there is enough light) but the camera struggles to see motion.  For my tests, the camera picks up the motion in these conditions around 12 feet (for large rooms) down to 6 feet (for hallways).The feel of the camera is very lightweight - so it seems very delicate.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020

Review Title: Not as good as Cloud Cam
Review Text: Had Cloud Cam and was happy with them for "person" and "dog bark" sensing.  Thought I was evolving to the Blink cameras because Amazon is fazing out the Cloud Cam option.  Cloud Cam technology for sensing options and viewing options is MUCH better and wish I could simply stay with Cloud Cam.  But Amazon is moving to Blink and forcing you too come with them.  (YUCK)Cloud Cam has different sensing for "person", "dog barking", "glass breaking", etc.  Blink has "motion", that's it and it's not very good.  It either senses nothing or senses a gentle breeze every couple seconds.  Blink fail.Cloud Cam let's you view the live video feed with the app or in a web browser.  So you could pull up your cameras and view in real-time on the go with your phone or pull it up on a computer screen and leave open in a tab to keep an eye on pets, kids, deliveries, etc.  Blink is ONLY viewable through the app, no web viewing option.  In addition when you pull up the app you don't get live footage, you get a picture and then have to click on each camera to get it live...and that takes a couple more seconds for it to pull up.  There's a ton of lag and when you switch to another camera it often says "wait, I'm still closing the last camera".Blink is clearly a less straining system on bandwidth that Amazon has moved to for a money saving decision.  It takes less resources to run because it's not sending or providing as much data back and forth between camera and cloud servers and cloud servers and user viewing.  It's a less feature rich experience but yet still something Amazon can market and make money on.Overall, boo on Amazon/Blink for moving backwards and offering less for the same price and marketing slop.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020

Review Title: Very disappointed motion detector stops working
Review Text: I bought this camera to monitor my vacation home. The motion detector stops working after about an hour once I reset it every time I go to the house. If I lived in the same town I could go every day and reset it but to me this is defeating the purpose of having the cameras. I’m sorry I bought them. My outdoor blink cameras work perfectly. I am completely disappointed! What I do every single day of the week is open my Blink go to each camera take a picture to reset the camera. This is ridiculous but I really want it to work all the time until I can find a new camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2022

Review Text: I use this for my puppy when we need to keep him in his crate to go to work or run errands. The image is very clear and sound is also great. I don’t use the talking feature often but it seems to work well. So worth the cost for this great camera!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021

Review Title: Started out impressed, then frustrated, now disgusted
Review Text: 4 Stars - I have 2 Blink Mini’s linked to a Module2.  I have them mounted inside and pointed toward the outside through windows.  The cameras were fairly easy and painless to set up.  I like the small size of the cameras and that they don’t have batteries to maintain or that can swell and fail over time.The picture quality is excellent daytime and low light.  I can’t comment on infrared night time picture quality, as I have disabled the infrared and LEDs to prevent reflection on the window glass.The app needs improvement.It’s good that you are able to block out zones where you don’t want to detect motion, like normal traffic on the street.  However, this doesn’t work at night as it will trigger cars in the zones blocked from monitoring.  Not just some, but all cars at night will trigger recording in the blocked zones.It’s good that you can enable and disable individual cameras easily from the home screen of the app.  However, I wish they would make it so you could silence the notification from individual cameras without disabling the motion detection and recording easily from the home screen.  The only way is to go deep into the app settings to turn off the notifications for all cameras.I tried the Beta test of the instant notification which would be good, however, it negates the ability to delete clips directly from the notification, which I like when the clip is of the mail carrier or the neighbor’s cat that likes to hang out at my house for some damn reason.  When I turned off the instant notification, I noticed that the cameras stopped picking up any motion, so I deleted and re-linked the cameras to the app and this fixed the problem.  I have not turned that function back on since.Update - Now it's 3 stars because I am starting to become frustrated with these cameras.  First of all, with the aforementioned blocking not working at night.  Secondly, it has stopped picking up the mail carrier delivering mail but picks me up walking the very same path to get the mail every time.?  A lot of users complain about having to keep pressing the continue button for live viewing.  In my case, I only use live view when aiming the camera or watching for the pizza delivery and it can become annoying even with my limited use of this function.  Many times there is a noise on the street so I attempt to see what it is, but then the camera doesn’t want to connect to live view and by the time I get it to connect, whatever was there is long gone.  Whenever I have trouble connecting to live view, I can usually get it to connect after I kill the app and restart it so thinking a lot of my issues with the cameras are app related.I am still within the free cloud storage period so don’t know if any of these issues will clear up when I am switched to local storage or if I will start to have more issues.  Only time will tell.Update - 2 stars.  Time told.  I am into day one of local storage and I can't believe how petty Amazon is with the app if you aren't paying the subscription plus a couple of issues I have been dealing with the cameras and waited to mention to see if it would change with local storage.  The dealt with issues I think is with the cameras and not the app.  I have to go into live view every morning in order to get the cameras to record motion for the day.  I don't get it, it's like they go to sleep overnight when not a lot of action is happening.  Another thing I don't understand, is it will record a huge amount of cars driving down the street past the house, even in the block out zones, but will not record me passing in front of my house as I am coming and going or entering and leaving my drive.  Not that I am interested in myself, but makes me wonder what else is happening that doesn't get recorded.  Now for the pettiness of the app that wasn't too hot to begin with.  The dot that tells you if you have already viewed the clip, gone.  The ability to delete groups or all the clips at one time, quickly and easily, gone.  You have to delete them one at a time in the viewer, which closes after you delete the clip and you have to tap the next clip and wait for it to open the viewer and load the clip.  The thumbnails of the clips so you can see what was captured without having to view the clip, gone.  The ability to save live views, gone.I can not recommend these cameras which is a shame, as the cameras are pretty dang good as compared to others that I have had with the exception of a couple of bugs.  But it's the app that keeps me from paying for the plan and recommending this system to anyone.  What was once a mediocre app that caused frustration, has been reduced to a needlessly onerous turd of a chore that causes angst and regret.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2021

Review Title: NOT secure! Don’t buy for your safety.
Review Text: There are two ways to get video recordings on blink: live view (where you have to go into the app and view the live video recording) and motion recordings (the camera starts recording once it detects motion). I have consistently been waking up in the morning to review the videos from the night before and there are “live view” recordings. I did not get on the app in the middle of the night while asleep. I called blink customer service and they were not helpful at all. They told me the recordings are being initiated from my phone, so my phone must be hacked. Called Apple, they said it is highly unlikely that my phone is hacked. I’ve never had these issues with my ring camera, which also has live view vs. motion recordings. Don’t buy a blink camera. I feel very uneasy that someone is getting on my app and just watching my camera in the middle of the night. Blink customer service acted so nonchalant about it and didn’t do anything to help me. Waste of money.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020

Review Title: Good camera but noisy (updated with fix)
Review Text: Picked this up to use as an additional baby monitor for my 2 year old so I can look in on his room even when he's with the sitter and I'm not there. I like how it works, but when it starts and stops recording with the IR set to "Auto" it makes a loud click sound. It's loud enough to wake a light sleeper. Besides that everything seems to work well.Update: If you manually turn the IR to "on" and leave it for the night, the camera makes no noise at all. Review Text: Super clear video during day,  but only works facing indoors at night. Facing it out a window does not work, it reflects off the glass not to mention you need some sort of light reflection for it to even give you video. All I could see was darkness and headlights going by my house. (Didn't matter how close you put it to the glass) Motion detection was great. The audio is so sensitive that it picks up the noise of the air around you, which makes it a little bit hard to understand voices if they aren't speaking loud. So it's great to talk to people through just fine but if you're spying on someone it can be a little bit irritating with the background whirring noise. I would buy again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2021

Review Title: Easy inatall, lag in refresh time, not able to view live feed simultaneously
Review Text: I like the easy installation and the productI don't like the amount of times the app is not able to view the live transmission, I get " live view in progress" and another message and so there is a delay when I refresh. I also can't view live video on both cameras at the same time. I have to clock on one and then click on the other one.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2021

Review Text: I bought this camera in search for something budget friendly, and quality to watch my 3D prints. In the event something goes wrong mid print, I'd know about it because I can watch it away from home! This isn't much of a bother to me but the camera only allows you to view it for upwards of 30 seconds, unless you have a subscription with them, it will grant you access to their "Extended Live View" option which is in beta mode. That's with noting that they grant you free 30 Day access to this feature which is quite helpful because it gives you an idea of the subscription and what it brings, before you purchase or put a card on file. As for the picture quality, it's not bad for the use I have it for, but if you're looking for something to see further away, you won't be able to recognize much with this camera. Close up objects are a little easier to see (which would be obvious) but this could be a great "Front Door" camera, or exterior house camera to watch around the house. There is a "Talk" button with the camera as well, but I must note that this it's a little hard to speak with and hold a general conversation due to the cameras delay and how it cuts the audio of the entire camera when speaking. So as if someone was talking to speak back, you can't hear them so as you have the talk button pressed within the app. This is a small feature that I wouldn't bother nitpicking too much, but I am also using this to simply monitor 3D prints. All in all, great budget camera for the video quality, night vision quality, and the ability to watch it from anywhere. Will definitely be buying another for my other 3D printers!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022

Review Title: I love this device - a MUST have if you have pets or children!
Review Text: Ease of set up is VERY easy.This camera is not a terrific option for security because there is a clearly visible cord that needs to be plugged in to an electric outlet for power. However, I purchased this camera so that I can see my dog and my son when he returns home from school.I absolutely love that there is two-way communication. I can speak to my son while I'm at work.The picture quality is very good.The price is very inexpensive. I paid $49.99 but that includes the echo show 5.It comes with a bracket and two screws so that you can easily hang it on a wall. My only tiny complaint is the wall will block you from being able to adjust/raise the camera angle.My only other tiny complaint is there is a charge for cloud storage even if you're a prime member. I have wireless cameras outside my home that I use with cloud storage so I have not purchased storage for the blink camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020

Review Text: So I purchased these indoor cameras to film from my window sill to hopefully capture the dogs responsible for me stepping in poo. So far, not much action. I think these cameras are great during the day time. I get notifications for motion all the way across the street. However at night I noticed lack of alerts which is odd because a lot of cars drive by as well as people walking should be more than enough to trigger the alert. I’ve figured out night vision is needed at night to improve motion detection. Unfortunately, since my camera films behind a window and screen, when I turn night vision on it just films a black screen since it’s unable to see through the screen with the night vision on. Luckily the controls allow you to modify and turn off night vision if need be. I’m okay with not getting as many alerts from across the street at night and when someone is on my side of the street I still get alerts about their movement which is what’s important. I’d recommend these cameras if you’re the type of person who is looking for a nanny cam or any kind of indoor cam. These would work great and it’s a great deal! These babies will be worth their weight in gold when I finally catch the poopertrator.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2021

Review Title: Save your money and buy a better camera
Review Text: It's ridiculous that this doesn't have a live stream. You have to wait for motion to be detected and THEN get the option for live viewing. What is even more of a joke is that this "feature" only lasts 30 days, and then they want you to pay for a feature that MOST other cameras have for free. It's insane. Def wouldn't have wasted my money if I knew that basic features would only last a few weeks and then they expect you to pay for it. So you're going to be paying for this device 5x over, just to get it to work how other cameras do automatically. Fun.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2021

Review Text: This camera is amazing for the price! I had some money stolen from my drawer in my office at work, so I immediately set out to buy a small camera. I'm so glad I found this one because it works perfectly! Setup was easy; just plug in and download the app, then scan the barcode on the back and it connects. You can Arm/Disarm the motion detection from your phone, and so far it seems to capture and notify of each motion (even a little too well, via light moving on the wall from bright lights downtown). The sound/picture quality are great, and the speaker to talk back through the camera is loud and clear. I definitely recommend this camera!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020

Review Text: There’s no night time vision what’s so ever. That’s was very disappointing as I have my camera facing my driveway, as we know most people break in at night. The talk mode is like a walkie-talkie. You must hold the button while talking but you can’t hear the other person until you are done and let go of the talk button. Other than that it does a great detecting movement and alerting on my phone. It sucks when it goes off at night and it’s pointless. If you are looking for something that records all the time and can get views at night, go with a different camera. If you just want to look inside your home or be able say something quickly to someone in the house it works.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021

Review Title: Long time user of other blink cameras, these are JUNK!!
Review Text: UPDATE 5/19/20 - I was contacted by tech support shortly after writing this review and am currently running a beta firmware update that has fixed the issue. I commend them for finally paying attention and fixing the issue. Still wish they used the motion sensing technology used in previous cameras, as these are more temperamental.. still not consistently recognizing a person walking in room, but yet a change in sunlight during day will set it off.. or a fleck of dust at night.. but I hope that they will continue to get it dialed in. For now, I am changing my review from 1 star to 4.*ORIGINAL REVIEW*I have been in contact with technical support for weeks in regards to a bug or just plain crap that these new mini's are.. Basically, if I arm the cameras during the day, they will work, DURING THE DAY. If I arm them at night, they will work DURING THE NIGHT. Meaning they detect motion relatively well, but not nearly as sensitive even at highest sensitivity as XT at middle sensitivity. Should be opposite for always on camera. HOWEVER, and if I arm the system at night and then it becomes daytime and along with it daylight (funny how that happens Blink, there is a day and night in most places in the world) the cameras are not reliably (almost never) switching out of IR/night mode and also do not detect motion even if I literally jump up and down in front of them. This obviously makes them worthless. I'm not going to set an alarm at 6 am to wake up and manually disarm and then rearm. So lame.So not only does technical support not have any clue what they are doing and keep trying to tell me how to use the system, and offer up obvious solutions like turn on IR to auto, really?? duh.. how stupid of me. I even recorded a video showing exactly what is happening and sent it to them and 2 weeks later, no updates yet. I then submit an other ticket and, I'm answering the same questions over and over..So to make a long story short, DO NOT BUY THESE until Blink/Amazon takes this seriously and fixes this.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020

Review Title: How to give more money to Amazon!
Review Text: The camera works fine, but without me spending more money to save the recordings, the camera is just a useless piece of hardware, just like the rest of Amazon's hardware. Ever since the VIRUS, Amazon can"t delivery anything on time, or they deliver empty pkgs. I  am not going to renew my Prime membership, because it  does not serve any useful purpose.

You get a motion notification and can view live but, no recordings. I don’t even need cloud storage. Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2021

Review Title: Now charging to use after 6 months.
Review Text: Update from 4 stars to 2 stars 05/26/21: These have been working good for the purpose that they served. But all of a sudden after over 6 months of having them they have decided to charge for membership to use the cloud. The motion detection no longer works and they are basically useless. This has been one of the few things I use an Alexa for as well since it doesn't work with Google. So save your money and get something else.They are ok for the price, I use them to watch my dogs while away. Sometimes the motion detection doesn't work that well but haven't really had any problems with them. The dogs don't like the popping sounds when you use the talk feature on them but they are worth it for the price. Just wish they would work with google home.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021

Review Title: Does exactly what I need it to do!
Review Text: I bought this so I could see how long it took my pup to settle down after I leave and to monitor what she does in her crate in my absence. (Sleep mostly, it turns out). I love it as it gives me great peace of mind. It has impressive night vision, good audio quality, and is nice and small with a long cord. Does everything I need it to do for a great price! The only issue was that I took it with me traveling and it needs to connect to a WIFI network with a password, so anywhere that you have to log in to a network without the password it won't work.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020

Review Text: Let me start off by saying for a $35 camera this does a pretty good job. I bought this to sit in my window to get a view of my front porch. NOTE THAT THIS WILL NOT WORK POINTING OUT OF A WINDOW AT NIGHT UNLESS THERE IS A SOURCE OF LIGHT OUTSIDE. It’s not really designed to do that, but I have a streetlight right outside my window so I am able to get clear shots at night time by turning the night vision function off. I also have it placed behind blackout curtains to reduce any glare from light from inside my house. I attached it to the side of the window sill using command strips as the stand is slightly too short to look over the window sill. This does a pretty good job for what it is. Yes, it is pretty limited as other people have noted. You are only able to record 30 seconds of motion and retrigger after 10 seconds which could cause you to miss some of the recording. One of my biggest complaints is that the storage is pretty limited. I live in a high traffic area with sidewalks and this picks up around 20-30 clips a day which can use up to 50 percent of the storage per day. However, you are able to go through and delete the ones you don’t need and can set it to automatically delete old clips. After messing around with the activity zones and sensitivity to what I feel are the best settings, I would say the motion sensor works correctly about 95 percent of the time. I haven’t had any problems with it not detecting motion, but instead capturing false motion from cars in the activity zones I have turned off and also occasionally the movement of shadows from the sun/clouds. Also the picture quality is pretty fair. It’s not ultra hd but also pretty easy to identify faces within a reasonable range. Overall, it does what I need it to do which is monitor my front door/porch area. I can’t say how well it functions with other blink cameras as this is the only one I’ve purchased but I plan on buying at least one more for other areas of my house.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2020

Review Text: I had one camera, and liked it quite a bit, so I ordered another since the price was fair for what you get; but once you have more than one camera it becomes a pain. The $3 a month plan for the camera to record once motion is detected has to be upgraded to the $10 a month plan, which is no biggie, but a pain to figure out how at first since you can’t do it through the Blink app. And when in the blink app, if you look at a camera, then want to “Arm Your System”, you’ll get a “Live View In Progress, Please Wait” error. You then have to close the app, and swipe it away in your task manager thingy, then reopen the app. Same thing if you want to switch to a different camera view. Over time when using it to watch pets or kids or whatever it may be, it becomes a big annoyance, and it has had this error for months and months now with no rush on fixing that issue, or anything at all in the app. The cameras are pretty good both day and night, but what’s the point if the software you use to look at your cameras is more annoying than helpful?
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2022

Review Text: Lacks key features that are standard in other cameras.  Cameras teeter between 2.4 & 5.0 Ghz wireless, with no way to force the cameras to one frequency or the other, which causes erratic network connectivity / issues.  Exceptionally poor means to utilize cameras with anything other than Amazon's cloud (i.e. meaning if you have local NAS for video storage, you are unable to configure the cameras to use that local storage).  I'm extremely disappointed with the feature / function of these cameras, and do not recommend the purchase of these cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2021

Review Title: Spike-vision:) perfect to watch our senior dog
Review Text: Absolutely love this! Our dog Spike is getting older (going blind) and lately having a few accidents at home. This is comforting to watch/see him while not home. The motion sensor goes off when he gets up for water. The night vision is amazing.Also love that when/if something happens, it’s recorded. When we noticed he wasn’t well one time we came home and he was limping, we had to assume he fell down the stairs. It was always scary leaving him alone. Just having the camera, is comforting. We will be buying more for the rest of the house.

I bought Amazon Echo Show and MiniCAM bundle not knowing it works with the existing XT system.Picture and Video quality is as good as larger unit; however, due to its size, fish-eye lense effect is more profound than the larger camera unit - which may bother some people.  It does not matter to me for my use.This is great camera for its price; I'm ordering few more unit to complete home system.

Review Title: Decent camera, useless with current limitations
Review Text: The camera itself seems great. I'm finding myself confused at the purpose of this camera though. I should have read more but since I had two XT2 cameras I figured I would try this out instead of buying another indoor nest cam. I get this does not have a continuous recording option, which that should be possible for a plug in camera but is there a way to turn off indoor notifications? I bought this to keep an eye on our playroom so motion detection is ok even though continuous would be preferred. However I do not see a way to have motion activated recording and not have motion activated notifications for this one camera. I still want the notifications for my XT2 outdoor cameras. I would get notifications canstantly in my situation for indoor recordings. This may very well be a "me" problem, but this is not a replacement for a Nest cam unfortunately. Hope this changes in the future. Great idea, not so great execution.

Review Title: Not as good as the reviews make it seem
Review Text: This camera has so many good reviews, I decided to try it.. This camera was a big disappointment. The app kept losing signal with the camera. So most of the time entering the app, I couldn'tsee anything. The camera doesn't swivel, or move so you will need upwards of 3 cameras to view an entire room. Motion detection rarely worked. I thought about mounting it, but then you have to pay more to get a mount. The entire experience was a big headache. I got a different brand that has 360 swivel, night vision, reliable motion detection, and it works with Alexa for about the same price. Save yourself the hassle and get one that can move.

Review Text: I bought two of these.  They were easy to set up and for the "trial" period I was happy with them.  Once the 30 day trial ended, I discovered even a 30 second  motion detected, video clip....could NOT be saved without purchasing a Amazon Cloud storage plan.  The plans are not expensive,  it just very annoying that it's another "gotcha".  The camera only works for real time viewing....would not buy again.  There are good cameras out there, the the same cost, that have micro SD slot which saves video clips and eliminates the need for added costs!

Review Title: No multiple instances and Does NOT work properly with Alexa
Review Text: Beware, the major technical flaw of Blink for me was the limit of 1 single access at any given point of time.  That means, if I’m loading the video feed on Echo show, then I cannot access it on my phone, nor my wife/anyone else. Review Title: These are good for what I need them for!

Review Text: I have 4 of these and 3 of them periodically just start taking clips every 20 seconds to the point.  Have to turn off the motion detection thus rendering them useless. Review Text: Would be nice if you could watch continuously??? Its powered by electricity and I may want to watch the camera view for an extended time. Two things other systems provide-common sense features.

Review Text: My use case was security. I don't care about continuous monitoring, my wife is just naturally anxious and I travel for work, so she just wants to be sure that no one has entered the house when no one is there, or if our Ring motion sensor goes off we want to verify that it is t the cat . With these cameras on sale for under 20 bucks it seemed a much better deal than the ring camera at 60 bucks, even though we already pay for ring alarm monitoring. There are plenty of indoor camera options on Amazon that will send you 15 second motion clips without having to subscribe.

Review Title: Now way to bulk save the video clips in the app
Review Text: There appears to be no way to select all of the files for a give date (or a random selection of files) in the app and save them (to the camera roll on iOS or to another application via sharing). Review Title: READ YOUR WATER METER IN DARK!

Review Title: Fun to play around with but now unplugged sitting in a drawer

Review Text: Really wanted to like these.  They only support 2.4gHz frequency, not 5gHz wifi.  I have one in my living room and one in my back room, but the back room always hangs when trying to view live video, and I've woken up to it in a "camera offline" mode only to discover it's too far away from the router.  None of my other devices (esp those that can use the 5gHz band, shame on you Blink for not including this) have this problem, so it's likely they used cheap wireless components and it's a nice gimmick.  Wanted to like this product but going to have to return it since they're kinda useless if they don't connect to wifi.TL;DR - The wifi on these are very lackluster, so don't expect much in terms of distance.  The app will have trouble connecting to your camera, especially if you live in an apartment with other tenants who are presumably using the same 2.4 gHz band these operate on.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2020

Review Text: You only get thirty seconds of video at most then it stops recording then you have to wait ten seconds before it will start again even if there’s ongoing movement. Also in a couple months I’m going to have to pay for storage for only 30 seconds of video. The price is right but if you want anything more than 30 seconds you’ll need to look elsewhere.

Review Text: This has the potential to be a fine little camera. The sound is decent, the picture quality is above what you would expect for a small camera like this and the night vision is good. But the app... It's horrible. It's not user friendly. You have to have a paid subscription to save videos. The app forces the camera to stop regardless of you watching it or not.  I'm a gadget guy. I love tech and tinkering with settings and software. But the app is bland and more complicated than it should be. Ring does a nice job with security camera software, Blink hasn't quite figured out out yet.

Review Title: Great Little Camera Gets the Job Done
Review Text: Wanted an inexpensive camera so I could check in on my puppy. This camera is exactly that. It is a corded camera which is fine for my needs. I mounted my camera on the wall. It comes with mounting screws. I didn’t use them. I mounted it with 3M command strips.There is a 30 day trial for the service. Otherwise it’s $3/mo to be able to save video.The daytime picture is very nice. It does have night vision which is black and white, but a clear photo.I would not hesitate to recommend this camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2021

Review Title: Won't reliably stay on Wi-Fi, thus useless for security
Review Text: Randomly drops wifi.  Won't reconnect automatically.  Manual reconnect requires you to totally delete it from the app and start from scratch.  Wifi is rock steady and very strong signal.  My Ring doorbell is on the same network and hasn't dropped wifi even once in a year - this Blink cam drops wifi several times a week.  This issue is with the camera. If I can't trust it to stay connected I can't trust it for security period.  If it occasionally dropped and reconnected it would be fine... But once it drops it's down for good until you manually reconnect it.  Amazon won't replace or allow me to return (after only 60 days), forced me to have a phone call with Amazon customer service and then put me on hold before they eventually disconnected.  I'm a long time prime customer and generally buy Amazon versions of products... But this is junk and this is the first time I've ever been disappointed with Amazon customer service.  Do not buy.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2021

Review Title: Weak antenna that loses signal regularly

If I decide to further expand my network, it will be with the more reliable Wyze cameras, also allowing control and monitoring through a single app.

Review Title: inability to auto-transition from night to day so will not detect motion
Review Text: While the camera will transition from day to night, the Blink mini (firmware 9.70) will not transition from night to day. Even with sufficient light on in the room with sunrise, the IR sensor remains on and motion is not detected so recording does not happen. Even at night if a light is turned on in the room, the camera will not transition from IR sensing to daylight mode and so will not detect motion. A security camera foiled by turning on a light! Evidently this is a long running issue with this mini camera as it was reported over a year ago now.It seems not fit for purpose.The only ways to work around this seem to be:1. Manually trigger a photo, live view, or disarm and immediately re-arm. This takes manual intervention and must be timed with sufficient day light in the space.2. Set a schedule to disarm and then rearm the camera. This results in at least 15 minutes of potentially lost recordings since schedules can only be set at 15 minute increments. (Maybe an Alexa routine can do this automatically with less of a gap in recording?)3. Turn off night vision mode and rely on a secondary light. So keep the camera in normal daylight mode at all times. Some use a separate motion detection light to turn on so that recording at night can still work.None of these seem like good enough solutions.Called support today and they said they were aware and working on the issue, but had no estimate on when it would be resolved. Maybe after a year of this being a known issue they can't resolve it at all?
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2021

Review Title: Great product BUT blink wireless more cost effective
Review Text: I love these little guys, that being said I have electrical surges which throws them offline a lot.  I’ve worked in finances a long time so did a simple cost comparison between blink mini and blink wireless.  Turns out by the time I purchased all I wanted (deco case, black power cords, birdhouse mount) it cost the exact same as a wireless blink camera set.  I purchased 2 of the minis, they zeroed out cost wise with 2 camera set wireless blink.  These are wonderful indoor cameras, blink system AMAZING.  I’m just trading up!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2021

Review Title: Once you have to pay for a subscription, activations become sketchy. **Plus an update**
Review Text: **Update** So a Blink rep contacted me after I posted this review and wrote that it was obvious that the blink mini was not working properly at all and that there was probably a problem with the unit. Though my goal was only to get the camera to work as promised, or get a replacement, the rep upgraded our blink mini to either the Indoor or Outdoor camera. We chose the outdoor and received it, and the synch hub within a couple days. I had to take a star away from my initial review because since connecting the camera, it has not worked properly. There were no activations- even when I stood right in front of and even touched the camera! What?! Then, things changed. Around 5pm, activation after activation notice started blowing up my phone. When reviewing the near 50 clips this morning, only one showed anything- a clip of the night sky quickly turning to bright blue. Literally nothing else was in the clip. I continue to get clips of nothing, but when I know people have walked in front of the camera because I see them, there is no recording. No activation. No protection. I emailed the rep over 5 hours ago asking for direction and help to make sure everything was connected and updated and whatever correctly on my end, but have heard nothing back yet. I saw a review that said to hang in and wait for 24 hours because he had similar issues. After 24 hours, he said his camera basically fixed itself and started working as promised. Well, this new camera's 24 hours is almost up and I have yet to see any improvements in service. Very annoying and makes me feel scammed.I really wanted to love this camera- especially since being able to get it at a great price. At the start, activations were not always good- sometimes the camera would send recorded clips that showed nothing in frame that would have activated it, or would not be activated at all when people were standing right in front of the camera. Once we had to pay for the subscription service, quality plummeted. I tried everything I could find online- google, reddit, blink's help hub to no avail. I tried facing the camera inside and would walk around in front of it and it was only a 50/50 chance that it would pick up even that movement. I tried all kinds of lighting conditions, placements, and suggestions that I found and thought of before finally contacting customer support. After about a bajillion activations during the time period I gave them access to my camera, they said everything looked fine. They also said that my account showed numerous activations so that it seemed as though the camera was constantly recording-  all during the time period in which they were in the account! Had they viewed the previous months, they would have seen that this was not the issue I was asking for help with and explaining over and over. At the end of a few days and numerous emails and no fixes or workable solutions or suggestions, they blew me off and sent me a CS satisfaction survey. So in all, since they've already gotten their money, they would no longer help me. I complied with/tried everything they said, am technically savvy, and now am just mad that I lost money on a shoddy camera and very shoddy subscription service.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2021

Review Text: Great budget security!  I originally bought this because I was going on vacation and wanted to check in on my two cats to make sure they still had food and nothing got knocked over. It’s fantastic! Video is great.Video is great (it does show in 30 sec. snippets, so it’s good to check in on, but the motion detection helps if you want to check in when something is actually happening) the night vision is great. the microphone and built in speaker is pretty decent, and the hardware it comes with is good if you need a special angle. Overall for 35$ It’s a steal.Would recommend if needed for something small or something to check when the kids get home, or something that isn’t necessary for a legit security system. Review Title: No records without notifications to your phone
Review Text: This camera is useless. I have two cameras connected and it was difficult for me to understand that what I really wanted to do, the software does not allow it. I should have called tech support because the two things I was trying to do is the least a person looks for when buying a camera:1) notifications: If you want the camera to record movements to be able to review later, you must allow notifications to your phone. That means that every time there is a movement your phone will ring. If you turn off the notifications, the camera stops recording.  You can block notifications for the entire application (in the settings of your phone), but you will not be able to leave any camera (if you have more than one) with notifications2) Live view: If you want to watch live, it only allows you to do it for a few seconds. There is no way to set to watch live for more than a few seconds.The answer of the support team is that it is a surveillance camera (I did not understand what difference that from an Eufy or other cameras that are better configurable)

Review Title: Small in size, big in performance.
Review Text: I have been a user of Blink products for just over a year. When I saw this on sale I decided to give it a try as our dedicated in house camera. I was really impressed with how easy it was to set up with our existing Blink ecosystem. I plugged it in and a couple of scans later it was working like i'd had it for years.I currently have it sitting on a counter to cover the area I wanted covered. However, it has the option to be mounted on a wall as well which when I move to my next house will be very handy. Amazing product and at a great value.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020

Review Text: I bought these cameras to replace a mix of Yi and Wyze cams that we used as monitors for our small children. I figured it would be nice to standardize on one system and thought Amazon does things well so I went for it. Turns out, these are terrible as monitors. The audio constantly plays a white noise sound as if we have the kids’ sound machines on. The night vision is not very good. The video also times out after about 30 seconds so you can’t leave the app open to just watch whatever you’re pointing your camera at (e.g. checking to see when your napping child wakes up). Also, with Yi and Wyze I could insert a micro SD card to enable local storage and view playback— not an option with Blink. They’ve got a lot to learn. I’ve returned the Blink cams and gone back to my old ways.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020

Review Title: Bought and returned in the same day
Review Text: I miss the Amazon cloud cam. It was a quality camera and you didn’t need a subscription in order to have temporary recordings. This camera has excellent picture quality, but only records if you have a subscription which in my opinion is too expensive. The advertising is slightly misleading and this camera does not work with the Amazon cloud cam app. Since you cannot purchase the Amazon cloud cam anymore, I went with Geeni cam instead which lets you record on an SD card. Camera quality isn’t as good but it does the job.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2021

Review Text: The camera misses huge blocks of time where there is plenty of motion but doesn't record anything. When viewing live there is a pretty significant lag and it almost always just stops recording before the time is up for live view and sometimes the live view doesn't work, rendering the live view useless. This camera has taken awhile for me to gain enough experience with it to realize it is not useful for security at all since you have to learn, over time, just how much it really misses. It starts recording when someone pulls up but stops before you can catch them doing anything. Useless for security, not worth the money.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2021

Review Title: A nice addition to Alexa system
Review Text: Have been using this for about 3 weeks.  It’s very effective and the interaction it provides when live recording works pretty well.  I’m still fussing with the motion detection aspect.  It sometimes won’t pick up things fast enough and then other times I get video of what seems to be nothing.Overall it was worth adding to the Echo Show 5 that I got it bundled with.  Will probably add a few others over time to cover other areas on my house.  Maybe even add some exterior models if they comes down in price.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2021

Review Text: I bought this to monitor my seizures, because I live alone. But 2 days later, the camera started going offline and I have to reset it every time(less than an hour). I have a 1 gigabyte internet that has not lost power once. And the camera hasn’t lost power,(since it has no batteries), and nothing is working.I would want a replacement or refund at this point.Note: Look at other camera companies reviews before considering this company. “You get what you pay for.” And that $26 did just that.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2021

Review Text: I was excited to get 2 indoor cameras for Christmas from my husband. I put one in our living room (to be able to see the dog when we’re not home) and one at the front door. It’s okay in the sense that you can use the app, see what’s happening live with just a slight couple second delay and even talk through them. My issue is, I also bought the echo at the same point to hook them up to it. It wouldn’t work and said it wasn’t supported. I then try to set the sensitive to give me motion alerts when someone approaches the front door. If the sensitivity isn’t at its max, it doesn’t alert me to anything. And if it is at its max, it detects nothing but I’ve had people walk up my front steps to deliver packages, food, etc. and I get no notifications. It’s nice to see sometimes when I want to check in and make sure all is well and it definitely added peace of mind when we were gone for a week. I just wish the Blink performed the way I hoped. If it wasn’t too late, I’d probably return and look at a different camera set.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021

Review Title: Blink Mini can NOT peer through glass at night...
Review Text: "We bought two Blink Minis for monitoring the front and rear verandas, placing both minis on the inside window ledges.  BOTH cameras work as described---during daylight hours.  Unfortnately, these Blink minis are NOT able to peer through the window glass, when night falls, only reflecting back images of these minis themselves.  There were several previous Blink Mini reviews that reported this exact issue.  Needless to say, we're disappointed, since we really needed a '24-hour' monitoring system for these two areas..."

Review Title: Good value add on camera, but using indoors for outdoor monitoring
Review Text: I am using this camera to view a wide area in the front yard through an upper window, therefore the picture quality, motion detection and night vision capabilities are diminished, but manageable by playing with the camera settings.  However, this is a much cheaper solution than adding another battery operated Outdoor camera, plus it is always on with no battery replacement issues and is indoors so not susceptible to theft like the Outdoor cameras. If used to monitor an indoor area it would get a 5 star rating.

Review Title: Not a bad camera for the price

There is no option to save to a memory card or anything else. I should have researched it a little better and that is on me.That said the picture quality was pretty good, I didn't care for the fisheye appearance but it did have a very clear picture. The motion detection was awesome! I didn't keep it long enough to test the night vision. If you already pay a subscription for a cloud service this is an excellent little camera!

Review Text: Este producto me vino de regalo con la Alexa 5, lo he probado, es muy bueno, me encanta que fue fácil de instalar, le puedo hablar a mis perros y dar seguimiento a todo lo que ocurre en casa, la calidad de la imagen y sonido excelente

Review Text: I like everything about this Blink mini camera.  Good resolution, very easy to set up (you do need a smart phone), easy to use and adjust, and the power cord is more than long enough to find an outlet. I am still pushing for Blink to offer a smoke detector with their system. I'd love to have that capability to add on to the system.  But with or without it, Blink is a great home monitoring system and is incredibly inexpensive compared to what else is out there.

However, once I became reacquainted with hooking cameras up, it was a breeze.  Note there is a tiny stamped code in the very back of the camera that you will need to sinc up with or type it into the app.  I do note that when I posted my issue, the manufacturer was reaching out to me right away, but I didn't need help after all.  I love the little camera as I have pets and I like to know what they're up to when I'm not home.  Very happy to receive two cameras at such a very reasonable price and it works great!!!

Review Text: There is an option to turn off the LED light but then there is a red light for when it is recording and an additional light when it senses motion.  We wanted to be able to peek in on our kids without them noticing but there is absolutely NO WAY.  In addition to these lights there is an very audible click on and off.  I am disappointed in this camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020

Review Title: Software locks you out of most features unless you pay for a monthly sub.
Review Text: This product is probably par for most small home security cameras. Video quality is fine same with night vision. Sound quality is as expected with a device that is this size.Where it fails is the developer has decided to lock most of the features behind a pay wall. If not currently subscribed to their premium service, you will get motion notices which only say at this date and time there was motion with no screen shot, and you can view live video, but you can not save watched video to your device.I don’t need to have every event recorded and saved to their cloud, but if I’m logged in to the camera and need to record an event that is happening live in the moment, the software locks you out until you subscribe to their premium service.Save your money and go with a camera with software that will allow you to record live video to your device.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2022

Review Title: Motion detection is questionable, at best
Review Text: Running two of these I was surprised to see what it picked up well (panel trucks, no problem!) but people -- not so good on those.  I went through a variety of settings in the app (which had its own problems) and could not find a sweet spot that would allow for detection of people.This morning an Amazon delivery was made and the camera -- pointing right at the walkway and entry -- didn't pick up a thing.  Not the van, nor the delivery person. Nothing.I tested a variety of light conditions, various IR settings, sensitivity, positions, all to no avail.  Sure it picked up the occasional motion, but if it can't reliably notice a human in motion inside of 20 feet, then back to Amazon these go. Disappointing, even if the customer service was responsive.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2020

Review Title: Let it be gone in a blink
Review Text: We have been using the Wyze cameras and saw this on a treasure truck deal. To start off, it’s relatively easy to get it up and going, however the user interface is terrible in comparison to other apps I’ve used. The camera itself is nice and compact but lacks the quality I’m used to with the Wyze cameras. It’s so difficult to navigate and figure out how to use these, I’m surprised so many people use them. I guess it’ll get the job done if you’re looking for something but IMO, this blink system is not what I expected out of and Amazon product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2021

Review Text: I have this in my garage.  I can walk through the garage and motion is not triggered.  Today, I opened the garage door, moved several items outside, and closed the garage door.  No motion was detected.  A bug flew by the camera and motions WAS detected.  It's useless if the motion detection is not consistent.  I'll try to return this, and get one of the larger cameras, which seem to correctly detect motion.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021

Review Text: Quality of the camera is great.  There’s one major flaw.  The “Live View” only lasts 30 seconds before you have to hit the continue button (and again every 30 secs after that).  The total time will only last 5 minutes before you have to start a new “Live View”.  If this could be configurable to remove the time out, I’d give this product 5 stars and recommend to everyone.  I opened a support ticket with marketing to see if this was on the product roadmap and was told:“I am unable to discuss our product roadmap however I would be happy to bring the suggestion for continuous live viewing to the team for consideration.”Hopefully they make this update since it’s the only major flaw with the product, but we’ll see.  If this is a non issue for you, then the quality of the cameras is great.  That’s my only complaint.

Review Text: If you just need a camera to watch a room sporadically, say for instance if you want to watch your dog at home, then this is fine. If you’re looking for something to function as a security system, go elsewhere. My motion detection experience is mediocre at best. My camera facing my front yard will regularly not be activated by my mail being delivered to my front porch, or even today when I left my home for a run and didn’t activate the motion sensor coming or going, but if there’s a breeze the shadow of the trees moving will definitely get recorded. My neighbors leaving home every morning at 5:48? Definitely gonna get recorded. Me, mowing my grass in my front yard? It’s like it never even happened. The free trial for the blink cloud was nice but I’m not interested in paying for recording of everything except what I need recorded.

Review Text: About three weeks ago Blink must have performed some kind of update because none of my cams work now (3 cams).  they reached out to me several times asking for permission to work on Cams which i gave permission within hours then they proceeded to email me again asking for permission which i reviewed and gave  permission was on so they could look. Review Text: I received the Blink Mini as a bundle with an Echo Show 5 for Christmas. My intention was to use it as a monitor for my 4 year old son. The picture quality is great! The Alexa integration also works pretty well. However, I quickly discovered as many people have, that they w is no option to continuously view the camera. It has not even occurred to me that this would not be an option, since it has a constant power source. Also, the camera makes an audible clicking sound when it begins recording & has a red IR light on the front that also turns on. You apparently can not turn this light off, even though there is an option to do so within the app. Toggling the light off in the app does nothing. My son became immediately aware of both of these factors & the result is that he was petrified to move the rest of the night. I didn’t realize this until the next morning, because the motion sensor is also pretty unreliable. My son got out of bed & left his room without seeing it off. It may be acceptable as a monitor for a small child, but certainly not an infant & without a continuous view option, you must rely on a hit or miss motion detector. I am now trying to find a place to repurpose the camera. Overall, it is a decent camera, but there are some significant flaws.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2021

Review Title: Peace of mind for the right price!
Review Text: This little camera packs a big punch. I love how easy it was to set up. It is corded but the usb cord that it came with is fairly long and you can always purchase longer ones. You can keep it on the stand and angle it how you want or take it off the stand and angle it how you want. The picture quality is good for day and night vision. I haven't tried to use it to view out of a window so I can't comment on that. Being able to check on my animals and my home while I'm at work or away is such a great feeling and the price is just right! The motion detection notifications and live feed are free or you can pay just $3 a month for unlimited cloud storage. I highly recommend this device as well as checking out their other cameras, as there are wireless and outdoor options. I love this little but mighty camera!

Review Text: Got the Mini on Prime Day and I am so happy I did. I have the Blink Outdoor on my front porch and now I have the Mini facing my back patio door. This is great for watching your pets during the day or children. This is a cheap addition to our home security that works just as well as expensive models. I am loyal to Blink and glad I choose this company for my home security needs. If you are looking for mid grade cameras to watch your home, this is for you! It is very sensitive but can be adjusted.

You can troubleshoot and get them back online, but that doesn't do any good if you are away from home and want to view your house...they are down until you get home…remote viewing is the main reason I got this product…unplugging, plugging back in…wait for the lights…try again (also, reset button didn’t work for me)…I may in the future try the next step up in the price range in the same brand…reviews report less problems in that area…you get what you pay for. Review Title: Good indoor camera for the price
Review Text: I bought these to replace a couple of other WIFI cameras that were beginning to fail. The setup is quick and easy. I especially like the motion alert zones configuration which allows a lot of flexibility in areas to detect and report motion as well as the sensitivity. One con, and not a huge one, is that there is no local storage, everything is cloud-based and requires a re-occurring fee after 1 year from purchase. The renewal fees are not much, hence being a rather small "con". Another missing feature, one that I had gotten used to with my previous cameras, was the ability to "slide and select" motion events and go to specific times within those events. That's not a con, per se, just a difference in from one app to the next. That could possibly be added in subsequent revisions of the software if the developers so chose to implement. Aside from that these cameras also integrate well with our Amazon Echo Show 5.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2020

Review Title: Choose a different Camera, EzViz w/SD card
Review Text: Constant connection issues. I bought it because it was meant to be compatible with Alexa devices, but there is almost no integration or controls in the Alexa app. There is no playback option unless you leave it armed all of the time, and if leave it armed all of the time you'll get a notification every time you walk by. It is good if you want to arm it every time you leave the house and disarm it every time you return. I would recommend an EzViz camera. It's smaller, cheaper, has better image quality, a better design, and you can put a micro SD card in it and look at video playback from any time over the last 30 days, when there was motion. You can arm it to set notifications or just have it always passively recording. There is no Alexa integration that I know of, but it's still a much better camera for a cheaper price.

Have had no issues with sound quality and the two way speaker works.  It's small and easy to move. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase.

Review Title: Don't buy, excellent camera, but app live view runs 30 seconds only
Review Text: Ok, shame on me asI don't usually write reviews, but I won't buy anything with reading everyone else's. I kno, selfish... But today, I'm redeeming myself. The camera itself is great, excellent quality, night vision, audio & motion detection. But don't buy this camera unless you're ok with having to push "continue" every 30 seconds to keep live view open.It's an app feature limitation, 1st set up bc the camera was battery operated and got too hot. New ones are AC powered, and this feature request is all over the Web and blink forums for years.Here on amazon it's packaged with Echo Show for cheap and NONE of the many reviews I read her mentioned it at all. According to reviews everywhere else but here, it's not an ideal baby monitor for this reason, but the price draws parents in since camara's titled "baby monitors" are 3-4x as much. But unless you want to press continue every 30 seconds for the hour your baby naps, while trying to get out emails or be on meetings, I recommend spending a few more dollars and go with a couple other options. The forum suggests the "Xpi" or named similar. That one is confirmed to all changing the connection duration. Good luck.

Review Title: Needs Above Average WiFi, Motion Detection is Random
Review Text: I purchased the camera because of a break-in at my mother's apartment, and it will not work to deter another invasion. I have an average WiFi setup (Xfinity), about 15 ft from the camera. The camera will record for about 6-9 seconds and then drop out, probably because of the WiFi signal. The camera is pointed at a door, and will record when the door is opened from outside, but not when opened from inside. It will also begin recording for most moving shadows near the closed door, but not when someone walks by the camera to the door. Finding information on the Blink web site is a challenge, and I get emails from Amazon about features of the camera that I would like (such as setting a window of time that the camera is active), but the link to describe the feature isn't accurate, and the search command of the Blink web site doesn't work.

Review Text: Picture is clear and the motion sensors work quickly. I set up my blink account fairly easy. I even set up my blink camera to work with my echo show 5. Now when I hear a bump in the night I can see outside of my room to know that all is good. You can arm or disarm from your cellphone and clips of the footage recorded on sent by notification. Know immediately if an intruder is in your house. You can even use the talk button to yell at them. Loved it so much I bought 2.

Review Title: PERFECT Cameras for what I wanted!!

The set up was super easy - and I am usually technologically challenged.  The picture is good - both light and dark.  The video records for a few seconds once the motion sensor is triggered.In other news... I've discovered my teenager talks to himself when he thinks no one is home.  Bahahaha

Review Text: Definitely worth the $$ if you are going to be paying for a subscription afterwords. They did give me an almost 1 year free trial. That was really cool. Blink/ Amazon needs to improve this about their product.

Review Text: We got this to protect our campsite while exploring, hiking, biking, boating, and etc. we have a nice camp setup with chairs, tables, screen rooms and kitchen that needed some protection while we’re away. While it may not keep our stuff from theft, we will know and can speak through the camera and scare off the would be thief. Or at least there is evidence even if they break into the rv and steal the camera.It is small and takes up little space. We love it.

Review Text: I recently bought a new house that I installed the blink camera system at. Then came a puppy, that needed to be watched when we weren’t home. The system and this particular camera are a hit. Easy to use, quick setup, the app works to perfection too. A great peace of mind item and gift!

Review Text: The app is very user friendly.  Easy to set zones and set motion alarm.  Unfortunately the alert takes a few seconds to get sent and I find it misses the first motion.  I use it outside my toddlers bedroom to alert us if they get up in the middle of the night and i often see that it alerts me when I am putting them back into bed instead of when they opened the door (zone is the door and in front of the door).Good - picture looks great.  Clips saved easily and able to save on my device.Bad - The night vision clicks on and off and so I cannot use it inside my children’s room as it is loud enough it alerts them to when I am peeking in on them.  Had to move it out of their room.Overall - good camera for the money for the right reason.  Still trying to find a better camera setup.

Review Title: Love this to watch my puppy!
Review Text: This is a great product. I had trouble at first connecting to the wifi. I believe it needs to be a 2.4ghz wifi connection for it to connect with. If you have multiple routers ensure the connection you're using is the one that is 2.4ghx. It didn't work with my wifi extended router, I had to connect to my provider's internet router to fix connectivity issue. Super easy set up if you can get past the wifi connection part.Great sound, and video quality. You can talk through the app and sound will come through camera. I have not tried the night mode yet but day quality is great.

Review Text: We put it in the room our very young puppy naps in so we can help with house training. The motion sensor is great because he doesn’t bark or whine for us, and there’s no accidents because we can see when he’s up and we’re able to let him out. So it’s also helping with crate training.

Review Text: So far this seems to be a pretty good camera, for a great price.  Its awkward needing to plug it in, which makes where you an put it a bit of a problem, however the quality seems good. We are mainly using it to look in on pets, which we are continuing to try different locations, and angles.  Night vision is better than expected, but difficult to see too much detail for the four legged furball. The app is very simple, but I'm should do alot more.  I really displeased that it will not link up with my ring system, since they are both amazon companies.  So many other items will link to ring.  They really need to get that figured out, then it would be a homerun.

Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020

Review Title: Cool concept, but not a recommended purchase unless you can get a good deal on one.
Review Text: I bought this camera to keep tabs on my kids while I'm at work.  I like the fact that it is a stand-alone device on my home network and doesn't require a PC to connect through.  Unboxing and set-up was easy and only required that I set up an account to get started.  It's a nicely designed and sturdy device.Things that I don't like about this device:- You can't access saved videos unless you subscribe for the service and pay $$$.- There is NO WEB INTERFACE -  You have to use a phone app to view your feed, or use an android emulator on your remote PC.  There is an op-source project to develop one, but the Blink development team has no current plans to create one - they are a small team and are currently working on new features for the phone app instead.- The feed keeps dropping/stuttering or failing to connect ALL THE TIME!!!  I have 500 MBps Internet - the drops are on Blink's/Amazon's servers.- Even if you happen to get a stable/good connection, the app asks you if you want to remain connected every 30 seconds - annoying as hell!I am happy enough with the device that I won't be returning it only because I got a good deal on it.  I would never pay full price for this camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2021

Review Text: I had heard Blink camera were good and this one fit my budget. I even called support (which was not useful as the person helping was getting annoyed with me and I was obviously a nuisance to him).  So I returned the item for another one to see if it will work any better.  Round 2 here we come !!!!

Review Text: Blink is a great little camera! It’s perfect to jump in for live views or to communicate really quick. However, it only has 10 seconds of motion recording which won’t work for certain areas of home or office.For example, blink camera sucks as the camera for your garage My Q system. It doesn’t integrate with My Q so it can not be controlled when you are in My Q app. It works well with Alexa, but you can’t view it on Ring. So it will work for Key and it has a motion sensor when your garage door opens, but it won’t record continuously. You only get 10 seconds of motion. So you can see your garage go up and feet or ankles and when it comes down, but you would have to actually go to live view to see what’s happening, if you can catch it (Amazon delivery must be trained by elves or Santa himself because they are quick).  I don’t know about you, but I want everything recorded if someone is coming in my garage to leave a package. I might not have time to pull over in traffic or interrupt a meeting to go to a live view.So I moved that camera to my office, because it sucks to have not all cameras in one app.  But for the price or as a baby monitor or kids room; if is great!

I would not recommend this item, you’re better off spending a little bit more money to buy something else.

Review Text: I purchased this camera for my living room. Up until now I have always used google nest so I was hoping this would be a decent replacement and I would buy more for other rooms. The camera quality isn’t bad. I was actually impressed for a $35 camera. The app is awful and likely going to be the reason I return this. It is not user friendly. There are too many settings for the camera that most people probably don’t know what all the options mean. When you open the app it shows a blank box where you can add a picture. It should show the live stream there. Why would I want a stale picture of the room? The only way to get video playback to my knowledge, is when you have the camera armed. But then you get notifications for every moment which is unnecessary. Overall if you have never used an indoor camera and you want something basic to check in while your away, maybe this would work for you. Hopefully Blink revamps the app soon since that is a trending con.

Review Title: Not ready. I can't imagine they actually have tested this thing.
Review Text: Where to start? 1) Motion detection triggers when it changes itself from day to night or night to day. 2) Gets stuck in night mode in the middle of the day, with a completely washed out BW picture. 3) Triggers when a moth is attracted to the night (IR) illuminator. 4) Yet, completely misses humans placing packages into view. FW version 9.75, default sensitivity (5).  5) App shows blank home screen when returning from "clips" view. It's like they have kids writing the software, and they don't bother testing it. Having worked as an Amazon engineer, it's what I should have expected.

Review Text: Im a college student and renting a house with 5 other girls. Yeah bad idea I know this now.. There had been many times where things where being stolen or missing and I was getting tired of it becuase i knew it was my roomaes doing these things. Review Title: Better than the XT in some ways
Review Text: Picture seem clearer, the ability to plug this into any USB power source is awesome!  I use it to monitor my studio computer when rendering huge video files so I can see when they're complete without going up and down the stairs. It's also great to add video monitoring to my garage when we're on vacation and to setup and monitor a babysitter when I'm gone and working. The USB option is great. Haven't used anything but the Blink app with this camera, but I understand there's a new paid service (which I have zero interest in). The two way audio is a nice feature, but I don't know that I'll be using it. This COULD be used as a baby monitor! The signal is much more reliable than some other cams.

I wish they would have put a better knuckle on it so it articulated better so that I could mount it on a wall that protrudes into a room - which would give me a better view of the room while being more discreet.All in all - I recommend this product.

Review Title: Great product for a great price
Review Text: The camera is amazing for the price that it has. The night vision is great, the motion detection is also very accurate. The app should have some more functionality heeded towards this specific product as it mainly focuses on the other cameras from the same brand.Two cons are that you need to select continue viewing every 30 seconds if attempting to watch a live video. The other issue is that the camera makes this EXTREMELY LOUD shutter sound when you go to access the app. I live in a two story house and bought this to watch my dog downstairs and there are times when I switch between the live view and the previous recordings I can literally hear the shutter from the second floor when the camera is downstairs. It’s bad to the point in which my dog has woken up a few times and that’s really a bummer. I’ve tried checking in on him and in doing so I wake him up because accessing the app causes the loud noise on the actual camera that’s downstairs.Aside from these two things, really great camera with a great price point

Review Text: These are great little indoor cameras. The motion detection is ok but it does miss things. Picture quality is pretty good for things close up to the camera but as you get further away the picture starts to degrade. It's good for small and average sized rooms. The Blink app still sucks and unfortunately these cameras use that app. Overall they work good and do what they're designed to do and that is to pick up motion. They're not baby monitors so don't go buying these thinking that they will constantly stream video to your tablet while you sleep.

Review Title: You have to pay for a subscription to use!!!
Review Text: Honestly, We loved the Blink camera when we first purchased it. The storage was really confusing because it sounded as if you only had a small amount to use and if it exceeded the limit it would start recording over the saved video clips. That actually was fine for us and we enjoyed using it until the free trial ran out. Now it will notify us of movement but NOT record anything! The plan now requires a subscription of 3.00 a month per camera OR 10.00 a month for unlimited cameras. Well.... we only have 2 cameras and they are not worth paying 6.00 a month just to video a 10 sec. clip!!!!! Sadly, I was so happy with them I was telling everyone about them and even purchased 2 for my elderly parents!!!! Thankfully, we live in a pretty safe neighborhood so we just used them for an added sense of security (and to spy on out parrot when we are at work). Lesson learned.... if it seems to good to be true it probably is!!!!!!

Review Title: Great for general security camera, NOT good as a baby monitor
Review Text: Great night vision, good picture quality for the price. App is secure and easy to use. Easy to connect with Alexa. It will shut off automatically. I talked to customer service and they say that it's programmed into all of their blink cameras so as to not run out the batteries. But the blink mini is corded and plugged into the wall...so no batteries to drain 😂 an unfortunate oversight. We needed a baby monitor but this does not work for that purpose, so I had to return. Review Title: Didn't expect to hear it, but everything else is great
Review Text: The cameras were extremely easy to install, clear picture in light and night modes, but would be so much better with longer cords or rechargeable / replaceable batteries. The short length of the cord extremely limited placement without running an extension cord. Using the app to load a new camera was extremely easy as well, I had four cameras installed and functioning on the app in less than an hour. The clarity of the pictures in the listing are what you actually get, but there is also some steady background noise in the live view. When the cameras are activated there is a noticeably audible click when recording starts and when the lights turn off and it switches to night mode. In the common areas of your house this shouldn't be an issue. If you have pets in your bedroom at night, though, it could be constantly clicking going on and off during the night unless you shut the camera off, which defeats the security purpose.
